original: 'dus byas 'bral bcas 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas 'bral bcas 'bras bu'o //
translated: The conditioned is the effect of separation.

original: 'di gang las she na /
analyzed: 'di gang las she na /
translated: From what is it the effect?🔽The treatise declares:

original: bstan bcos las 'bras bu'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: bstan bcos las 'bras bu'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the phenomena that are effects?

original: 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad dang / so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad dang / so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: All conditioned phenomena and analytical cessation.

original: de lta na yang 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu de gang gi yin pa 'dus ma byas la rgyur yang 'gyur la rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir rgyu de gang gi yin pa 'bras bur yang 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu de gang gi yin pa 'dus ma byas la rgyur yang 'gyur la rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir rgyu de gang gi yin pa 'bras bur yang 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if it is an effect, then unconditioned should be a cause, since it is the cause of that effect. And if it is a cause, then unconditioned should be an effect, since it is the cause of that effect.

original: 'dus byas kyi chos 'ba' zhig la rgyu dang 'bras bu dag tu 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos 'ba' zhig la rgyu dang 'bras bu dag tu 'gyur gyi /
translated: Only conditioned phenomena are causes and effects.

original: 'dus ma byas la de dag min //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas la de dag min //
translated: Unconditioned phenomena are not.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: rgyu drug tu mi srid pa'i phyir ba dang / 'bras bu lnga mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu drug tu mi srid pa'i phyir ba dang / 'bras bu lnga mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible for them to be the six causes and it is impossible for them to be the five effects.

original: yang 'bras bu 'di rnams las rgyu gang gi 'bras bu gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: yang 'bras bu 'di rnams las rgyu gang gi 'bras bu gang zhig ce na /
translated: What are the effects of which causes?

original: rnam smin 'bras bu tha ma'i yin //
analyzed: rnam smin 'bras bu tha ma'i yin //
translated: The maturational effect is the final effect.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni tha mar 'don pa'i phyir tha ma ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni tha mar 'don pa'i phyir tha ma ste /
translated: The cause of karmic maturation is the last because it is mentioned last.

original: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni de'i 'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni de'i 'o //
translated: Its result is the result of karmic maturation.

original: bdag po'i 'bras bu dang po yin //
analyzed: bdag po'i 'bras bu dang po yin //
translated: The first is the dominant result.

original: rgyu mthun skal mnyam kun 'gro yin //
analyzed: rgyu mthun skal mnyam kun 'gro yin //
translated: The result of natural outflow is homogeneous and omnipresent causes.

original: 'di gnyis dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: 'di gnyis dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: These two are results that are similar to their causes, because they are results that are similar to their causes.

original: skyes bu pa ni gnyis kyi yin //
analyzed: skyes bu pa ni gnyis kyi yin //
translated: The result of conscious effort is the two.

original: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu'i 'o //
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu'i 'o //
translated: The result of conscious effort is the result of coemergent causes and concomitant causes.

original: skyes bu'i ngo bo las tha mi dad pa'i phyir skyes bu'i byed pa ni //
analyzed: skyes bu'i ngo bo las tha mi dad pa'i phyir skyes bu'i byed pa ni //
translated: Because it is not different from the nature of a person, the conscious effort of a person is a person.

original: skyes bu nyid yin la de'i 'bras bu ni skyes bu pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu nyid yin la de'i 'bras bu ni skyes bu pa'o //
translated: Its result is the result of conscious effort.

original: skyes bu'i byed pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: skyes bu'i byed pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is this called the conscious effort of a person?

original: chos gang gi byed pa gang yin pa skyes bu'i byed pa lta bu'i ni skyes bu'i byed pa ste /
analyzed: chos gang gi byed pa gang yin pa skyes bu'i byed pa lta bu'i ni skyes bu'i byed pa ste /
translated: The conscious effort of a person is the conscious effort of a person that is like the conscious effort of any phenomenon.

original: dper na sman bya rog rkang zhes bya ba dang / mi @127a * //
analyzed: dper na sman bya rog rkang zhes bya ba dang / mi @127a * //
translated: For example, it is like the medicine called crow's foot and the medicine called human flesh.

original: glang po smyos pa zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: glang po smyos pa zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: like an elephant gone mad.🔽What is the ripened result?🔽up to the dominant result?

original: yang rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu nas bdag po'i 'bras bu zhes pa'i bar 'di dag ci zhig ce na /🔽rnam smin lung du ma bstan chos //
analyzed: yang rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu nas bdag po'i 'bras bu zhes pa'i bar 'di dag ci zhig ce na / rnam smin lung du ma bstan chos //
translated: The ripened result is a neutral factor.🔽The ripened result is a factor that is non-defined, i.e., morally neutral, for only a morally neutral factor can be the ripened result.

original: rnam par smin pa ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i chos so //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i chos so //
translated: The ripened result is not a factor that is wholesome or unwholesome, for a wholesome or unwholesome factor is, respectively, a counteragent or a counteragent.

original: sems can ma yin par ston pa yang yod pas /🔽de'i phyir smras pa /🔽sems can zhes bya /
analyzed: sems can ma yin par ston pa yang yod pas / de'i phyir smras pa / sems can zhes bya /
translated: The ripened result is not a factor that is related to the realms of existence, for the realms of existence are wholesome or unwholesome.🔽The ripened result is not a factor that is related to the realm of desire, for the realm of desire contains wholesome and unwholesome factors.🔽The ripened result is not a factor that is related to the realm of fine-materiality, for the realm of fine-materiality contains only wholesome factors.

original: rgyas pa las byung ba dang / rgyu mthun pa las byung ba yang yod pas /🔽de'i phyir smras pa /🔽lung bstan byung /
analyzed: rgyas pa las byung ba dang / rgyu mthun pa las byung ba yang yod pas / de'i phyir smras pa / lung bstan byung /
translated: The ripened result is not a factor that is related to the realm of immateriality, for the realm of immateriality contains only morally non-defined factors.🔽The ripened result is not a factor that is related to the realm of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, for this realm contains only morally non-defined factors.🔽The ripened result is not a factor that is related to the realm of non-percipient beings, for this realm contains only morally non-defined factors.🔽The ripened result is not a factor that is related to the realm of the pure abodes, for this realm contains only wholesome factors.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las ni rnam par smin pa'i phyir lung bstan pas lung bstan pa'o //🔽gang zhig de las dus phyi ma la 'byung zhing de ma thag tu ma yin pa de ni rnam par smin pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las ni rnam par smin pa'i phyir lung bstan pas lung bstan pa'o // gang zhig de las dus phyi ma la 'byung zhing de ma thag tu ma yin pa de ni rnam par smin pa ste /
translated: The ripened result is not a factor that is related to the realm of the stream-enterers, etc., for this realm contains only wholesome factors.

original: 'di ni rnam par smin pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par smin pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The ripened result is not a factor that is related to the realm of the perfected beings, for this realm contains only morally non-defined factors.🔽The ripened result is not a factor that is related to the realm of the pratyekabuddhas, for this realm contains only wholesome factors.🔽The ripened result is not a factor that is related to the realm of the Buddhas, for this realm contains only morally non-defined factors.

original: rgyu mthun rgyu dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu mthun rgyu dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: The ripened result is not a factor that is related to the realm of the bodhisattvas, for this realm contains only wholesome factors.🔽The ripened result is not a factor that is related to the realm of the bodhisattvas, for this realm contains only wholesome factors.

original: rgyu dang 'dra ba'i chos gang yin pa de ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ste 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'dra ba'i chos gang yin pa de ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ste 'di lta ste /
translated: The effect resembling its cause is the effect of equal outflow.

original: skal ba mnyam pa dang kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa dang kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: It is the homogeneous cause and the pervasive cause.

original: bral ba blo yis zad byas pa //🔽blo ni shes rab po ;
analyzed: bral ba blo yis zad byas pa // blo ni shes rab po ;
translated: The effect of disconnection is the cessation due to deliberation.

original: / zad pa ni 'gog pa ste /🔽de na so sor brtags te 'gog pa ni bral ba'i 'bras bu zhes bya'o //🔽gang gi stobs kyis skye ba gang //
analyzed: / zad pa ni 'gog pa ste / de na so sor brtags te 'gog pa ni bral ba'i 'bras bu zhes bya'o // gang gi stobs kyis skye ba gang //
translated: The effect of disconnection is the cessation due to deliberation.🔽The effect of human action is the effect of the dominant.

original: 'bras de skyes bu byed las skyes //
analyzed: 'bras de skyes bu byed las skyes //
translated: The effect of human action is the effect of the dominant.🔽For example, the concentration of a higher stage is the effect of the human action of the thought of application of a lower stage.

original: dper na sa 'og ma pa'i sbyor ba'i sems kyis ni sa gong ma pa'i ting nge 'dzin no //
analyzed: dper na sa 'og ma pa'i sbyor ba'i sems kyis ni sa gong ma pa'i ting nge 'dzin no //
translated: The thought of emanation is the effect of the human action of the thought of absorption.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa ni zag pa med pa'o //🔽bsam gtan gyi sems kyis ni sprul pa'i sems so zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //🔽sngon byung ma yin 'dus byas kyi //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa ni zag pa med pa'o // bsam gtan gyi sems kyis ni sprul pa'i sems so zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o // sngon byung ma yin 'dus byas kyi //
translated: The effect of the dominant is the effect of the human action.🔽The effect of the dominant is the effect of the human action.🔽The effect of the dominant is the effect of the human action.🔽The effect of the dominant is the effect of the human action.🔽The effect of the dominant is the effect of the human action.🔽The effect of the dominant is the effect of the human action.🔽The effect of the dominant is the effect of the human action.🔽The effect of the dominant is the effect of the human action.🔽The effect of the dominant is the effect of the human action.🔽The effect of the dominant is the effect of the human action.🔽The effect of the dominant is the effect of the human action.🔽The effect of the dominant is the effect of the human action.🔽The effect of the dominant is the effect of the human action.🔽The effect of the dominant is the effect of the human action.🔽The effect of the dominant is the effect of the human action.🔽The effect of the dominant is the effect of the human action.🔽The effect of the dominant is the effect of the human action.🔽The effect of the dominant is the effect of the human action.🔽The effect of the dominant is the effect of the human action.🔽The effect of the dominant is the effect of the human action.🔽The effect of the dominant is the effect of the human action.🔽The effect of the dominant is the effect of the human action.🔽The effect of the dominant is the effect of the human action.🔽The effect of the dominant is the effect of the human action.🔽The effect of the dominant is the effect of the human action.🔽The effect of the dominant is the effect of the human action.

original: 'dus byas bdag po'i 'bras bu yin //
analyzed: 'dus byas bdag po'i 'bras bu yin //
translated: The effect of the dominant is the effect of the human action.🔽The effect of the dominant is the effect of the human action

original: sngar byung ba las gzhan pa'i 'dus byas kyi chos ni 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad kyi bdag po'i 'bras bu'o//
analyzed: sngar byung ba las gzhan pa'i 'dus byas kyi chos ni 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad kyi bdag po'i 'bras bu'o//
translated: All conditioned factors are the dominant results of conditioned factors, with the exception of the factor itself which one considers, of the time period of this factor and of the pervasive factors.

original: yang rgyu 'di dag las rgyu gang zhig gang gi dus su 'bras bu 'dzin cing 'byin ce na /
analyzed: yang rgyu 'di dag las rgyu gang zhig gang gi dus su 'bras bu 'dzin cing 'byin ce na /
translated: In what time period is the effect held and produced by each of these causes?

original: lnga ni da lta'i dus bdag tu //🔽'bras bu 'dzin te /🔽yongs su bzung zin pa'i phyir 'das pa rnams kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: lnga ni da lta'i dus bdag tu // 'bras bu 'dzin te / yongs su bzung zin pa'i phyir 'das pa rnams kyang ma yin la /
translated: Five hold their effect in the present.🔽The five causes hold their effect when they are in the present.🔽The past causes do not hold their effect, because the effect has already been produced;

original: skyes bu byed pa med pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa med pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: the future causes do not hold their effect, because they do not yet have activity.

original: byed pa'i rgyu yang de ngang 'dra mod kyi de ni rnam par smin pa dang bcas par ma nges pas mi brjod do //
analyzed: byed pa'i rgyu yang de ngang 'dra mod kyi de ni rnam par smin pa dang bcas par ma nges pas mi brjod do //
translated: The efficient cause is also like that, but, as it does not necessarily have an effect, it is not mentioned.

original: gnyis 'byin to //
analyzed: gnyis 'byin to //
translated: Two produce their effect in the present and in the past.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu ni da lta'i dus su 'bras bu 'byin to //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu ni da lta'i dus su 'bras bu 'byin to //
translated: The co-existent cause and the associated cause produce their effect when they are in the present;

original: 'di gnyis ni 'bras bu 'dzin pa dang / 'byin pa dus mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni 'bras bu 'dzin pa dang / 'byin pa dus mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: these two causes hold and produce their effect at the same time.

original: gnyis ni 'das dang da ltar @127b las //
analyzed: gnyis ni 'das dang da ltar @127b las //
translated: Two produce their effect in the past and in the future.

original: 'bras bu 'byin te /🔽skal ba mnyam pa dang / kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'byin te / skal ba mnyam pa dang / kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: It gives forth its fruit.

original: gcig ni 'das las 'byin par 'gyur //
analyzed: gcig ni 'das las 'byin par 'gyur //
translated: The homogeneous cause and the pervasive cause give forth their fruit when they are in the present.🔽One gives forth its fruit when it is in the past.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni 'das pa nyid las 'bras bu 'byin te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni 'das pa nyid las 'bras bu 'byin te /
translated: The ripening cause gives forth its fruit when it is in the past.

original: 'di ltar lhan cig pa'am de ma thag tu rnam par smin pa ni med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar lhan cig pa'am de ma thag tu rnam par smin pa ni med do //
translated: In fact, the ripened effect never occurs either simultaneously with or immediately after the action.

original: rgyu rnams dang 'bras bu bshad zin to //
analyzed: rgyu rnams dang 'bras bu bshad zin to //
translated: We have explained the causes and their effects.

original: da ni chos gang zhig rgyu du zhig gis bskyed pa 'di brjod dgos so zhe na /
analyzed: da ni chos gang zhig rgyu du zhig gis bskyed pa 'di brjod dgos so zhe na /
translated: Now, we must examine the question of how many causes produce the various factors.

original: smas pa / mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: smas pa / mdor bsdu na /
translated: In brief,

original: chos ni rnam pa 'di bzhi ste /
analyzed: chos ni rnam pa 'di bzhi ste /
translated: there are four types of factors:🔽defiled, i.e., the defiled factors and the factors that arise with the defiled factors;

original: nyon mongs pa can dang / rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang / zag pa med pa'i dang po dang / de dag gi lhag ma rnams so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can dang / rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang / zag pa med pa'i dang po dang / de dag gi lhag ma rnams so //
translated: the effect of retribution, i.e., the factors that arise from the effect of retribution;🔽the first pure factor, i.e., the first pure thought;

original: lhag ma yang gang dag cig ce na /🔽rnam par smin pa las ma gtogs pa lung du ma bstan pa rnams dang / zag pa med pa'i dang po ma gtogs pa dge ba rnams so //
analyzed: lhag ma yang gang dag cig ce na /🔽rnam par smin pa las ma gtogs pa lung du ma bstan pa rnams dang / zag pa med pa'i dang po ma gtogs pa dge ba rnams so //
translated: the remaining factors, i.e., all other factors.

original: chos rnam pa bzhi po de dag ni /
analyzed: chos rnam pa bzhi po de dag ni /
translated: These four types of dharmas

original: nyon mongs can dang rnam smin skyes //
analyzed: nyon mongs can dang rnam smin skyes //
translated: are, respectively, afflicted, arisen from ripening,

original: lhag dang dang po 'phags rim bzhin //
analyzed: lhag dang dang po 'phags rim bzhin //
translated: the remainder, and the first, like the noble ones.🔽The remainder arise from the remaining causes,

original: rnam smin kun 'gro de gnyis dang // skal mnyam ma gtogs lhag las skye //
analyzed: rnam smin kun 'gro de gnyis dang // skal mnyam ma gtogs lhag las skye //
translated: except for the ripening cause and the universal cause.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi chos ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma gtogs pa rgyu lhag ma rnams las skye'o //🔽rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ni kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu ma gtogs pa lhag ma lnga nyid las so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi chos ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma gtogs pa rgyu lhag ma rnams las skye'o // rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ni kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu ma gtogs pa lhag ma lnga nyid las so //
translated: Afflicted dharmas arise from the remaining causes, except for the ripening cause.🔽Dharmas arisen from ripening arise from the remaining five causes, except for the universal cause.

original: chos lhag ma rnams ni rnam par smin pa dang / kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu de gnyis ma gtogs pa lhag ma bzhi las skye'o //
analyzed: chos lhag ma rnams ni rnam par smin pa dang / kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu de gnyis ma gtogs pa lhag ma bzhi las skye'o //
translated: The remainder arise from the remaining four causes, except for the ripening cause and the universal cause.

original: zag pa med pa'i dang po ni rnam par smin pa dang / kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu de gnyis dang / skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma gtogs pa lhag ma gsum las skye'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i dang po ni rnam par smin pa dang / kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu de gnyis dang / skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma gtogs pa lhag ma gsum las skye'o //
translated: The first uncontaminated dharmas arise from the remaining three causes, except for the ripening cause, the universal cause, and the homogeneous cause.

original: chos rnam pa bzhir bstan pa 'di dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos rnam pa bzhir bstan pa 'di dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are these four types of dharmas?

original: smras pa / sems dang sems las byung ba yin //
analyzed: smras pa / sems dang sems las byung ba yin //
translated: He says: They are mind and mental factors.

original: 'o na gang dag sems dang mi ldan pa dang / gzugs can gyi chos de dag ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: 'o na gang dag sems dang mi ldan pa dang / gzugs can gyi chos de dag ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What are those phenomena that are not associated with mind and those that are physical?

original: mtshungs ldan ma gtogs gzhan de bzhin //
analyzed: mtshungs ldan ma gtogs gzhan de bzhin //
translated: Other than that, they are similar.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu gcig pu ma gtogs par nyon mongs pa can la sogs pa chos gzhan dag ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ji lta ba de bzhin du skye ste /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu gcig pu ma gtogs par nyon mongs pa can la sogs pa chos gzhan dag ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ji lta ba de bzhin du skye ste /
translated: Other than the similar cause alone, other phenomena such as those that are afflicted and so on arise in the same way that mind and mental factors do.

original: de la nyon mongs pa can dang rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ni bzhi las so //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa can dang rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ni bzhi las so //
translated: Here, those arisen from affliction and those arisen from karmic maturation arise from four causes.

original: lhag ma rnams ni gsum las so //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni gsum las so //
translated: The remaining ones arise from three causes.

original: zag pa med pa'i dang po ni gnyis las te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i dang po ni gnyis las te /
translated: The first uncontaminated state arises from two causes.

original: rgyu gcig las byung ba'i chos ni med do //
analyzed: rgyu gcig las byung ba'i chos ni med do //
translated: There are no phenomena that arise from a single cause.

original: rgyu'i dbang du byas pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: rgyu'i dbang du byas pa rdzogs so /
translated: The section on the power of cause is complete.

original: // / @128a * //  rkyen rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: // / @128a * //  rkyen rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are conditions?

original: rkyen ni bzhi po dag tu gsungs //
analyzed: rkyen ni bzhi po dag tu gsungs //
translated: Conditions are said to be four.

original: rgyu gang nas gsungs she na /
analyzed: rgyu gang nas gsungs she na /
translated: From what sutra are they said to be four?🔽A sutra states:

original: mdo las rkyen ni bzhi nyid de /
analyzed: mdo las rkyen ni bzhi nyid de /
translated: There are four conditions.

original: rgyu'i rkyen nyid dang / de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid dang / dmigs pa'i rkyen nyid dang / bdag po'i rkyen nyid do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyu'i rkyen nyid dang / de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid dang / dmigs pa'i rkyen nyid dang / bdag po'i rkyen nyid do zhes gsungs so //
translated: 4. the dominant condition.

original: rkyen du 'dra bas na rkyen nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: rkyen du 'dra bas na rkyen nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The condition is the cause, thus it is a causal condition.

original: de la rgyu zhes bya ba rgyu lnga yin /
analyzed: de la rgyu zhes bya ba rgyu lnga yin /
translated: The cause is fivefold:

original: byed pa'i rgyu ma gtogs pa rgyu lnga ni rgyu'i rkyen to //
analyzed: byed pa'i rgyu ma gtogs pa rgyu lnga ni rgyu'i rkyen to //
translated: The causal condition is the five causes, excluding the efficient cause.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams //🔽tha ma ma gtogs de ma thag //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams // tha ma ma gtogs de ma thag //
translated: The immediately preceding condition is the mind and mental factors.

original: dgra bcom pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba tha ma ma gtogs pa ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen to //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba tha ma ma gtogs pa ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen to //
translated: The immediately preceding condition is the mind and mental factors, excluding the final mind and mental factors of an arhat.

original: dmigs pa chos rnams thams cad do ;
analyzed: dmigs pa chos rnams thams cad do ;
translated: The object as condition is all phenomena.🔽The object as condition is all phenomena.

original: / rim bzhin du mig gi rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa ni gzugs so //🔽rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i ni sgra'o //🔽sna'i rnam par shes pa'i ni dri'o //
analyzed: / rim bzhin du mig gi rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa ni gzugs so // rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i ni sgra'o // sna'i rnam par shes pa'i ni dri'o //
translated: The object as condition of eye consciousness and its concomitant mental factors is form.🔽The object as condition of ear consciousness and its concomitant mental factors is sound.

original: lce'i rnam par shes pa'i ni ro'o //
analyzed: lce'i rnam par shes pa'i ni ro'o //
translated: The object as condition of nose consciousness and its concomitant mental factors is smell.🔽The object as condition of tongue consciousness and its concomitant mental factors is taste.

original: lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i ni reg bya'o //
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i ni reg bya'o //
translated: The object-field of the body consciousness is the tangible.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i ni chos thams cad de ;
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i ni chos thams cad de ;
translated: The object-field of the mental consciousness is all the factors.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i yul du ma gtogs pa gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i yul du ma gtogs pa gzhan ni med do //
translated: There is no factor which is not the object-field of the mental consciousness.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen bshad zin to //🔽byed pa zhes bya bdag por bshad //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen bshad zin to // byed pa zhes bya bdag por bshad //
translated: The condition qua object has been discussed.🔽The condition qua dominant is the cause qua generative cause.

original: byed pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de nyid bdag po'i rkyen to //
analyzed: byed pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de nyid bdag po'i rkyen to //
translated: The cause qua generative cause is the condition qua dominant.

original: 'di ni lhag ma'i rkyen yin pas bdag po'i rkyen to //
analyzed: 'di ni lhag ma'i rkyen yin pas bdag po'i rkyen to //
translated: It is called dominant because it is the cause of the rest.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen yang chos thams cad yin par ni 'dod mod kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos ni nam yang dmigs par mi 'gyur la /🔽bdag po'i rkyen du ni 'gyur bas lhag pa nyid du yod pa'am /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen yang chos thams cad yin par ni 'dod mod kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos ni nam yang dmigs par mi 'gyur la / bdag po'i rkyen du ni 'gyur bas lhag pa nyid du yod pa'am /
translated: Although all factors are accepted as the condition qua object, the co-existent factors are never the object.

original: lhag pa'i rkyen yin pa ste /
analyzed: lhag pa'i rkyen yin pa ste /
translated: The condition qua dominant is the cause of the rest, or the dominant condition.

original: rang gi ngo bo ma gtogs pa thams cad ni 'dus byas thams cad kyi'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ma gtogs pa thams cad ni 'dus byas thams cad kyi'o //
translated: All factors are the dominant condition of all conditioned factors, with the exception of themselves.

original: yang rkyen 'di dag bya ba byed pa gnas skabs gang dag gi chos la byed ce na /
analyzed: yang rkyen 'di dag bya ba byed pa gnas skabs gang dag gi chos la byed ce na /
translated: In what state do the conditions exercise their activity?

original: re zhig rgyu'i rkyen rnam pa lnga bshad pa de las /
analyzed: re zhig rgyu'i rkyen rnam pa lnga bshad pa de las /
translated: The fivefold causal condition has been explained.

original: 'gag pa'i tshe la byed pa ni //
analyzed: 'gag pa'i tshe la byed pa ni //
translated: The active condition is at the time of cessation.

original: rgyu gnyis kyis byed /
analyzed: rgyu gnyis kyis byed /
translated: It is performed by two causes.

original: 'gag pa'i tshe zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir da ltar te /
analyzed: 'gag pa'i tshe zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir da ltar te /
translated: The time of cessation is the present because it is directed toward cessation.

original: der ni lhan cig 'byung ba dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu'i bya ba byed de ;
analyzed: der ni lhan cig 'byung ba dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu'i bya ba byed de ;
translated: At that time, the active condition is performed by the simultaneous cause and the associated cause.

original: de gnyis kyi bya ba ni lhan cig byung ba'i 'bras bu la byed do //🔽skye tshe la /
analyzed: de gnyis kyi bya ba ni lhan cig byung ba'i 'bras bu la byed do // skye tshe la /
translated: The activity of those two is performed with regard to the simultaneous effect.🔽The active condition is at the time of birth.

original: gsum ste / skye tshe zhes bya ba ni skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa ste /
analyzed: gsum ste / skye tshe zhes bya ba ni skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa ste /
translated: The time of birth is the future because it is directed toward birth.

original: der ni skal ba mnyam pa dang / kun du 'gro ba dang / rnam par smin pa'i rgyu rnams bya ba byed de /
analyzed: der ni skal ba mnyam pa dang / kun du 'gro ba dang / rnam par smin pa'i rgyu rnams bya ba byed de /
translated: At that time, the active condition is performed by the homogeneous cause, the pervasive cause, and the ripening cause.

original: re zhig rgyu'i rkyen ni de lta'o //
analyzed: re zhig rgyu'i rkyen ni de lta'o //
translated: Thus is the causal condition.

original: de las gzhan @128b pa'i rkyen gnyis de las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan @128b pa'i rkyen gnyis de las bzlog pa'o //
translated: The other two conditions are the opposite of that.

original: byed pa'i tshul gang gis rgyu'i rkyen rnam pa gnyis su bshad pa de las bzlog pa ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang / dmigs pa'i rkyen du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: byed pa'i tshul gang gis rgyu'i rkyen rnam pa gnyis su bshad pa de las bzlog pa ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang / dmigs pa'i rkyen du rig par bya ste /
translated: The mode of activity of the two kinds of causal conditions is the opposite of the immediately preceding condition and the objective condition.

original: de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni go skabs 'byed pa'i phyir skye ba'i tshe bya ba byed la /
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni go skabs 'byed pa'i phyir skye ba'i tshe bya ba byed la /
translated: The immediately preceding condition acts at the time of birth, because it creates an opportunity.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni da ltar gyi sems dang sems las byung ba gnyis kyis 'dzin pa'i phyir 'gag pa'i tshe'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni da ltar gyi sems dang sems las byung ba gnyis kyis 'dzin pa'i phyir 'gag pa'i tshe'o //
translated: The objective condition acts at the time of cessation, because the present mind and mental factors grasp it.

original: bdag po'i rkyen ni gnas skabs thams cad du mi sgrib pa'i ngo bor gnas pa 'di ni de nyid byed do //
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen ni gnas skabs thams cad du mi sgrib pa'i ngo bor gnas pa 'di ni de nyid byed do //
translated: The dominant condition acts in all states, because it is present as the nature of nonobstruction.

original: rkyen rnams byed pa dang bcas pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: rkyen rnams byed pa dang bcas pa bshad zin to //
translated: The conditions with their functions have been explained.

original: yang chos gang zhig rkyen du zhig gis bskyed ce na /
analyzed: yang chos gang zhig rkyen du zhig gis bskyed ce na /
translated: How many conditions generate which factors?

original: bzhi yis sems dang sems byung rnams //
analyzed: bzhi yis sems dang sems byung rnams //
translated: Mind and mental factors are generated by four.

original: de la 'di dag gi rgyu'i rkyen ni rgyu lnga po thams cad do //
analyzed: de la 'di dag gi rgyu'i rkyen ni rgyu lnga po thams cad do //
translated: The causal condition of those is all five causes.

original: de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni sems dang sems las byung ba snga ma gzhan gyis par mchod pa rnams so //
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni sems dang sems las byung ba snga ma gzhan gyis par mchod pa rnams so //
translated: The condition as the equivalent and immediate antecedent is the former thought and thoughtconcomitants which leave no interval between themselves and their effect.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni ci rigs par yul lnga dang / chos thams cad do //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni ci rigs par yul lnga dang / chos thams cad do //
translated: The condition as the object is the five sense-objects and all factors.

original: bdag po'i rkyen ni rang gi ngo bo ma gtogs pa chos thams cad do //
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen ni rang gi ngo bo ma gtogs pa chos thams cad do //
translated: The dominant condition is all factors, with the exception of the factor itself.

original: gsum gyis snyoms par 'jug pa gnyis //
analyzed: gsum gyis snyoms par 'jug pa gnyis //
translated: Two attainments are by means of three conditions.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa de gnyis ni dmigs par byed pa med pas dmigs pa'i rkyen med do //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa de gnyis ni dmigs par byed pa med pas dmigs pa'i rkyen med do //
translated: The attainment of cessation and the attainment of non-perception are not associated with a cognitive object, thus they do not have a condition as the cognitive object.

original: de gnyis kyi rgyu'i rkyen ni rgyu rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de gnyis kyi rgyu'i rkyen ni rgyu rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The condition as cause is twofold:

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni skye ba la sogs pa'o //🔽skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni mtshungs pa'i dge ba'i chos sngar 'byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni skye ba la sogs pa'o // skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni mtshungs pa'i dge ba'i chos sngar 'byung ba rnams so //
translated: the co-existent cause is origination, etc.🔽The homogeneous cause is the former factors of the same class.

original: de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The condition as the equivalent and immediate antecedent is the thought of attainment and its thoughtconcomitants.

original: bdag po'i rkyen 'di snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen 'di snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The dominant condition is as above.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa de dag gi sems kyi mngon par 'du byed pa las skye pa'i phyir sems kyi de ma thag pa ni yin gyi sems skye ba la bgegs byed pa'i phyir de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni ma yin no //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa de dag gi sems kyi mngon par 'du byed pa las skye pa'i phyir sems kyi de ma thag pa ni yin gyi sems skye ba la bgegs byed pa'i phyir de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni ma yin no //
translated: The condition as the equivalent and immediate antecedent is the mind and the mental states that have just perished, because the meditative attainment arises from the formation of the mind.

original: gzhan ni gnyis po dag las skye //
analyzed: gzhan ni gnyis po dag las skye //
translated: The other arises from two.

original: gzhan mi ldan pa dang / gzugs can gyi chos rnams ni rgyu dang bdag po'i rkyen las skye'o //
analyzed: gzhan mi ldan pa dang / gzugs can gyi chos rnams ni rgyu dang bdag po'i rkyen las skye'o //
translated: Other factors, namely, non-possession and the material factors, arise from the causal condition and the dominant condition.

original: ji skad du dngos po rnams ni rgyu dang rkyen las skye ba'i 'gro ba thams cad la dbang phyug dang skyes bu dang gtso bo la sogs pa rgyu gcig pu ni med do zhes bshad pa 'di la gtan tshigs ci yod ce na /
analyzed: ji skad du dngos po rnams ni rgyu dang rkyen las skye ba'i 'gro ba thams cad la dbang phyug dang skyes bu dang gtso bo la sogs pa rgyu gcig pu ni med do zhes bshad pa 'di la gtan tshigs ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the reason for the statement: “All things arise from causes and conditions. There is no creator such as God, a primordial being, or a principal agent”?

original: dbang phyug sogs min rim sogs kyis //
analyzed: dbang phyug sogs min rim sogs kyis //
translated: Because of the order, etc.

original: gal te dbang phyug gam gzhan yang rung ba rgyu gcig @129a * //
analyzed: gal te dbang phyug gam gzhan yang rung ba rgyu gcig @129a * //
translated: If God, etc., were the cause of the world, then the world would be created all at once, and not gradually.

original: pu zhig yod na ni 'gro ba thams cad cig car du skye bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: pu zhig yod na ni 'gro ba thams cad cig car du skye bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If there were a single cause of all things, all things would arise at once.

original: dngos po rnams rim gyis 'byung ba yang mthong ste /
analyzed: dngos po rnams rim gyis 'byung ba yang mthong ste /
translated: But we see that things arise in succession.

original: de bas na 'jig rten gyi rgyu dbang phyug la sogs pa yod pa ma yin no //🔽sogs pa smos pa ni mi dmigs pa dang / rgyu med pa mi snang ba dang / rigs sna tshogs du ma'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //🔽gzhan ni gnyis po dag las skyes //🔽gang de skad du bshad de thal ba de la ji ltar na 'byung ba rnams kyi rgyu'i rkyen yin zhe na /🔽de'i rgyu 'byung ba rnam gnyis so //
analyzed: de bas na 'jig rten gyi rgyu dbang phyug la sogs pa yod pa ma yin no // sogs pa smos pa ni mi dmigs pa dang / rgyu med pa mi snang ba dang / rigs sna tshogs du ma'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa'i phyir ro // gzhan ni gnyis po dag las skyes // gang de skad du bshad de thal ba de la ji ltar na 'byung ba rnams kyi rgyu'i rkyen yin zhe na / de'i rgyu 'byung ba rnam gnyis so //
translated: Therefore, the world is not produced by a single cause, such as a divine being.

original: 'byung ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i don te /🔽skal ba mnyam pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba gnyis las so //🔽'byung las gyur pa rnam pa lnga //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i don te /🔽skal ba mnyam pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba gnyis las so //🔽'byung las gyur pa rnam pa lnga //

original: 'byung ba las gyur pa la ni 'byung ba rnams rnam pa lngas rgyu byed de /
analyzed: 'byung ba las gyur pa la ni 'byung ba rnams rnam pa lngas rgyu byed de /
translated: The primary elements act as causes of the derivative form in five ways.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: skyed pa dang / rten pa dang / gnas pa dang / ston pa dang / 'phel bar byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: skyed pa dang / rten pa dang / gnas pa dang / ston pa dang / 'phel bar byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they generate, support, endure, manifest, and increase.

original: de dag kyang byed pa'i rgyu nyid do //
analyzed: de dag kyang byed pa'i rgyu nyid do //
translated: They are also the active cause.

original: yang na rnam pa lnga tha dad pa ni skyed pa'i rgyu ni de dag las skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na rnam pa lnga tha dad pa ni skyed pa'i rgyu ni de dag las skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Alternatively, the five ways are different: the generating cause is because derivative form arises from them.

original: rten pa'i rgyu ni skyes nas 'byung ba'i rjes su mthun pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rten pa'i rgyu ni skyes nas 'byung ba'i rjes su mthun pa'i phyir te /
translated: The supporting cause is because they are compatible with what arises after it has arisen,

original: slob dpon la sogs pa la brten pa bzhin no //
analyzed: slob dpon la sogs pa la brten pa bzhin no //
translated: like a master, etc.

original: gnas pa'i rgyu ni rten du gyur pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gnas pa'i rgyu ni rten du gyur pa'i phyir te /
translated: The enduring cause is because they are the support,

original: ri mo'i rtsig pa bzhin no //🔽ston pa'i rgyu ni rgyun mi 'chad pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ri mo'i rtsig pa bzhin no // ston pa'i rgyu ni rgyun mi 'chad pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: like a wall, etc.🔽The manifesting cause is because they are the cause of the continuity.

original: 'phel bar byed pa'i rgyu ni 'phel ba'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'phel bar byed pa'i rgyu ni 'phel ba'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The increasing cause is because they are the reason for its increase.

original: de ltar na de dag ni skye ba dang / 'gyur ba dang / brten pa dang / gnas pa dang / 'phel ba'i rgyu nyid du bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na de dag ni skye ba dang / 'gyur ba dang / brten pa dang / gnas pa dang / 'phel ba'i rgyu nyid du bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, these are taught as the causes of birth, change, support, duration, and growth.

original: 'byung 'gyur rnam gsum phan tshun du //
analyzed: 'byung 'gyur rnam gsum phan tshun du //
translated: The great elements are the reciprocal cause of the three.

original: rgyu yin te lhan cig 'byung ba dang / skal pa mnyam pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i rgyus so //
analyzed: rgyu yin te lhan cig 'byung ba dang / skal pa mnyam pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i rgyus so //
translated: They are the reciprocal cause of the three: the cause of arising, the cause of continuance, and the cause of duration.

original: byed pa'i rgyu ni bye brag med par gnas pas thams cad ni mi bgrang ngo //
analyzed: byed pa'i rgyu ni bye brag med par gnas pas thams cad ni mi bgrang ngo //
translated: The active cause is not mentioned because it is not distinguished.

original: de la lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni lus dang / ngag gi las sems kyi rjes su yongs su 'jug pa rnams phan tshun du ste /
analyzed: de la lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni lus dang / ngag gi las sems kyi rjes su yongs su 'jug pa rnams phan tshun du ste /
translated: Among them, the co-existent cause is the mutual cause of the bodily and verbal actions that follow the mind.

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the cause of other derivative form.

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni sngar byung ba thams cad skal ba mnyam pa'i 'o //
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni sngar byung ba thams cad skal ba mnyam pa'i 'o //
translated: The homogeneous cause is all that has arisen previously.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni lus dang ngag gi rnam par smin pa mig la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni lus dang ngag gi rnam par smin pa mig la sogs pa'o //
translated: The ripening cause is the eye, etc. that is the ripening of bodily and verbal actions.

original: 'byung ba rnams la de rnams gcig //
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams la de rnams gcig //
translated: The great elements are the cause of the three.

original: 'byung ba rnams la ni 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs rnam par smin pa'i rgyu 'ba' zhig byed de /
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams la ni 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs rnam par smin pa'i rgyu 'ba' zhig byed de /
translated: The primary elements act as the cause of karmic maturation of derivative form alone.

original: lus dang ngag @129b gi las gang gi rnam par smin pa 'byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: lus dang ngag @129b gi las gang gi rnam par smin pa 'byung ba rnams so //
translated: The primary elements that are the karmic maturation of bodily and vocal karma.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams bye brag med par de ma thag pa'i rkyen du bshad kyi /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams bye brag med par de ma thag pa'i rkyen du bshad kyi /
translated: The mind and mental factors are explained as the immediately preceding condition without distinction.

original: sems gang gi mjug thogs su sems gang 'byung ba nges par ni ma bshad pas /
analyzed: sems gang gi mjug thogs su sems gang 'byung ba nges par ni ma bshad pas /
translated: But it is not explained with certainty which mind arises immediately after which mind.

original: da ni de brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni de brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now that will be explained.

original: de la re zhig mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: de la re zhig mdor bsdu na /
translated: First, in brief,

original: sems ni bcu gnyis so//
analyzed: sems ni bcu gnyis so//
translated: there are twelve minds.🔽How so?

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: It is said:🔽In the desire realm, the mind is virtuous, nonvirtuous,

original: smras pa / 'dod yid dge dang mi dge dang // bsgribs pa dang ni ma bsgribs pa //
analyzed: smras pa / 'dod yid dge dang mi dge dang // bsgribs pa dang ni ma bsgribs pa //
translated: obscured, and unobscured.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dag na ni sems bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dag na ni sems bzhi ste /
translated: In the desire realm there are four minds:

original: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: virtuous, nonvirtuous, obscured neutral, and unobscured neutral.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa dag na /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa dag na /
translated: In the form and formless realms

original: mi dge ba'i las gzhan /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i las gzhan /
translated: nonvirtuous karma is excluded.

original: gzugs kyi khams dag na mi dge ba ni med kyi gsum yod do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams dag na mi dge ba ni med kyi gsum yod do //

original: gzugs med pa'i khams dag na yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams dag na yang de bzhin te /

original: bcu po 'di dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i sems so //
analyzed: bcu po 'di dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i sems so //

original: zag med gnyis zhes bya ba ni slob pa dang / mi slob pa ste /
analyzed: zag med gnyis zhes bya ba ni slob pa dang / mi slob pa ste /

original: de ltar na de dag ni sems bcu gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na de dag ni sems bcu gnyis su 'gyur ro //

original: de la / 'dod sems dge ba las sems dgu //
analyzed: de la / 'dod sems dge ba las sems dgu //

original: de ma thag tu'o zhes phyis 'chad do //
analyzed: de ma thag tu'o zhes phyis 'chad do //

original: 'dod pa'i khams dag gi dge ba'i sems gang yin pa de'i mjug thogs su sems dgu 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dag gi dge ba'i sems gang yin pa de'i mjug thogs su sems dgu 'byung ste /
translated: Immediately after the wholesome thought of the realm of desire, nine thoughts can arise, i.e.,

original: rang gi sa pa bzhi dang / slob pa dang / mi slob pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rang gi sa pa bzhi dang / slob pa dang / mi slob pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa gnyis te /

analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe dge ba dang nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe bsgribs pa'o //

original: gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe bsgribs pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe bsgribs pa nyid do //

original: shin tu ring ba'i phyir dge ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: shin tu ring ba'i phyir dge ba ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not virtuous because it is too distant.

original: 'dod pa'i khams pas ni gzugs med pa'i khams gnas dang / rnam pa dang / dmigs pa dang / gnyen po'i ring ba nyid kyis ring ngo //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams pas ni gzugs med pa'i khams gnas dang / rnam pa dang / dmigs pa dang / gnyen po'i ring ba nyid kyis ring ngo //

original: de ni brgyad po nyid las so //
analyzed: de ni brgyad po nyid las so //

analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa dge ba'i sems de ni rang gis pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa gnyis las te /

original: ldang ba'i tshe dge ba dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi ting nge 'dzin gyis gzir ba sa 'og ma'i dge ba la brten pa'i phyir bsgribs pa dang / ldang ba'i tshe slob pa dang / mi slob pa las te /
analyzed: ldang ba'i tshe dge ba dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi ting nge 'dzin gyis gzir ba sa 'og ma'i dge ba la brten pa'i phyir bsgribs pa dang / ldang ba'i tshe slob pa dang / mi slob pa las te /
translated: At the time of rising from meditative attainment, it arises from a virtuous mind and from an obscured mind that is afflicted by formless realm meditative attainment, since it relies on a virtuous mind of a lower level. At the time of rising from meditative attainment, it arises from a learner mind and a nonlearner mind.

original: sems brgyad kyi mjug thogs su 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sems brgyad kyi mjug thogs su 'byung ngo //

analyzed: mi dge ba ni bcu po dag las slob pa dang mi slob pa ma gtogs te /

analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dag tu nying mtshams sbyor ba na gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i sems thams cad kyi @130a * //

analyzed: mi dge ba'i sems kyi mjug thogs su ni rang gi sa pa'i sems bzhi po 'ba' zhig 'byung ngo //

original: bsgribs de bzhin /
analyzed: bsgribs de bzhin /

original: 'dod pa'i khams dag gi mi dge ba ji skad du bshad pa de bzhin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dag gi mi dge ba ji skad du bshad pa de bzhin te /

analyzed: bcu'i mjug thogs su 'byung la de las ni bzhi nyid do // ma bsgribs rnam lnga las so //

analyzed: 'dod pa'i zhes bya bar sbyar te / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i sems ni rang gis pa bzhi dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba las sprul pa'i sems te /

original: lnga'i mjug thogs su 'byung ngo //
analyzed: lnga'i mjug thogs su 'byung ngo //

original: de las de ma thags mas bdun //
analyzed: de las de ma thags mas bdun //

analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa las ni rang gis pa bzhi dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i gnyis te /

original: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe nyon mongs pa can dang / sprul pa'i sems kyi mjug thogs su dge ba dang nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can nyid do /

original: gzugs kyi dge las bcu gcig go //
analyzed: gzugs kyi dge las bcu gcig go //

translated: Immediately after a wholesome form realm mind, eleven minds arise, excluding a form realm unobscured-neutral mind and a formless realm mind.

original: dgu yi de ma thag las te //
analyzed: dgu yi de ma thag las te //

original: gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba'i sems ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can gnyis dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ma gtogs pa dgu'i mjug thogs su 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba'i sems ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can gnyis dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ma gtogs pa dgu'i mjug thogs su 'byung ngo //

original: bsgribs pa brgyad las /
analyzed: bsgribs pa brgyad las /

analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa'i bsgribs la lang du ma bstan pa'i sems ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can gnyis dang slob pa dang / mi slob pa ma gtogs pa brgyad kyi mjug thogs su 'byung ngo // de las gzugs na spyod pa'i ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i mjug thogs su ni rang gi sa pa rnams dang / 'dod pa'i khams pa gsum ste /

analyzed: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ma gtogs pa drug 'byung ngo //

analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa'i ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ni rang gis pa gsum po nyid las so //

original: de las drug ste /
analyzed: de las drug ste /

analyzed: rang gi sa pa gsum dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can no //

analyzed: gzugs kyi khams dag gis ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ji ltar bshad pa ltar / @130b gzugs med pa yang /

original: tshul de bzhin te /
analyzed: tshul de bzhin te /

analyzed: de pa'i ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yang rang gis pa gsum po 'ba' zhig la 'byung la /

analyzed: de las ni rang gis pa gsum dang / sa 'og ma pa'i nyon mongs pa can rnams dang drug 'byung ngo // dge ba las /

original: sems dgu dag ste /
analyzed: sems dgu dag ste /
translated: Nine minds arise from a virtuous mind of the formless realm.

original: gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i dge ba'i sems kyi mjug thogs su ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba dang 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa'i ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ma gtogs pa'i sems dgu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i dge ba'i sems kyi mjug thogs su ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba dang 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa'i ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ma gtogs pa'i sems dgu 'byung ngo //
translated: Immediately after a virtuous mind of the formless realm, nine minds arise: the virtuous mind of the desire realm, the virtuous mind of the form realm and the unobscured neutral minds of the desire realm and form realm are excluded.

original: drug las te /
analyzed: drug las te /

analyzed: gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i dge ba ni rang gi gsum dang / gzugs na spyod ba'i dge ba dang / slob pa dang / mi slob pa las so //

original: bsgribs pa las bdun /
analyzed: bsgribs pa las bdun /

original: de de bzhin /
analyzed: de de bzhin /

analyzed: khams gsum pa'i dge ba dang slob pa las so // de las lnga / bzhi po de dag nyid dang mi slob pa'o //

original: mi slob pa lnga las so //
analyzed: mi slob pa lnga las so //

original: 'das ma thag pa'i lnga po dag nyid las so //
analyzed: 'das ma thag pa'i lnga po dag nyid las so //
translated: The unobscured-non-defined mind of the realm of immateriality can arise immediately after five minds, namely, the four of its own realm and the unobscured-non-defined mind of the realm of fine-materiality.

original: de las sems ni bzhi rnams te /
analyzed: de las sems ni bzhi rnams te /
translated: Four minds can arise immediately after the unobscured-non-defined mind of the realm of immateriality.

original: mi slob pa'i sems de'i mjug thogs su ni khams gsum pa'i dge ba dang / mi slob pa dang sems bzhi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i sems de'i mjug thogs su ni khams gsum pa'i dge ba dang / mi slob pa dang sems bzhi 'byung ngo //
translated: Four minds can arise immediately after the unobscured-non-defined mind of the realm of immateriality: the two of its own realm, the unobscured-non-defined mind and the defiled mind of the realm of fine-materiality.

original: sems bcu gnyis rdzogs so /
analyzed: sems bcu gnyis rdzogs so /
translated: The twelve types of minds are completed.

original: // / yang bcu gnyis de dag nyi shur yang dbye ste /
analyzed: // / yang bcu gnyis de dag nyi shur yang dbye ste /

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /

analyzed: gsum du skyes nas thob pa dang // sbyor byung dge rnam gnyis su dbye //

analyzed: khams gsum po dag tu skyes nas 'thob pa dang / sbyor ba las byung ba ste dge ba'i sems rnam pa gnyis su dbye'o //

original: rnam smin skyes dang spyod lam pa //
analyzed: rnam smin skyes dang spyod lam pa //

original: bzo gnas ba dang sprul pa ste //
analyzed: bzo gnas ba dang sprul pa ste //

original: 'dod pa'i lung bstan min rnam bzhir //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i lung bstan min rnam bzhir //

original: dbye zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: dbye zhes bya bar sbyar te /

original: 'dod pa ni spyod pa'i ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang / spyod lam pa dang / bzo'i gnas pa dang / sprul pa'i sems dang rnam pa bzhir dbye'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa ni spyod pa'i ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang / spyod lam pa dang / bzo'i gnas pa dang / sprul pa'i sems dang rnam pa bzhir dbye'o //
translated: In the desire realm, there are four types of unobscured neutral minds: those arisen from karmic maturation, those of creative activity, those of creative activity, those of deportment, and those of emanation.

original: gzugs dag na ni bzo ma gtogs //
analyzed: gzugs dag na ni bzo ma gtogs //
translated: In the form realm, those of creative activity are excluded.

original: @131a * // gzugs kyi khams dag na ni rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: @131a * // gzugs kyi khams dag na ni rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
translated: In the form realm, there are three types of unobscured neutral minds.

original: de la bzo med pa'i phyir bzo'i gnas ma gtogs so //
analyzed: de la bzo med pa'i phyir bzo'i gnas ma gtogs so //
translated: because it is not a creation, it is not included in the creations.

original: de ltar na dge ba drug dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa bdun du phye bas sems bcu gnyis po de dag las nyi shur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na dge ba drug dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa bdun du phye bas sems bcu gnyis po de dag las nyi shur 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, by dividing the wholesome into six and the unobscured-non-defined into seven, these twelve minds make twenty.

original: zhar la 'ongs pa 'di dag gi de ma thag pa'i rkyen nges pa ni chos mngon pa mdzod kyi 'grel pa las bshad do //
analyzed: zhar la 'ongs pa 'di dag gi de ma thag pa'i rkyen nges pa ni chos mngon pa mdzod kyi 'grel pa las bshad do //
translated: The certainty of the condition as antecedent has been explained in the Abhidharmakośaśāstra.

analyzed: 'dir ni gzhung dka' ba yongs su spangs pa'i phyir mi brjod do //

analyzed: gang dag sems bcu gnyis su bshad pa 'di dag las sems gang zhig la rnyed pa du zhig ce na /
translated: How many minds are acquired in relation to the twelve minds that have been explained?

original: khams gsum pa yi nyon mongs can //
analyzed: khams gsum pa yi nyon mongs can //

analyzed: rnyed pa drug dang drug dang gnyis //

analyzed: sems drug po 'di dag mi ldan pa las thob ste /

analyzed: yongs su nyams pa la gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can dang / yongs su nyams pa las slob pa'i'o //
translated: From degeneration, the afflicted state of the form realm and the learner state are obtained.

original: gzugs na spyod pa'i nyon mongs ba can yang rnyed pa drug ste /
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa'i nyon mongs ba can yang rnyed pa drug ste /
translated: The afflicted state of the form realm is obtained from six.

original: khams su slar log pa las gzugs na spyod pa gsum dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i dang / yongs su nyams pa las gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can dang slob pa'i'o //
analyzed: khams su slar log pa las gzugs na spyod pa gsum dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i dang / yongs su nyams pa las gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can dang slob pa'i'o //
translated: From returning to the desire realm, the three of the form realm and the unobscured neutral state of the desire realm are obtained. From degeneration, the afflicted state of the formless realm and the learner state are obtained.

original: gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can la ni rnyed pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can la ni rnyed pa gnyis te /
translated: The afflicted state of the formless realm is obtained from two.

original: yongs su nyams pa las de nyid nyon mongs pa can dang slob pa'i'o //
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa las de nyid nyon mongs pa can dang slob pa'i'o //
translated: The obscured mind of the realm of desire is obtained relative to the wholesome mind of the realm of desire and the unobscured-non-defined mind of the realm of desire.🔽The wholesome mind of the realm of fine-materiality is obtained relative to three minds.

original: gzugs skyes dge la gsum dag gi / gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba la sems gsum gyi rnyed pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs skyes dge la gsum dag gi / gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba la sems gsum gyi rnyed pa ste /
translated: The wholesome mind of the realm of fine-materiality is obtained relative to the wholesome mind of the realm of fine-materiality, the unobscured-non-defined mind of the realm of desire and the unobscured-non-defined mind of the realm of fine-materiality.

original: dge ba de nyid kyi dang / 'dod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa gnyis kyi'o //🔽slob pa la bzhi /
analyzed: dge ba de nyid kyi dang / 'dod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa gnyis kyi'o // slob pa la bzhi /

original: slob pa de nyid kyi dang / 'dod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / lam gyi 'dod pa dang / gzugs kyi khams kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba la gzugs med pa'i dge ba'o //🔽lhag la de'i /🔽lhag par byas pas lhag ma ste /
analyzed: slob pa de nyid kyi dang / 'dod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / lam gyi 'dod pa dang / gzugs kyi khams kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba la gzugs med pa'i dge ba'o // lhag la de'i / lhag par byas pas lhag ma ste /
translated: The unobscured-non-defined mind of the realm of immateriality is obtained relative to the wholesome mind of the realm of immateriality and the unobscured-non-defined mind of the realm of immateriality.

original: sems gang gi rnyed pa ma bshad pa @131b de la de nyid kyi rnyed par lta'o //🔽yang smras pa /
analyzed: sems gang gi rnyed pa ma bshad pa @131b de la de nyid kyi rnyed par lta'o //🔽yang smras pa /
translated: The unobscured-non-defined mind of the realm of immateriality is obtained relative to the wholesome mind of the realm of immaterial

original: skye dang snyoms par 'jug pa dang // 'dod chags bral dang yongs nyams dang // dge ba'i nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe //
analyzed: skye dang snyoms par 'jug pa dang // 'dod chags bral dang yongs nyams dang // dge ba'i nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe //
translated: and the linking of virtuous minds.

original: sems de ldan pa min las rnyed //🔽ces bya'o // chos mngon pa mdzod kyi 'grel pa mdo dang mthun pa las /
analyzed: sems de ldan pa min las rnyed // ces bya'o // chos mngon pa mdzod kyi 'grel pa mdo dang mthun pa las /
translated: That mind is obtained from a non-conjoined state.

original: dbang po bstan pa zhes bya ba mdzod kyi gnas gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: dbang po bstan pa zhes bya ba mdzod kyi gnas gnyis pa'o /
translated: This concludes the second chapter on the presentation of faculties in the Treasury of Abhidharma, which is a commentary consistent with the sūtras.

original: // / da ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi sems kyi nges pa ni bstan na /
analyzed: // / da ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi sems kyi nges pa ni bstan na /
translated: Now, having explained the certainty of mind in the desire, form, and formless realms,

original: de la 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams rnams gang yin pa de brjod par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams rnams gang yin pa de brjod par bya'o zhe na /
translated: one might ask, What are the desire, form, and formless realms?

original: de'i phyir 'dir smras pa /🔽dmyal ba yi dags dud 'gro dang // mi rnams dang ni lha rnams drug /'dod pa'i khams te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir smras pa / dmyal ba yi dags dud 'gro dang // mi rnams dang ni lha rnams drug /'dod pa'i khams te /
translated: Therefore, it is said here:🔽The six hells, hungry ghosts, animals, humans, and gods are the desire realm.

original: 'gro ba zhi dang / lha'i ris drug las 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba zhi dang / lha'i ris drug las 'di lta ste /
translated: From the six classes of beings and six divine abodes,

original: rgyal chen bzhi pa rnams dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang / 'thab bral dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byer de /
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi pa rnams dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang / 'thab bral dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byer de /
translated: the Four Great Kings, the Thirty-three gods, the Yāma gods, the Tuṣita gods, the Nirmāṇarati gods, the Paranirmitavaśavartin gods.

original: de ltar na de dag snod kyi 'jig rten dang bcas pa ni 'dod pa'i khams so //
analyzed: de ltar na de dag snod kyi 'jig rten dang bcas pa ni 'dod pa'i khams so //
translated: Thus, together with the receptacle world, the desire realm is twenty-one thousand yojanas in height and thirty-two thousand yojanas in length and breadth.

original: de gnas du zhig ce na /
analyzed: de gnas du zhig ce na /
translated: How many places are there in the desire realm?

original: smras pa / dmyal ba dang / gling dbye ba las de nyi shu /
analyzed: smras pa / dmyal ba dang / gling dbye ba las de nyi shu /
translated: It is said: Twenty, divided into hells and continents.

original: gnas rnams so zhes tshig gi lhag ma sbyar ro //
analyzed: gnas rnams so zhes tshig gi lhag ma sbyar ro //
translated: The word “places” is understood.

original: dmyal ba chen po brgyad de /
analyzed: dmyal ba chen po brgyad de /
translated: There are eight great hells:

original: yang sos dang / thig nag dang / bsdus gzhom dang / ngu 'bod dang / ngu 'bod chen po dang / tsha ba dang / rab tu tsha ba dang / mnar med pa'o //
analyzed: yang sos dang / thig nag dang / bsdus gzhom dang / ngu 'bod dang / ngu 'bod chen po dang / tsha ba dang / rab tu tsha ba dang / mnar med pa'o //
translated: Saṃjīva, Kālasūtra, Saṃghāta, Raurava, Mahāraurava, Tapana, Pratāpana, and Avīci.

original: gling bzhi ste 'dzam bu'i gling dang / shar gyi lus 'phags dang / nub gyi  ba lang spyod dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan dang / bshad ma thag pa'i lha'i ris drug ste /
analyzed: gling bzhi ste 'dzam bu'i gling dang / shar gyi lus 'phags dang / nub gyi  ba lang spyod dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan dang / bshad ma thag pa'i lha'i ris drug ste /
translated: There are four continents: Jambudvīpa, Pūrvavideha, Aparagodānīya, and Uttarakuru. There are six classes of gods that have just been explained.

original: de ltar na gzhan 'phrul dbang byed nas mnar med pa'i bar gyi gnas nyi shu po de dag ni 'dod pa'i khams so //
analyzed: de ltar na gzhan 'phrul dbang byed nas mnar med pa'i bar gyi gnas nyi shu po de dag ni 'dod pa'i khams so //
translated: Thus, the realm of desire is made up of twenty places, from the gods who control enjoyments magically created by others down to the Avici hells.

original: snod dang bcas pa gzung na ni rlung gi dkyil 'khor la thug gi bar du'o //
analyzed: snod dang bcas pa gzung na ni rlung gi dkyil 'khor la thug gi bar du'o //
translated: If one includes the receptacle, then the realm of desire extends as far as the circle of wind.

original: 'dod pa'i khams 'di nas /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams 'di nas /
translated: Above the realm of desire,

original: gong ma'i gnas dge bcu bdun ni //🔽gzugs kyi khams /
analyzed: gong ma'i gnas dge bcu bdun ni // gzugs kyi khams /
translated: there are seventeen places in the realm of finemateriality.

original: ji lta zhe na /🔽smras pa / der so so'i /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na / smras pa / der so so'i /
translated: What is the realm of finemateriality?🔽It is the four meditations.

original: bsam gtan la ni sa gsum pa //
analyzed: bsam gtan la ni sa gsum pa //
translated: Each meditation is threefold.

original: bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis ba dang gsum pa ni re re zhing sa gsum gsum pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis ba dang gsum pa ni re re zhing sa gsum gsum pa'o //
translated: The first, second and third meditations are each made up of three stages.

original: bzhi pa la ni sa brgyad pa //
analyzed: bzhi pa la ni sa brgyad pa //
translated: The fourth meditation is made up of eight stages.

original: de la bsam gtan dang po ni //
analyzed: de la bsam gtan dang po ni //
translated: The first meditation is threefold:

original: tshangs ris dang / tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don dang / tshangs pa chen po rnams so //
analyzed: tshangs ris dang / tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don dang / tshangs pa chen po rnams so //
translated: Brahmakayika, Brahmapurohita, Mahabrahma.🔽The second meditation is threefold:

original: gnyis pa la 'od chung dang / tshad med 'od dang / @132a * //🔽'od gsal rnams so //
analyzed: gnyis pa la 'od chung dang / tshad med 'od dang / @132a * // 'od gsal rnams so //
translated: Parittabha, Apramanabha, Abhasvara.

original: gsum pa ni /
analyzed: gsum pa ni /
translated: The third meditation is threefold:

original: dge chung dang / tshad med dge dang / dge rgyas rnams so //
analyzed: dge chung dang / tshad med dge dang / dge rgyas rnams so //
translated: Paritta­shubha, Apramanashubha, Shuddhavasa.

original: bzhi pa ni sprin med rnams dang / bsod nams skyes rnams dang / 'bras bu che ba rnams dang / mi che ba dang / mi gdung ba dang / gya nom snang dang // shin tu mthong dang / 'og min rnams te /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni sprin med rnams dang / bsod nams skyes rnams dang / 'bras bu che ba rnams dang / mi che ba dang / mi gdung ba dang / gya nom snang dang // shin tu mthong dang / 'og min rnams te /
translated: The fourth is the Abhasvara gods.

original: de ltar na gnas bcu bdun po 'di dag gnas pa'i sems can dang bcas pa de ni gzugs gyi  khams so //
analyzed: de ltar na gnas bcu bdun po 'di dag gnas pa'i sems can dang bcas pa de ni gzugs gyi  khams so //
translated: Thus, these seventeen abodes together with the sentient beings who dwell there constitute the form realm.

original: gzugs med khams na gnas med de //
analyzed: gzugs med khams na gnas med de //
translated: There is no abode in the formless realm.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa rnams la ni gnas med la /
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa rnams la ni gnas med la /
translated: There is no abode for those who are formless.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang / gzugs can ma yin pa'i chos rnams kyang yul na yang mi gnas phyogs na yang mi gnas zhes bya bar nges so //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang / gzugs can ma yin pa'i chos rnams kyang yul na yang mi gnas phyogs na yang mi gnas zhes bya bar nges so //
translated: It is certain that past, future, nonindicative form, and formless phenomena do not abide in a place or direction.

original: de yang / skye ba la ni de rnams bzhi //
analyzed: de yang / skye ba la ni de rnams bzhi //
translated: Further, they are four in terms of birth.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The formless realm is as follows.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched dang / de dag yul gyi bye brag tu byas nas bla 'og tu yod pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched dang / de dag yul gyi bye brag tu byas nas bla 'og tu yod pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: They are not arranged in a vertical order, one above the other, according to their object.

original: yul gang du snyoms par 'jug pa de rnyed pa nyid du shi 'phos nas de nyid du skye la /
analyzed: yul gang du snyoms par 'jug pa de rnyed pa nyid du shi 'phos nas de nyid du skye la /
translated: When one enters into meditative attainment on a certain object, one is reborn in the place where this object is found, and one dies there.

original: de nas shi 'phos pa na yang de nyid du srid ba bar ma mngon par grub bo //
analyzed: de nas shi 'phos pa na yang de nyid du srid ba bar ma mngon par grub bo //
translated: When one dies there, the intermediate existence manifests itself there.

original: ji ltar sems can gzugs can rnams gzugs la brten nas sems kyi rgyud rnam ba bzhin du gzugs med pa rnams kyi rgyud ci la brten te gnas she na /🔽der ni ris dang srog dag la //🔽sems kyi rgyud ni nges par brten //
analyzed: ji ltar sems can gzugs can rnams gzugs la brten nas sems kyi rgyud rnam ba bzhin du gzugs med pa rnams kyi rgyud ci la brten te gnas she na / der ni ris dang srog dag la // sems kyi rgyud ni nges par brten //
translated: In the same way that the stream of thought of sentient beings with form is supported on form, on what is the stream of thought of the formless ones supported?🔽The stream of thought of the formless ones is supported on the class and on life.

original: ris mthun pa dang srog gi dbang po las de dag gi sems dang sems las byung ba'i rgyud brten te gnas so //
analyzed: ris mthun pa dang srog gi dbang po las de dag gi sems dang sems las byung ba'i rgyud brten te gnas so //
translated: The stream of thought of the formless ones is supported on the class and on the vitality faculty.

original: khams gsum pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: khams gsum pa bshad zin to //
translated: The three realms have been explained.

original: dmyal sogs 'gro lnga de dag tu //
analyzed: dmyal sogs 'gro lnga de dag tu //
translated: The five destinies are the destinies of hell beings, animals, ghosts,

original: rang gi ming gis smos so //
analyzed: rang gi ming gis smos so //
translated: gods, and humans.

original: dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags dang / lha dang mi zhes bya ba rang gi ming gis smos pa ni de dag tu 'gro ba lngar bshad do //
analyzed: dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags dang / lha dang mi zhes bya ba rang gi ming gis smos pa ni de dag tu 'gro ba lngar bshad do //
translated: The destinies of hell beings, animals, ghosts, gods, and humans are the five destinies.

original: gang gi phyir khams dag tu'o zhes bshad na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir khams dag tu'o zhes bshad na /
translated: The realms have been explained.

original: ci 'gro ba las ma gtogs pa'i khams zhig yod dam zhe na yod de /
analyzed: ci 'gro ba las ma gtogs pa'i khams zhig yod dam zhe na yod de /
translated: Are there realms that are not destinies?

original: khams rnams ni dge ba dang / nyon mongs pa can dang / snod dang / srid pa bar ma'i rang bzhin yang yin gyi 'gro ba gang yin pa de dag / nyon mongs can min lung bstan min //
analyzed: khams rnams ni dge ba dang / nyon mongs pa can dang / snod dang / srid pa bar ma'i rang bzhin yang yin gyi 'gro ba gang yin pa de dag / nyon mongs can min lung bstan min //
translated: There are, because the realms are of five types: wholesome, afflicted, physical cosmos, intermediate existence, and unobscured non-defined.🔽The five destinies are unobscured non-defined.

original: sems can zhes bya bar srid min //
analyzed: sems can zhes bya bar srid min //
translated: They are not wholesome or afflicted.

original: 'gro ba lnga ni ma @132b bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'gro ba lnga ni ma @132b bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa nyid do //
translated: The five destinies are unobscured non-defined avyakṛta.

original: de lta ma yin na 'gro ba 'chol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'gro ba 'chol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If they were wholesome or afflicted, the destinies would be confused.

original: sems can zhes bya ba nyid yin yang srid pa bar ma'i rang bzhin ma yin no //
analyzed: sems can zhes bya ba nyid yin yang srid pa bar ma'i rang bzhin ma yin no //
translated: The sentient beings who are in the intermediate existence are not included in the seven stations of consciousness.🔽There are sentient beings who have different bodies and different ideas.

original: lus dang 'du shes tha dad dang // tha dad lus dang 'du shes 'dra //
analyzed: lus dang 'du shes tha dad dang // tha dad lus dang 'du shes 'dra //
translated: There are sentient beings who have different bodies and the same ideas.🔽There are sentient beings who have the same bodies and different ideas.

original: bzlog dang lus dang 'du shes ni //🔽'dra dang gzugs med gsum po dag / rnam shes gnas pa bdun zhes mdo las gsungs pa ni 'gro ba lnga pa'i khams gsum pa 'di nyid du rim bzhin du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bzlog dang lus dang 'du shes ni // 'dra dang gzugs med gsum po dag / rnam shes gnas pa bdun zhes mdo las gsungs pa ni 'gro ba lnga pa'i khams gsum pa 'di nyid du rim bzhin du rig par bya ste /
translated: There are sentient beings who have the same bodies and the same ideas.

original: sems can gzugs can la lus tha dad cing /
analyzed: sems can gzugs can la lus tha dad cing /
translated: There are sentient beings who are not included in the above categories.

original: 'du shes tha dad pa yang yod de /
analyzed: 'du shes tha dad pa yang yod de /
translated: These are the seven stations of consciousness.

original: 'di lta ste mi rnams dang / lha kha cig go //
analyzed: 'di lta ste mi rnams dang / lha kha cig go //
translated: The first station of consciousness is made up of humans and certain gods.🔽The second station of consciousness is made up of the Brahmakāyikas who are born in the first meditation, with the exception of the Pratapana gods.🔽The third station of consciousness is made up of the Pratapana gods.🔽The fourth station of consciousness is made up of the Sudarśanas.🔽The fifth station of consciousness is made up of the Sudarśanas.

original: 'di ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa dang po'o //🔽lha kha cig ces bya ba de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa dang po'o // lha kha cig ces bya ba de dag gang zhe na /
translated: The sixth station of consciousness is made up of the Ābhāsvaras.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams dang // bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa rnams las dang por skyes pa ma gtogs pa rnams so //🔽de dag gi lus tha dad pa'i phyir ba'am //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams dang // bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa rnams las dang por skyes pa ma gtogs pa rnams so //🔽de dag gi lus tha dad pa'i phyir ba'am //
translated: The seventh station of consciousness is made up of the sentient beings who are in the intermediate existence, the sentient beings who are born in the realm of fine-materiality and the sentient beings who are born in the realm of immateriality.

original: de dag gi lus tha dad pas na lus tha dad pa ste /
analyzed: de dag gi lus tha dad pas na lus tha dad pa ste /
translated: They are different bodies because their bodies are not the same.

original: kha dog dang / rtags dang / dbyibs du ma'i phyir ro //🔽'du shes du ma'i phyir 'du shes tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: kha dog dang / rtags dang / dbyibs du ma'i phyir ro // 'du shes du ma'i phyir 'du shes tha dad pa'o //
translated: They are different colors, different signs, and different shapes.

original: de 'di dag la yod pas 'du shes tha dad pa ste /
analyzed: de 'di dag la yod pas 'du shes tha dad pa ste /
translated: They are different perceptions because their perceptions are not the same.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin par 'du shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin par 'du shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They have different perceptions because they have perceptions of pleasure, pain, and neither pleasure nor pain.

original: sems can gzugs can la lus tha dad cing 'du shes 'dra ba yang yod de /
analyzed: sems can gzugs can la lus tha dad cing 'du shes 'dra ba yang yod de /
translated: There are sentient beings who have different bodies but the same perception.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: tshangs ris kyi lha gang dag dang por byung ba de dag go //
analyzed: tshangs ris kyi lha gang dag dang por byung ba de dag go //
translated: the gods of the first meditative absorption.

original: 'di ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa gnyis pa ste /🔽dang por byung ba de dag thams cad ni 'di snyam du bdag cag ni tshangs pa 'dis phyung ngo snyam du 'du shes par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa gnyis pa ste / dang por byung ba de dag thams cad ni 'di snyam du bdag cag ni tshangs pa 'dis phyung ngo snyam du 'du shes par 'gyur la /
translated: This is the second abode of consciousness.🔽All those who first appear there have the perception, “We have been born through this Brahma.”

original: tshangs pa yang 'di snyam du 'di dag ni bdag gis phyung ngo snyam du sems te /
analyzed: tshangs pa yang 'di snyam du 'di dag ni bdag gis phyung ngo snyam du sems te /
translated: And Brahma thinks, “They have been born through me.”

original: 'du shes kyi rgyu tha mi dad pa'i phyir 'du shes 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: 'du shes kyi rgyu tha mi dad pa'i phyir 'du shes 'dra ba'o //
