translated: They have the same ideation because the cause of ideation is not differentiated.

original: tshangs pa ni chu zheng dang lus kyi sha tshugs dang tshig tu brjod pa dang / bgo ba'i gos gzhan pa nyid yin la de'i 'khor yang gzhan pas na lus tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa ni chu zheng dang lus kyi sha tshugs dang tshig tu brjod pa dang / bgo ba'i gos gzhan pa nyid yin la de'i 'khor yang gzhan pas na lus tha dad pa'o //
translated: Brahma has a different body, for his body, his voice, his clothing and his ornaments are different from those of his retinue.

original: sems can gzugs can la lus 'dra zhig 'du shes tha dad pa yang yod de /
analyzed: sems can gzugs can la lus 'dra zhig 'du shes tha dad pa yang yod de /
translated: There are sentient beings who have a different body and the same ideation.

original: 'di lta ste 'od gsal gyi lha rnams so //
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'od gsal gyi lha rnams so //
translated: They are the Abhasvara gods.

original: 'di ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third station of consciousness.

original: 'dir ni mtha' smos pas bsam gtan gnyis pa mtha' dag smos par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni mtha' smos pas bsam gtan gnyis pa mtha' dag smos par rig par bya ste /
translated: Here, the expression “up to” should be understood as meaning “in its entirety,” for the second meditation is not divided up.

original: de ltar ma yin na 'od chung dang / tshad med 'od @133a * //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na 'od chung dang / tshad med 'od @133a * //
translated: Otherwise, one would have to attribute the Abhasvara gods to the third station of consciousness.

original: rnams gang gi rnam par shes pa gnas par rnam par gzhag de la kha dog dang / rtags dang / dbyibs tha mi dad pa'i phyir lus 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: rnams gang gi rnam par shes pa gnas par rnam par gzhag de la kha dog dang / rtags dang / dbyibs tha mi dad pa'i phyir lus 'dra ba'o //
translated: They have the same ideation because their ideation, which is caused by color, sign and shape, is not differentiated.

original: bde bar 'du shes pa'i phyir ba dang bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin par 'du shes pa'i phyir 'du shes tha dad pa ste /
analyzed: bde bar 'du shes pa'i phyir ba dang bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin par 'du shes pa'i phyir 'du shes tha dad pa ste /
translated: Because they have the perception of pleasure, they have different perceptions because they have the perception of neither pleasure nor pain.

original: de dag ni dngos gzhi'i sa la yid bde ba'i dbang pos yongs su skyo nas /
analyzed: de dag ni dngos gzhi'i sa la yid bde ba'i dbang pos yongs su skyo nas /
translated: They are weary of the faculty of mental satisfaction on the level of the actual basis and

original: nyer bsdogs la btang snyoms kyi dbang po mngon sum du byed do //
analyzed: nyer bsdogs la btang snyoms kyi dbang po mngon sum du byed do //
translated: they manifest the faculty of equanimity on the access level.

original: nyer bsdogs kyi btang snyoms kyi dbang pos yongs su skyo nas ni yang dngos gzhi'i sa'i yid bde ba'i dbang po mngon du byed de /
analyzed: nyer bsdogs kyi btang snyoms kyi dbang pos yongs su skyo nas ni yang dngos gzhi'i sa'i yid bde ba'i dbang po mngon du byed de /
translated: They are weary of the faculty of equanimity on the access level and they manifest the faculty of mental satisfaction on the level of the actual basis.

original: de'i phyir de dag 'du shes tha dad pa'o zhes grag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag 'du shes tha dad pa'o zhes grag go //
translated: Therefore it is said that they have different perceptions.

original: yang na 'od gsal ba'i lha'i ris na sems can yang gang dag skyes nas ring po ma lon pa 'jig rten 'di 'jig pa la mi mkhas shing chags pa la mi mkhas pa de dag me lce de mthong nas skrag ste /
analyzed: yang na 'od gsal ba'i lha'i ris na sems can yang gang dag skyes nas ring po ma lon pa 'jig rten 'di 'jig pa la mi mkhas shing chags pa la mi mkhas pa de dag me lce de mthong nas skrag ste /
translated: Or, in the realm of luminous gods, sentient beings who have been born for a long time are skilled in the destruction of this world and skilled in attachment.

original: me lce des tshangs pa'i gzhal med khang stong pa bsregs nas 'dir 'ong bar mi 'gyur ram zhes yi chad cing skyo bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me lce des tshangs pa'i gzhal med khang stong pa bsregs nas 'dir 'ong bar mi 'gyur ram zhes yi chad cing skyo bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But the flame will not come here to burn the empty palace of Brahma.🔽 Among the gods of the realm of the luminous heavens, there are some beings who, having been born there a long time ago, are skilled in the destruction of the world and skilled in attachment. They comfort the frightened beings, saying: Friends, do not be afraid!

original: de la 'od gsal ba'i lha'i ris nas sems can gang dag skyes nas ring du lon pa 'jig rten 'di'i 'jig pa la mkhas shing chags pa la mkhas pa de dag sems can skrag pa de dag la grogs po dag ma 'jigs shig / me lce 'di ni
analyzed: de la 'od gsal ba'i lha'i ris nas sems can gang dag skyes nas ring du lon pa 'jig rten 'di'i 'jig pa la mkhas shing chags pa la mkhas pa de dag sems can skrag pa de dag la grogs po dag ma 'jigs shig / me lce 'di ni
translated: This flame,

original: sngon yang tshangs pa'i gzhal med khang stong pa bsregs nas de nyid du med par gyur to zhes dbugs 'byin par byed do //
analyzed: sngon yang tshangs pa'i gzhal med khang stong pa bsregs nas de nyid du med par gyur to zhes dbugs 'byin par byed do //
translated: having burned the empty palace of Brahma, will disappear right there.

original: de bas na de dag me lce 'ong ba dang / ldog par 'du shes pa'i phyir ba dang / skrag pa dang mi skrag bar 'du shes pa'i phyir 'du shes tha dad ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de dag me lce 'ong ba dang / ldog par 'du shes pa'i phyir ba dang / skrag pa dang mi skrag bar 'du shes pa'i phyir 'du shes tha dad ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, because they perceive the coming and going of the flame, and because they perceive fear and non-fear, it is said that they have different perceptions.

original: sems can gzugs can la lus 'dra zhing 'du shes 'dra ba yang yod de /
analyzed: sems can gzugs can la lus 'dra zhing 'du shes 'dra ba yang yod de /
translated: There are beings who have form, with the same body and the same perception.

original: 'di lta ste dge rgyas kyi lha rnams so //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dge rgyas kyi lha rnams so //
translated: The gods of the Excellent Radiance.

original: 'di ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: This is the fourth station of consciousness.

original: 'du shes 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni bde bar 'du shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni bde bar 'du shes pa'o //
translated: The gods of the same ideation are those who have the ideation of pleasure.

original: de ltar na gzugs med pa gsum po mdo las ji skad gsungs pa dang / bdun po de dag ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa bdun no //
analyzed: de ltar na gzugs med pa gsum po mdo las ji skad gsungs pa dang / bdun po de dag ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa bdun no //
translated: Thus, the three formless stations are as described in the sutra, and these seven are the seven stations of consciousness.

original: ci'i phyir lhag ma rnams rnam par shes pa gnas pas ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir lhag ma rnams rnam par shes pa gnas pas ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why are the remaining stations not stations of consciousness?

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because

original: lhag ma / de yongs de bye ldan /
analyzed: lhag ma / de yongs de bye ldan /
translated: the remaining ones are not exclusively that.

original: lhag ma gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: lhag ma gang zhig ce na /
translated: What are the remaining ones?

original: ngan 'gro rnams dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / srid pa'i rtse mo ste /
analyzed: ngan 'gro rnams dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / srid pa'i rtse mo ste /
translated: The unfortunate destinies, the fourth meditation, and the peak of cyclic existence.

original: 'di dag ni rnam par @133b shes pa yongs su dbye ba yod pas de'i phyir de dag ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag ni rnam par @133b shes pa yongs su dbye ba yod pas de'i phyir de dag ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: These are not stations of consciousness because consciousness is divided in them.

original: yongs su dbye ba zhes bya ba ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: yongs su dbye ba zhes bya ba ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is meant by divided?

original: gang gi rnam par shes pa yongs su 'jig par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi rnam par shes pa yongs su 'jig par byed pa ste /
translated: That in which consciousness is destroyed.

original: de la ngan song dag na ni tshor ba yongs su 'byed de /
analyzed: de la ngan song dag na ni tshor ba yongs su 'byed de /
translated: In the lower rebirths, feeling is fully differentiated.🔽

original: gnod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the unfortunate destinies, the distinction of feeling is due to the fact that they are painful.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa dag na ni 'du shes med pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa dag na ni 'du shes med pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: In the fourth meditation, it is the attainment of non-perception and the attainment of the cessation of ideation and sensation.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo na ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo na ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
translated: In the summit of cyclic existence, it is the attainment of cessation.

original: sems kyi rgyun chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyun chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the stream of consciousness is interrupted.

original: yang smras pa /🔽gang du 'di na gnas ba rnams ni 'gro bar 'dod la /
analyzed: yang smras pa / gang du 'di na gnas ba rnams ni 'gro bar 'dod la /
translated: Another explanation is as follows:

original: de na gnas pa rnams ni 'pho bar mi 'dod pa de ni rnam par shes pa gnas par bshad na /
analyzed: de na gnas pa rnams ni 'pho bar mi 'dod pa de ni rnam par shes pa gnas par bshad na /
translated: The place where those who are here desire to go and where those who are there do not desire to fall is said to be a station of consciousness.

original: ngan song dag na ni gnyi ga med do //
analyzed: ngan song dag na ni gnyi ga med do //
translated: In the unfortunate destinies, neither of these two conditions is met.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa dag na ni sems can rnams 'pho ba'i yid kyi so so'i skye bo rnams ni 'du shes med par 'jug 'dod la /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa dag na ni sems can rnams 'pho ba'i yid kyi so so'i skye bo rnams ni 'du shes med par 'jug 'dod la /
translated: In the fourth meditation, ordinary worldlings who are about to transmigrate desire to enter the attainment of non-perception.

original: 'phags pa rnams ni gnas gtsang mar ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams ni gnas gtsang mar ro //
translated: The noble ones desire to go to the pure abodes.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo ni rgyu ba mi gsal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo ni rgyu ba mi gsal ba'i phyir te /
translated: In the summit of cyclic existence, the movement of thought is not clear.

original: de dag ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa zhes mi bya'o //
translated: These are not called stations of consciousness.🔽The seven stations of consciousness have been explained.

original: rnam par shes pa gnas pa bdun po ji skad bshad pa de dag dang / srid rtse dang / 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gnas pa bdun po ji skad bshad pa de dag dang / srid rtse dang / 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams //
translated: The summit of existence and the sentient beings of the realm of immateriality

original: sems can gyi ni gnas dgur bshad //
analyzed: sems can gyi ni gnas dgur bshad //
translated: are the nine abodes of sentient beings.

original: 'di dag tu sems can rang dgar kun du gnas pas so //
analyzed: 'di dag tu sems can rang dgar kun du gnas pas so //
translated: Sentient beings dwell there spontaneously.

original: gnas dang mi 'dod phyir gzhan min //
analyzed: gnas dang mi 'dod phyir gzhan min //
translated: The other abodes are not mentioned because they are not desirable.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba gang dag cig ce na /
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba gang dag cig ce na /
translated: What are the other abodes?

original: ngan song rnams te /
analyzed: ngan song rnams te /
translated: The unfortunate planes of existence.

original: de dag tu ni sems can rnams mi 'dod bzhin du las kyi srin pos kun du gnas su 'jug go //
analyzed: de dag tu ni sems can rnams mi 'dod bzhin du las kyi srin pos kun du gnas su 'jug go //
translated: Sentient beings are constrained to dwell there by the demon of action, against their will.

original: de bas na ma dad pa bzhin du gnas pas de dag ni sems can gyi gnas ma yin te /🔽btson ra bzhin no //
analyzed: de bas na ma dad pa bzhin du gnas pas de dag ni sems can gyi gnas ma yin te / btson ra bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, since they dwell there as in a prison, against their will, they are not abodes of sentient beings.

original: mdo gzhan dag las ni gnas ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa bdun zhes gsungs so //🔽gzhan dag las ni /🔽gnas pa dag ni yang bzhi ste //
analyzed: mdo gzhan dag las ni gnas ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa bdun zhes gsungs so // gzhan dag las ni / gnas pa dag ni yang bzhi ste //
translated: In other sūtras, the Blessed One has taught that there are four abodes of sentient beings.🔽What are these four?

original: zhes bya ba gsungs pa la bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs pa la bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: The first is the abode of sentient beings who are undetermined.🔽The second is the abode of sentient beings who are determined.🔽The third is the abode of sentient beings who are not destined.🔽The fourth is the abode of sentient beings who are destined.

original: rnam par shes pa gnas pas gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba dang / tshor bar nye bar 'gro ba dang / 'du shes su nye bar 'gro ba dang / 'du byed du nye bar 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gnas pas gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba dang / tshor bar nye bar 'gro ba dang / 'du shes su nye bar 'gro ba dang / 'du byed du nye bar 'gro ba'o //
translated: The four stations of consciousness are the station of consciousness that occurs in relation to form, the station of consciousness that occurs in relation to sensation, the station of consciousness that occurs in relation to conceptualization, and the station of consciousness that occurs in relation to the karmic forces.

original: de dag gi rang bzhin ci zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gi rang bzhin ci zhe na /
translated: What is their intrinsic nature?

original: de dag ni rim bzhin du /
analyzed: de dag ni rim bzhin du /
translated: They are, respectively,

original: zag bcas phung bo bzhi rnams so //
analyzed: zag bcas phung bo bzhi rnams so //
translated: the four impure aggregates.

original: de dag kyang rang gi sa pa nyid /
analyzed: de dag kyang rang gi sa pa nyid /
translated: They are of the same stage as the consciousness that occurs in relation to them.

original: sa gzhan dag tu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sa gzhan dag tu ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not of other stages.

original: @134a * // ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: @134a * // ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: gnas pa ni rten yin na /
analyzed: gnas pa ni rten yin na /
translated: The station is the support of the consciousness.

original: skal ba mi mnyam pa'i sa'i phung po la ni rnam par shes pa mi rten to //
analyzed: skal ba mi mnyam pa'i sa'i phung po la ni rnam par shes pa mi rten to //
translated: Consciousness does not occur in the aggregates of other stages.

original: ci'i phyir rnam par shes pa la rnam par shes pa gnas pa zhes mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnam par shes pa la rnam par shes pa gnas pa zhes mi bya zhe na /
translated: Why is the station of consciousness not called the station of consciousness in consciousness?

original: gnas pa po yongs su spangs pa ni gnas pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnas pa po yongs su spangs pa ni gnas pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the station is the support of the consciousness, and the supported is not the support.

original: gnas pa po nyid la gnas pa zhes mi bya ste /
analyzed: gnas pa po nyid la gnas pa zhes mi bya ste /
translated: The supported is not called the station of the support.

original: dper na rgyal po nyid rgyal po'i stan ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rgyal po nyid rgyal po'i stan ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the king is not the throne.

original: 'on kyang bye brag tu ma phyed na ni skye ba'i skye mched kyis bsdus pa'i phung po dag tu mngon par dga' ba dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa 'jug pa la ni rnam par shes pa'i gnas pa rnam par shes pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang bye brag tu ma phyed na ni skye ba'i skye mched kyis bsdus pa'i phung po dag tu mngon par dga' ba dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa 'jug pa la ni rnam par shes pa'i gnas pa rnam par shes pa yin no //
translated: But if one does not distinguish them, the consciousness that is associated with delight in the aggregates included in the place of rebirth is the station of consciousness.

original: so sor dbye na ni /
analyzed: so sor dbye na ni /
translated: If one distinguishes them,

original: ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa ni rnam par shes pa kun nas nyon mongs par byed par 'gyur gyi rnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa ni rnam par shes pa kun nas nyon mongs par byed par 'gyur gyi rnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no //
translated: form, etc., are the stations of consciousness, because they are the cause of the defilement of consciousness, but consciousness alone is not.

original: de bas rnam par shes pa gnas pa bzhi dag tu /
analyzed: de bas rnam par shes pa gnas pa bzhi dag tu /
translated: Therefore, in the four stations of consciousness,

original: rnam shes / 'ba' zhig gnas par ma bshad do //
analyzed: rnam shes / 'ba' zhig gnas par ma bshad do //
translated: consciousness alone is not said to be the station.

original: yang bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par shes pa gnas pa bzhi ni zhing gi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: yang bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par shes pa gnas pa bzhi ni zhing gi ngo bo'o //
translated: Moreover, the four stations of consciousness are the nature of the field,🔽and the consciousness that appropriates is the nature of the seed.

original: nye bar len pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa zad par ni sa bon gyi ngo bo zhes gsungs pa'i dgongs pa yang /
analyzed: nye bar len pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa zad par ni sa bon gyi ngo bo zhes gsungs pa'i dgongs pa yang /
translated: This is the intention of the statement.

original: sa bon nyid sa bon gyi zhing gi ngo bor rnam par gzhag par gyur pa ni ma yin par snang ngo //
analyzed: sa bon nyid sa bon gyi zhing gi ngo bor rnam par gzhag par gyur pa ni ma yin par snang ngo //
translated: It is not that the seed itself is posited as the nature of the field of the seed.

original: yang ci rnam par shes pa gnas pa bzhis bdun bsdus sam bdun gyis bzhi zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci rnam par shes pa gnas pa bzhis bdun bsdus sam bdun gyis bzhi zhe na /
translated: Are the four abodes of consciousness included in the seven or are the seven included in the four?

original: bdun gyis bzhi yang ma yin la /
analyzed: bdun gyis bzhi yang ma yin la /
translated: The seven are not included in the four,

original: bzhis kyang bdun ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bzhis kyang bdun ma yin gyi /
translated: nor are the four included in the seven.

original: bsdu ba dag ni mu bzhi yin //
analyzed: bsdu ba dag ni mu bzhi yin //
translated: The inclusion of the four and the seven is fourfold.

original: bsdu ba spyad na mu bzhir rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bsdu ba spyad na mu bzhir rig par bya ste /
translated: If the inclusion of the four and the seven is considered, it should be understood as being fourfold.

original: bdun gyis bsdus la bzhis ma yin pa yang yod de zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdun gyis bsdus la bzhis ma yin pa yang yod de zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: There is inclusion in the seven but not in the four, and so on.

original: dang po ni bdun dag tu rnam par shes pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dang po ni bdun dag tu rnam par shes pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The first is the consciousness that is included in the seven.

original: gnyis pa ni ngan song dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / srid pa'i rtse mo dag tu rnam par shes pa ma gtogs pa'i phung po rnams so //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni ngan song dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / srid pa'i rtse mo dag tu rnam par shes pa ma gtogs pa'i phung po rnams so //
translated: The second is the aggregates, with the exception of consciousness, that are included in the unfortunate realms, the fourth absorption, and the peak of existence.

original: gsum pa ni bdun dag tu phung po bzhi rnams so //
analyzed: gsum pa ni bdun dag tu phung po bzhi rnams so //
translated: The third is the four aggregates that are included in the seven.

original: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: The fourth is the aggregates that are not included in the above three categories.

original: gang yang 'gro ba la sogs pa'i bye brag tha dad pa 'di dag khams gsum par bshad pa /🔽der ni mngal nas skyes la sogs //
analyzed: gang yang 'gro ba la sogs pa'i bye brag tha dad pa 'di dag khams gsum par bshad pa / der ni mngal nas skyes la sogs //
translated: The different types of beings, such as those who go upright, etc., are explained as being in the three realms.

original: sems can skye gnas bzhi dag tu //🔽rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sems can skye gnas bzhi dag tu // rig par bya ste /
translated: In the three realms, there are four modes of birth.🔽The four modes of birth are🔽the womb, the egg, moisture, and spontaneous birth.

original: sgo nga'i skye gnas las skye ba dang / mngal nas skye ba rnams dang / drod gsher las skye ba rnams dang / rdzus te skye ba rnams kyi gnas so //
analyzed: sgo nga'i skye gnas las skye ba dang / mngal nas skye ba rnams dang / drod gsher las skye ba rnams dang / rdzus te skye ba rnams kyi gnas so //
translated: The four modes of birth are the womb, the egg, moisture, and spontaneous birth.

original: skye gnas zhes bya ba ni 'dir @134b sems can rnams thun mong du 'dres shing 'chol bar skye ba'i phyir ro //🔽sgo nga'i skye gnas las skye ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: skye gnas zhes bya ba ni 'dir @134b sems can rnams thun mong du 'dres shing 'chol bar skye ba'i phyir ro // sgo nga'i skye gnas las skye ba gang zhe na /
translated: The womb is the place where sentient beings are born who are born from a womb.🔽The egg is the place where sentient beings are born who are born from an egg.🔽Moisture is the place where sentient beings are born who are born from moisture.🔽Spontaneous birth is the place where sentient beings are born who are born spontaneously.

original: sems can gang dag sgo nga las skye ba rnams te /
analyzed: sems can gang dag sgo nga las skye ba rnams te /
translated: What is birth from the womb?🔽It is birth from a womb.🔽What is birth from an egg?

original: 'di lta ste /🔽dang ba dang / khrung khrung dang / rma bya dang / ne tso dang / ri skegs la sogs pa'o //🔽mngal gyi skye gnas las skye ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / dang ba dang / khrung khrung dang / rma bya dang / ne tso dang / ri skegs la sogs pa'o // mngal gyi skye gnas las skye ba gang zhe na /
translated: It is birth from an egg.🔽What is birth from moisture?🔽It is birth from moisture.

original: sems can gang dag mngal nas skye ba rnams te /
analyzed: sems can gang dag mngal nas skye ba rnams te /
translated: What is spontaneous birth?🔽It is birth without any medium.

original: 'di lta ste glang po dang / rta dang / bong bu dang / phag la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste glang po dang / rta dang / bong bu dang / phag la sogs pa'o //
translated: They are elephants, horses, donkeys, oxen, camels, goats, sheep, and so on.

original: drod gsher las skye ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: drod gsher las skye ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is birth from moisture?

original: sems can gang dag 'byung ba'i drod gsher las skye ba rnams te /
analyzed: sems can gang dag 'byung ba'i drod gsher las skye ba rnams te /
translated: It is birth from the fermenting of organic substances.

original: 'di lta ste srin bu dang / grog sbur dang / sprang bu dang / phye ma leb la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste srin bu dang / grog sbur dang / sprang bu dang / phye ma leb la sogs pa'o //
translated: They are insects, ants, bees, butterflies, and so on.

original: rdzus te 'byung ba'i skye gnas gang zhe na /
analyzed: rdzus te 'byung ba'i skye gnas gang zhe na /
translated: What is spontaneous birth?

original: sems can gang dag dbang po tshang ba dang / ngan pa ma yin pa dang / yan lag dang nyid lag thams cad dang ldan par cig car du skye ba rnams so //🔽de'i phyir de ni skye ba na mdzes pa'i phyir rdzus te byung ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems can gang dag dbang po tshang ba dang / ngan pa ma yin pa dang / yan lag dang nyid lag thams cad dang ldan par cig car du skye ba rnams so // de'i phyir de ni skye ba na mdzes pa'i phyir rdzus te byung ba zhes bya ste /
translated: It is birth of beings who are complete and not incomplete, with all their organs, without deficiency, all at once, not gradually, except for the wheel-turning kings and the great enlightening beings.

original: 'di lta ste lha dang / dmyal ba dang / srid pa bar ma la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste lha dang / dmyal ba dang / srid pa bar ma la sogs pa'o //
translated: They are the gods, hell-beings, and the intermediate beings.

original: yang 'gro ba gang dag la skye gnas du zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: yang 'gro ba gang dag la skye gnas du zhig yod ce na /
translated: In which destinies are the different kinds of birth found?

original: smras pa / mi dang dud 'gro'i rnam pa bzhi //
analyzed: smras pa / mi dang dud 'gro'i rnam pa bzhi //
translated: In the human destiny and the animal destiny all four kinds of birth are found.

original: mi rnams kyi rnam bzhi la sgo nga las skye ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mi rnams kyi rnam bzhi la sgo nga las skye ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Humans are born from eggs, such as

original: ri brags dang / nye ba'i ri brags gnyis khrung khrung las skyes pa dang / ri dags 'dzin gyi ma'i bu sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / rgyal po lnga len gyi bu lnga brgya rnams so //
analyzed: ri brags dang / nye ba'i ri brags gnyis khrung khrung las skyes pa dang / ri dags 'dzin gyi ma'i bu sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / rgyal po lnga len gyi bu lnga brgya rnams so //
translated: the two, the son of the sage and the son of the sage's disciple, born from a crane's egg, the thirty-two sons of Mṛgajā, the mother of Mṛgajā, and the five hundred sons of King Pañcaśatika.

original: mngal nas skye ba ni da ltar gyi rnams so //
analyzed: mngal nas skye ba ni da ltar gyi rnams so //
translated: Humans born from wombs are humans of the present.

original: drod gsher las skye ba ni /
analyzed: drod gsher las skye ba ni /
translated: Humans born from heat and moisture

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: are as follows.

original: nga las nu dang / mdzes pa dang / nye mdzes dang / thi ba'i phreng ba can /
analyzed: nga las nu dang / mdzes pa dang / nye mdzes dang / thi ba'i phreng ba can /
translated: Manu, Sundara, Upa-sundara, and Kapiñjala-mālā,

original: aa mra skyong ma la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: aa mra skyong ma la sogs pa'o //
translated: Āmrapālī, and so on.

original: rdzus te skye ba ni bskal pa dang po rnams 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: rdzus te skye ba ni bskal pa dang po rnams 'ba' zhig go //
translated: Humans born supernaturally are only those of the first eon.

original: dung 'gro la yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: dung 'gro la yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Animals are of four types.

original: rnam pa gsum ni snang ba nyid do //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum ni snang ba nyid do //
translated: Three types are evident.

original: rdzus te skye ba ni klu dang nam mkha' lding la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rdzus te skye ba ni klu dang nam mkha' lding la sogs pa'o //
translated: Those born supernaturally are nāgas, garuḍas, and so on.🔽Hell beings, gods, and

original: dmyal ba dang ni lha rnams dang // srid pa bar ma rdzus te skye //
analyzed: dmyal ba dang ni lha rnams dang // srid pa bar ma rdzus te skye //
translated: intermediate beings are born supernaturally.

original: dmyal ba thams cad dang / lha rnams dang / srid pa bar ma ni rdzus te skye ba nyid do //
analyzed: dmyal ba thams cad dang / lha rnams dang / srid pa bar ma ni rdzus te skye ba nyid do //
translated: All hell beings and all gods and all intermediate beings are born supernaturally.

original: yi dags mngal nas skye ba'ang yin //
analyzed: yi dags mngal nas skye ba'ang yin //
translated: Pretas are born from a womb.

original: 'ang gi sgras ni rdzus te skye ba'ang yin te /
analyzed: 'ang gi sgras ni rdzus te skye ba'ang yin te /
translated: The word “also” indicates that they are also born supernaturally.

original: tshe dang ldan pa mood gal gyi bu chen po la /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa mood gal gyi bu chen po la /
translated: The elder Maudgalyāyana

original: yi dags mo zhig na re /
analyzed: yi dags mo zhig na re /
translated: was told by a hungry ghost:

original: bdag ni mtshan mo yang bu lnga /🔽de bzhin du nyin mo yang bu lnga skyes nas zos kyang bdag de dag gis yongs su tshim pa @135a * //
analyzed: bdag ni mtshan mo yang bu lnga / de bzhin du nyin mo yang bu lnga skyes nas zos kyang bdag de dag gis yongs su tshim pa @135a * //
translated: “At night five sons are born to me and

original: med do zhes smras pa'o //
analyzed: med do zhes smras pa'o //
translated: I eat them, and in the same way five sons are born to me during the day, but I am not satisfied with eating them.”

original: yang skye gnas thams cad kyi nang na mang ba gang zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: yang skye gnas thams cad kyi nang na mang ba gang zhe na smras pa /
translated: What is the most numerous of the modes of birth?

original: rdzus te skye ba nyid de /
analyzed: rdzus te skye ba nyid de /
translated: The answer is: The mode of miraculous birth is the most numerous.

original: de ni 'gro ba gnyis dang gsum gyi phyogs dang srid pa bar ma pa thams cad do //
analyzed: de ni 'gro ba gnyis dang gsum gyi phyogs dang srid pa bar ma pa thams cad do //
translated: It is the mode of all intermediate beings and of two or three of the other modes.

original: srid pa bar ma pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ce na /🔽'chi dad skye ba srid gnyis kyi //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ce na / 'chi dad skye ba srid gnyis kyi //
translated: What is an intermediate existence?

original: gang 'dir srid pa bar ma yin //
analyzed: gang 'dir srid pa bar ma yin //
translated: The intermediate existence is that which exists between death and birth.

original: 'chi ba dang skye ba'i srid pa'i bar du lus mngon par 'grub ste /🔽yul gzhan du skye ba thob par bya ba'i phyir 'gro ba'i bar ma yin pas /
analyzed: 'chi ba dang skye ba'i srid pa'i bar du lus mngon par 'grub ste / yul gzhan du skye ba thob par bya ba'i phyir 'gro ba'i bar ma yin pas /
translated: The intermediate existence is the existence that is formed between death existence and birth existence.

original: de ni srid pa bar ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni srid pa bar ma zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called intermediate existence because it is an intermediate existence that goes to the place of birth in order to obtain birth in another place.

original: skyes zin pa 'di ji ltar skyes pa ma yin zhe na /🔽bgrod pa'i yul du ma phyin phyir //
analyzed: skyes zin pa 'di ji ltar skyes pa ma yin zhe na / bgrod pa'i yul du ma phyin phyir //
translated: How can it be said that it is born when it is intermediate?

original: srid pa bar ma skyes pa min //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma skyes pa min //
translated: It is not born because it has not yet arrived at the place where it should go.🔽The intermediate existence is not born because it has not yet arrived at the place where it should go.

original: nye bar song ba ni skye zhes bya ba ni srid pa bar ma 'di ni bgrod pa'i yul du nye bar ma 'ong bas de bas na skyes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nye bar song ba ni skye zhes bya ba ni srid pa bar ma 'di ni bgrod pa'i yul du nye bar ma 'ong bas de bas na skyes pa ma yin no //
translated: It is said that it is born when it has arrived.

original: 'di'i bgrod par bya ba'i yul gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: 'di'i bgrod par bya ba'i yul gang zhig ce na /
translated: What is the place where it should go?

original: gang du rnam par smin pa 'phangs pa mngon zhing rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang du rnam par smin pa 'phangs pa mngon zhing rdzogs pa'o //
translated: It is the place where the projected result of action is actualized and completed.🔽Other schools say that there is no interruption between death existence and birth existence.

original: sde pa gzhan dag na re 'chi ba'i srid pa nas skye ba'i bar chad kyang skye'o zhes pa la de ni mi 'dod do //🔽ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: sde pa gzhan dag na re 'chi ba'i srid pa nas skye ba'i bar chad kyang skye'o zhes pa la de ni mi 'dod do // ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: We do not accept that.🔽Why?

original: rigs pa dang / lung las te /
analyzed: rigs pa dang / lung las te /
translated: Because of reasoning and because of the scriptures.

original: de la re zhig rigs pa la brten nas brjod pa /
analyzed: de la re zhig rigs pa la brten nas brjod pa /
translated: First, the argument based on reason:

original: 'bru yi rgyun dang chos mthun phyir //
analyzed: 'bru yi rgyun dang chos mthun phyir //
translated: Because it is similar to the continuity of a seed,

original: srid pa chad las 'byung ma yin //
analyzed: srid pa chad las 'byung ma yin //
translated: existence does not arise from a severed continuum.

original: rgyun la yod pa'i chos rnams ni rgyun mi 'chad par yul gzhan dag tu 'byung ba mthong ste /
analyzed: rgyun la yod pa'i chos rnams ni rgyun mi 'chad par yul gzhan dag tu 'byung ba mthong ste /
translated: It is seen that phenomena that exist in a continuum arise in other places without the continuum being severed.

original: dper na 'bru'i rgyun lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'bru'i rgyun lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the continuity of a seed.

original: de bas na sems can gyi rgyun 'di la yang rgyun mi 'chad pa yul gzhan dag tu 'byung ba dang ldan no //
analyzed: de bas na sems can gyi rgyun 'di la yang rgyun mi 'chad pa yul gzhan dag tu 'byung ba dang ldan no //
translated: Therefore, this continuum of sentient beings also has the characteristic of arising in other places without the continuum being severed.

original: rgyun chad na yang dper na me long la sogs pa'i nang du gzugs kyi gzugs brnyan 'byung ba yang ma mthong ste /
analyzed: rgyun chad na yang dper na me long la sogs pa'i nang du gzugs kyi gzugs brnyan 'byung ba yang ma mthong ste /
translated: But if the continuum is severed, then for example, the reflection of a form is not seen arising in a mirror, etc.

original: de bzhin du 'chi ba'i srid pa las skye ba'i srid pa'i bar yang srid do zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'chi ba'i srid pa las skye ba'i srid pa'i bar yang srid do zhe na /
translated: In the same way, it is not possible that existence arises from the death existence to the birth existence.

original: gzugs brnyan ma grub pa'i phyir dang / mi 'dra phyir na dpe ma yin //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan ma grub pa'i phyir dang / mi 'dra phyir na dpe ma yin //
translated: Because the reflection is not established and because it is not similar, it is not an example.

original: gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba ni kha dog gzhan pa nyid du yang 'byung bas de ni ma grub po //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba ni kha dog gzhan pa nyid du yang 'byung bas de ni ma grub po //
translated: That which is called a reflection arises as a different color, and therefore it is not established.

original: grub tu zin kyang mi 'dra ba'i phyir dpe ma yin no //
analyzed: grub tu zin kyang mi 'dra ba'i phyir dpe ma yin no //
translated: But the example is not appropriate, because the two cases are not similar.

original: re zhig ji ltar ma grub ce na /
analyzed: re zhig ji ltar ma grub ce na /
translated: How are they not similar?

original: gcig tu lhan cig gnyis med phyir //
analyzed: gcig tu lhan cig gnyis med phyir //
translated: Because two things do not exist in the same place.

original: yul de nyid du me long gi gzugs dang / gzugs brnyan gnyi ga snang du ni rten gyi 'byung ba za dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul de nyid du me long gi gzugs dang / gzugs brnyan gnyi ga snang du ni rten gyi 'byung ba za dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the same place, in the mirror, the form and its reflection appear, because the fundamental material elements that are their supports are not separated from each other.

original: yul gcig tu gzugs gnyis lhan cig pa ni med do //
analyzed: yul gcig tu gzugs gnyis lhan cig pa ni med do //
translated: But two forms do not exist in the same place.

original: de dag tshogs na de 'dra ba'i mthu gang yin @135b pa de bzhin du snang ste /
analyzed: de dag tshogs na de 'dra ba'i mthu gang yin @135b pa de bzhin du snang ste /
translated: When they are combined, the power of the form and the reflection is such that they appear in that way.

original: chos rnams kyi mthu'i bye brag ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi mthu'i bye brag ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The specific power of things is inconceivable.

original: re zhig ma grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'o //
analyzed: re zhig ma grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'o //
translated: This is the way to explain the first reason: because the example does not exist.

original: ji ltar mi 'dra ba'i phyir dpe ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mi 'dra ba'i phyir dpe ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is the example not appropriate because the two cases are not similar?

original: rgyun min phyir /
analyzed: rgyun min phyir /
translated: Because the stream is not the same.

original: gzugs la ni gzugs brnyan gyi rgyun du gyur pa med kyi me long gi rgyun la yod pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: gzugs la ni gzugs brnyan gyi rgyun du gyur pa med kyi me long gi rgyun la yod pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: The stream of the reflection is not the same as the stream of the form, because the stream of the mirror is not the same as the stream of the form.

original: / cig car du yod pa'i phyir 'chi ba dang skye ba'i srid pa ji lta ba bzhin du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: / cig car du yod pa'i phyir 'chi ba dang skye ba'i srid pa ji lta ba bzhin du ni ma yin no //
translated: because they exist simultaneously, not like death and birth.

original: rgyun la rgyun mi 'chad par yul gzhan dag tu 'byung bar brjod gyi  rgyun ma yin pa ni ma yin pas gzugs brnyan gyi dpe ni 'dra ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyun la rgyun mi 'chad par yul gzhan dag tu 'byung bar brjod gyi  rgyun ma yin pa ni ma yin pas gzugs brnyan gyi dpe ni 'dra ba ma yin no //
translated: The stream is said to arise in another place without interruption, not a non-stream. Therefore the example of the reflection is not similar.

original: gnyis las 'byung phyir /
analyzed: gnyis las 'byung phyir /
translated: Because it arises from two.

original: gzugs dang me long dang rgyu gnyis las gzugs brnyan 'byung bar 'gyur ba la /
analyzed: gzugs dang me long dang rgyu gnyis las gzugs brnyan 'byung bar 'gyur ba la /
translated: The reflection arises from two causes: the form and the mirror.

original: gtso bo'i rgyu gang yin pa de la brten te 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gtso bo'i rgyu gang yin pa de la brten te 'byung ngo //
translated: It arises in dependence on the principal cause, which is the form.

original: de bzhin du skye ba'i srid pa ni 'chi ba'i srid pa las gzhan pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du skye ba'i srid pa ni 'chi ba'i srid pa las gzhan pa /
translated: In the same way, the birth existence is not different from the death existence.

original: gtso bo'i rgyu zhig dang rgyu gnyis las byung ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gtso bo'i rgyu zhig dang rgyu gnyis las byung ba ni ma yin te /
translated: It does not arise from two causes, a principal cause and a secondary cause.

original: 'dis kyang dpe mi 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dis kyang dpe mi 'dra ba yin no //
translated: This also shows that the example is not similar.

original: phyi'i khu ba dang khrag la sogs pa sems med pa yang gtso bo'i rgyu zhes bya bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: phyi'i khu ba dang khrag la sogs pa sems med pa yang gtso bo'i rgyu zhes bya bar mi rigs te /
translated: It is not logical that the principal cause is the external semen and blood, etc., which are without mind.

original: gang du rdzus te skye ba rnams nam mkha' la 'byung ba der ci zhig dang rgyu gnyis su brtag / re zhig rigs pa las ni 'chi ba'i srid pa'i bar chad nas skye ba'i srid pa 'byung bar ni da ltar mi 'dod de /
analyzed: gang du rdzus te skye ba rnams nam mkha' la 'byung ba der ci zhig dang rgyu gnyis su brtag / re zhig rigs pa las ni 'chi ba'i srid pa'i bar chad nas skye ba'i srid pa 'byung bar ni da ltar mi 'dod de /
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas do not accept that the intermediate existence arises without interruption between death existence and birth existence.

original: de bas na srid pa bar ma yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na srid pa bar ma yod pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the intermediate existence does exist.

original: yod par mgur nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: yod par mgur nas gsungs pa /
translated: It is stated in the scriptures.

original: srid pa bdun gyi mdo las dmyal ba'i srid pa dang / dud 'gro'i srid pa dang / yi dags kyi srid pa dang / lha'i srid pa dang / mi'i srid pa dang / las kyi srid pa dang / srid pa bar ma'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: srid pa bdun gyi mdo las dmyal ba'i srid pa dang / dud 'gro'i srid pa dang / yi dags kyi srid pa dang / lha'i srid pa dang / mi'i srid pa dang / las kyi srid pa dang / srid pa bar ma'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Sūtra of the Seven Existences declares: “There is the existence of hell beings, the existence of animals, the existence of ghosts, the existence of gods, the existence of humans, the existence of action, and the intermediate existence.”

original: mdo 'di ni de dag mi 'don to zhe na /
analyzed: mdo 'di ni de dag mi 'don to zhe na /
translated: But the Vaibhāṣikas do not recite this sūtra.

original: 'o na dri za zhes bya ba 'di las gnas gsum mngon du gyur na ma'i mngal du bu chags par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na dri za zhes bya ba 'di las gnas gsum mngon du gyur na ma'i mngal du bu chags par 'gyur te /
translated: Well then, what about the statement in the Sūtra on the Trance States: “When three conditions are present, the embryo is formed in the womb of a mother.”

original: ma yang rung bzla mtshan dang ldan pa dang / pha ma chags par gyur pa dang / 'dus pa dang / dri za yang nye bar gnas par gyur na'o zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: ma yang rung bzla mtshan dang ldan pa dang / pha ma chags par gyur pa dang / 'dus pa dang / dri za yang nye bar gnas par gyur na'o zhes gsungs pa /
translated: the gandharva is present.

original: srid pa bar ma ma gtogs pa dri za zhes bya ba gzhan gang zhig yin /
analyzed: srid pa bar ma ma gtogs pa dri za zhes bya ba gzhan gang zhig yin /
translated: What is this gandharva that is mentioned, other than the intermediate existence?

original: phung po zhig par nye bar gnas par 'gyur ro zhes 'don to zhe na /
analyzed: phung po zhig par nye bar gnas par 'gyur ro zhes 'don to zhe na /
translated: The text reads: “The gandharva is present, and the mother and father have desire for each other and unite.”

original: mi rung ste /
analyzed: mi rung ste /
translated: This is unacceptable.

original: rta len gyi bu'i mdo dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rta len gyi bu'i mdo dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it contradicts the Aśvalāyanasūtra.

original: yang de yang mi 'don to zhe na /
analyzed: yang de yang mi 'don to zhe na /
translated: If you do not recite that sūtra,

original: 'o na sngar gsungs pa las phyir mi 'ong ba lnga zhes bya ba 'di las phyir mi 'ong ba bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba zhes gsungs @136a * //
analyzed: 'o na sngar gsungs pa las phyir mi 'ong ba lnga zhes bya ba 'di las phyir mi 'ong ba bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba zhes gsungs @136a * //
translated: then what is the intermediate existence of the nonreturners who are said to attain nirvāṇa in the intermediate state among the five nonreturners mentioned in the sūtra?

original: pa srid pa bar ma med na ji ltar bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur /
analyzed: pa srid pa bar ma med na ji ltar bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur /
translated: If there is no intermediate existence, how could they attain nirvāṇa in the intermediate state?

original: 'gro mdo las /
analyzed: 'gro mdo las /
translated: The Aśvalāyanasūtra says:

original: skyes bu dam pa'i 'gro ba lnga zhes bya ba'i mdo 'di las dus dang yul gyis bskal ba'i bye brag gis bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba gsum ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa'i 'gro ba lnga zhes bya ba'i mdo 'di las dus dang yul gyis bskal ba'i bye brag gis bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba gsum ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: This sutra states that there are three types of intermediate beings who attain nirvana in the intermediate state due to the specific time and place of their birth.

original: me stag mngon par 'grub pa'i mdo bzhin du 'chi bar 'gyur ba de lta bu dang po nyid do //🔽de bzhin du 'di lta ste /🔽lcags kyi tsha tsha gnam du yar ba'i mod nyid du 'chi bar 'gyur ba de lta bu ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: me stag mngon par 'grub pa'i mdo bzhin du 'chi bar 'gyur ba de lta bu dang po nyid do // de bzhin du 'di lta ste / lcags kyi tsha tsha gnam du yar ba'i mod nyid du 'chi bar 'gyur ba de lta bu ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The first are those who attain nirvana as soon as they are born, like a spark that is extinguished as soon as it appears.🔽The second are those who attain nirvana without having had any opportunity to enjoy objects, like an iron spark that is extinguished as soon as it rises into the air.

original: de bzhin du 'di lta ste lcags kyi tsha tsha gnam du yar nas sa la ma ltung ba nyid du 'chi bar 'gyur ba de lta bu ni gsum pa'o zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di lta ste lcags kyi tsha tsha gnam du yar nas sa la ma ltung ba nyid du 'chi bar 'gyur ba de lta bu ni gsum pa'o zhes gsungs pas /
translated: The third are those who attain nirvana without falling to the ground, like an iron spark that is extinguished in the air.

original: de'i phyir 'gro ba'i mdo 'di las kyang srid pa bar ma grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gro ba'i mdo 'di las kyang srid pa bar ma grub bo //
translated: Therefore, this sutra on the five destinies also proves the existence of intermediate beings.

original: yang 'gro ba gang du 'gro bar 'gyur ba na srid pa bar ma'i sha tshugs ji lta bu zhig mngon par 'grub ce na /
analyzed: yang 'gro ba gang du 'gro bar 'gyur ba na srid pa bar ma'i sha tshugs ji lta bu zhig mngon par 'grub ce na /
translated: What is the form of an intermediate being who is going to be born in a certain realm?

original: de ni 'phen pa gcig pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de ni 'phen pa gcig pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is projected by the same action,

original: srid pa phyi ma'i sha tshugs 'gyur //
analyzed: srid pa phyi ma'i sha tshugs 'gyur //
translated: the intermediate existence has the form of the future existence.

original: las gang zhig 'gro ba 'phen pa de nyid 'thob par byed pa'i srid pa bar ma ste /
analyzed: las gang zhig 'gro ba 'phen pa de nyid 'thob par byed pa'i srid pa bar ma ste /
translated: The intermediate existence is the existence that obtains the plane of existence that a certain action projects.

original: de'i phyir 'gro ba gang du 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i 'gro ba der srid pa phyi ma cir 'gyur ba de'i sha tshugs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gro ba gang du 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i 'gro ba der srid pa phyi ma cir 'gyur ba de'i sha tshugs su 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the intermediate existence has the form of the future existence that the being in the intermediate existence will take up.

original: yang srid pa phyi ma zhes bya ba 'di gang zhig ce na /🔽de ni 'chi ba tshun chad nas //
analyzed: yang srid pa phyi ma zhes bya ba 'di gang zhig ce na / de ni 'chi ba tshun chad nas //
translated: What is the future existence?🔽It is the existence after the intermediate existence,

original: skye ba'i skad cig phan chad do //
analyzed: skye ba'i skad cig phan chad do //
translated: from the moment of the second existence up to death.

original: srid pa zhes bya ba ni bye brag med par nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams so //
analyzed: srid pa zhes bya ba ni bye brag med par nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams so //
translated: Existence is the five aggregates without making any distinction.

original: de ni rnam pa bzhir dbye ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa bzhir dbye ste /
translated: It is divided into four categories:🔽intermediate existence, existence at conception, existence as growth, and existence at death.

original: srid pa bar ma ni ji skad du bshad pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma ni ji skad du bshad pa'o //
translated: Intermediate existence is that which has been discussed above.🔽Existence at conception is the first moment in the womb.

original: skye ba'i srid pa ni 'gro ba dag tu nying mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig ma'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i srid pa ni 'gro ba dag tu nying mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig ma'o //
translated: Existence as growth is from the second moment on, up to the moment when the being is born.🔽Existence at death is from birth up to the moment of death.

original: de phan chad 'chi ba'i srid pa ma gtogs pa'i srid pa gzhan thams cad ni srid pa phyi ma'o //
analyzed: de phan chad 'chi ba'i srid pa ma gtogs pa'i srid pa gzhan thams cad ni srid pa phyi ma'o //
translated: The intermediate existence which follows this one is the second existence.

original: skad cig ma tha ma ni 'chi ba'i srid pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma tha ma ni 'chi ba'i srid pa'o //
translated: The last moment of the intermediate existence is the existence at death.

original: gal te sems can gzugs can dag gi nang du skye ba ni de phan chad srid pa bar ma'o //
analyzed: gal te sems can gzugs can dag gi nang du skye ba ni de phan chad srid pa bar ma'o //
translated: If the sentient being is going to be reborn in a realm of form, then the intermediate existence is followed by an intermediate existence.

original: srid pa bar ma de ni /
analyzed: srid pa bar ma de ni /
translated: This intermediate existence

original: rigs mthun lha mig dag pas mthong //
analyzed: rigs mthun lha mig dag pas mthong //
translated: is seen by the pure divine eye of those of its own class.🔽The intermediate existence of a sentient being is seen by the divine eye of a sentient being.🔽The divine eye of those who are born is not pure enough to see it.

original: srid pa bar ma pa ni rigs mthun pa nyid kyis mthong ba dang / gang dag gi lha'i mig shin tu dag pa mngon par shes pa'i rgyu las 'byung ba des ni 'di mthong gi / shin tu dang ba'i phyir skyes nas thob pa'i mig gis ni mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma pa ni rigs mthun pa nyid kyis mthong ba dang / gang dag gi lha'i mig shin tu dag pa mngon par shes pa'i rgyu las 'byung ba des ni 'di mthong gi / shin tu dang ba'i phyir skyes nas thob pa'i mig gis ni mi mthong ngo //
translated: According to other masters, the intermediate existence of a god sees the intermediate existence of a god; and so on.

original: gzhan dag na re lha'i srid pa bar ma pas ni thams cad mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re lha'i srid pa bar ma pas ni thams cad mthong ngo //
translated: According to other masters, the intermediate existence of a god sees all intermediate existences;

original: mi dang / yi dags dang / dud 'gro dang / dmyal ba'i srid pa bar ma pas ni gong ma gong ma bor @136b nas so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mi dang / yi dags dang / dud 'gro dang / dmyal ba'i srid pa bar ma pas ni gong ma gong ma bor @136b nas so zhes zer ro //
translated: the intermediate existence of a human, a hungry ghost, an animal and a hell being respectively see the intermediate existences of the four classes of sentient beings, three, two or one classes of sentient beings.

original: las kyi rdzu 'phrul shugs dang ldan //
analyzed: las kyi rdzu 'phrul shugs dang ldan //
translated: It is endowed with the power of magical emanations and actions.

original: rdzu 'phrul ni nam mkha' la 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul ni nam mkha' la 'gro ba'o //
translated: Magical emanation is the going in space.

original: las kyi rdzu 'phrul yin pas na las kyi rdzu 'phrul lo //
analyzed: las kyi rdzu 'phrul yin pas na las kyi rdzu 'phrul lo //
translated: It is the power of magical emanation because it is the power of action.

original: de'i shugs ni las kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi shugs te /
analyzed: de'i shugs ni las kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi shugs te /
translated: The power of that is the power of the magical emanation of action.

original: mgyogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: mgyogs pa nyid do //
translated: It is speed.

original: de 'di la yod pas na las kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi shugs dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: de 'di la yod pas na las kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi shugs dang ldan pa ste /
translated: Since it exists here, it is endowed with the power of the magical emanation of action.

original: gang gis 'di ni las kyi stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyis kyang dgag par mi spyod pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis 'di ni las kyi stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyis kyang dgag par mi spyod pa'o //
translated: Because of the power of action, even the Buddha cannot stop it.

original: dbang po kun tshang dbang po lnga char tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po kun tshang dbang po lnga char tshogs pa'o //
translated: It is endowed with all faculties, because it is endowed with all five faculties.🔽It is endowed with nonobstruction, because it is endowed with nonobstruction.

original: thogs med ldan thogs pas na thogs pa'o //
analyzed: thogs med ldan thogs pas na thogs pa'o //
translated: Obstruction is that which obstructs.

original: de 'di la yod pas na thogs pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de 'di la yod pas na thogs pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Since it exists here, it is endowed with obstruction.

original: thogs pa med pas thogs pa med pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: thogs pa med pas thogs pa med pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: It is endowed with nonobstruction, because it is endowed with nonobstruction.

original: rdo rje la sogs pas kyang mi bzlogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje la sogs pas kyang mi bzlogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because it is not obstructed even by such things as a diamond.

original: 'di ltar lcags kyi thu lum 'bar ba gshegs pa'i nang na de las byung ba'i srin bu dmigs so zhes thos so //🔽de 'gro ba gang dag tu skye ba de las ni thams cad du yang /
analyzed: 'di ltar lcags kyi thu lum 'bar ba gshegs pa'i nang na de las byung ba'i srin bu dmigs so zhes thos so // de 'gro ba gang dag tu skye ba de las ni thams cad du yang /
translated: It is said that one can see worms born from such a lump of burning iron.

original: mi bzlogs te /🔽mi'i srid pa bar ma med par gyur nas lha'i srid pa bar ma'am /
analyzed: mi bzlogs te / mi'i srid pa bar ma med par gyur nas lha'i srid pa bar ma'am /
translated: Wherever the intermediate beings are born, they are not stopped from going there.🔽If they are born as humans, they do not become gods.

original: gzhan du skye ba ni nam yang med pas /
analyzed: gzhan du skye ba ni nam yang med pas /
translated: If they are born as gods, they do not become humans.

original: 'di 'gro ba gang gi phyir grub pa de nyid du skye bar 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya bar nges so /
analyzed: 'di 'gro ba gang gi phyir grub pa de nyid du skye bar 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya bar nges so /
translated: Thus, they are born in the very place where they are to be reborn, and not elsewhere.

original: yang ci 'dod pa na spyod pa'i srid pa bar ma yang kham gyi zas za'am zhe na /🔽smras pa / de bzhin no //
analyzed: yang ci 'dod pa na spyod pa'i srid pa bar ma yang kham gyi zas za'am zhe na / smras pa / de bzhin no //
translated: Do intermediate beings of the realm of desire eat gross or subtle food?🔽They eat subtle food.

original: rigs pa ni ma yin te /🔽'di ltar 'di ni dri za ste //
analyzed: rigs pa ni ma yin te / 'di ltar 'di ni dri za ste //
translated: This is not logical.🔽They are gandharvas,

original: de'i phyir dri za zhes bya'o //🔽dbang chung ba'i zas ni dri mi zhim pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dri za zhes bya'o // dbang chung ba'i zas ni dri mi zhim pa'o //
translated: and they are called gandharvas because they eat gandhas, i.e., odors.🔽The food of those of little power is bad smelling;

original: dbang che ba'i zas ni dri zhim pa'o //
analyzed: dbang che ba'i zas ni dri zhim pa'o //
translated: the food of those of great power is good smelling.

original: yang 'gro ba'i yul du phyin par bya ba'i phyir 'byung ba'i srid pa bar ma de ni /
analyzed: yang 'gro ba'i yul du phyin par bya ba'i phyir 'byung ba'i srid pa bar ma de ni /
translated: The intermediate existence of those who are to be reborn in a lower plane of existence goes in the opposite direction.

original: rtse dags 'gro ba'i yul du ni //
analyzed: rtse dags 'gro ba'i yul du ni //
translated: It goes to the place of its destination by leaping,

original: phyin ci log gi blos 'gro'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi blos 'gro'o //
translated: because of a mistaken mind.

original: de ni las kyi mthus byung ba'i mig gis rang gi skye ba'i gnas thag ring po na 'dug kyang mthong ste /🔽de la des pha ma de gnyis log par grub pa mthong nas phor gyur pa zhig yin na ni ma la pho'i 'dod chags 'byung ngo //🔽mor 'gyur ba zhig yin na ni pha la mo'i 'dod chags 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de ni las kyi mthus byung ba'i mig gis rang gi skye ba'i gnas thag ring po na 'dug kyang mthong ste / de la des pha ma de gnyis log par grub pa mthong nas phor gyur pa zhig yin na ni ma la pho'i 'dod chags 'byung ngo // mor 'gyur ba zhig yin na ni pha la mo'i 'dod chags 'byung ngo //
translated: By the power of action, it sees with its eyes that arise from action the place of its rebirth, even though it may be far away.🔽If it is to be reborn as a male, lust for the mother arises in it.🔽If it is to be reborn as a female, lust for the father arises in it.

original: bzlog pa ni khong khro ba'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa ni khong khro ba'o //
translated: Hatred for the father or the mother arises in the opposite case.

original: btags pa las kyang 'di skad du //
analyzed: btags pa las kyang 'di skad du //
translated: The Prajñapti declares:

original: dri za la rjes su chags pa'o //🔽lhan cig pa'am /
analyzed: dri za la rjes su chags pa'o // lhan cig pa'am /
translated: The gandharva is attached to the place where it will enter the womb,🔽whether it is empty or not empty.

original: khong khro ba dang lhan cig pa'i sems gnyis las gang yang rung ba'i sems mngon du gyur pa na'o //
analyzed: khong khro ba dang lhan cig pa'i sems gnyis las gang yang rung ba'i sems mngon du gyur pa na'o //
translated: Or else, it is when one of the two minds, lust or hatred, is present.

original: 'di 'don te /
analyzed: 'di 'don te /
translated: The text should be completed as follows:

original: de phyin ci log de gnyis kyis dga' bar 'dod pas /
analyzed: de phyin ci log de gnyis kyis dga' bar 'dod pas /
translated: Because of these two errors, it desires to unite with the parents.

original: yul de yang phrad na gnas skabs der bdag nyid mos so //🔽ma'i mngal gyi @137a * //
analyzed: yul de yang phrad na gnas skabs der bdag nyid mos so // ma'i mngal gyi @137a * //
translated: And when the object is encountered, the intermediate being becomes attached to it.🔽Then, having gone to the place of the mother’s womb,

original: gnas mi gtsang ba der phyin nas /
analyzed: gnas mi gtsang ba der phyin nas /
translated: which is impure,

original: dga' ba skye zhing mngon par zhen to //
analyzed: dga' ba skye zhing mngon par zhen to //
translated: it becomes attached and takes pleasure in it.

original: de nas ni de'i phung po mkhrang por 'gyur la /
analyzed: de nas ni de'i phung po mkhrang por 'gyur la /
translated: Then, the aggregates of the intermediate being become solidified,

original: srid pa bar ma yang 'gags nas skye ba yin no //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma yang 'gags nas skye ba yin no //
translated: and the intermediate existence ceases.

original: re zhig sgo nga las skye ba dang / mngal nas skye ba'i skye gnas su 'gro ba ni de lta bu'o //
analyzed: re zhig sgo nga las skye ba dang / mngal nas skye ba'i skye gnas su 'gro ba ni de lta bu'o //
translated: This is how one enters the womb and is born, whether one is to be born from an egg or from the womb.

original: gzhan ni ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
translated: The other modes of birth should be explained according to reason.

original: de la 'dir ni rigs pa yin par snang ste /
analyzed: de la 'dir ni rigs pa yin par snang ste /
translated: Here is the way it appears to us.

original: dri dang gnas la 'dod pa gzhan //🔽drod gsher las skye ba'i skye gnas su 'gro ba na dri la chags pas /
analyzed: dri dang gnas la 'dod pa gzhan // drod gsher las skye ba'i skye gnas su 'gro ba na dri la chags pas /
translated: The other is attached to smell and place.

original: skye ba'i gnas gtsang ma 'am mi gtsang bar rang gi las ji lta ba bzhin du 'gro'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i gnas gtsang ma 'am mi gtsang bar rang gi las ji lta ba bzhin du 'gro'o //
translated: When one is to be born from moisture, one is attached to smell and goes to the place of one’s birth, whether it is pure or impure, in accordance with one’s actions.

original: rdzus te skye ba'i skye gnas su 'gro ba na ni gnas la chags pas so //
analyzed: rdzus te skye ba'i skye gnas su 'gro ba na ni gnas la chags pas so //
translated: When one is to be born spontaneously, one is attached to the place.

original: de la lha'i srid pa bar ma ni stan las ldang ba bzhin du gyen du 'gro'o //
analyzed: de la lha'i srid pa bar ma ni stan las ldang ba bzhin du gyen du 'gro'o //
translated: The intermediate existence of a god moves upward like one rising from a seat.

original: mi dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags la sogs pa ni mi la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mi dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags la sogs pa ni mi la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Humans, animals, hungry ghosts, etc. move like humans, etc.

original: dmyal ba dag ni spyi'u tshugs so //🔽yang dag sdom dang dka' thub can //
analyzed: dmyal ba dag ni spyi'u tshugs so // yang dag sdom dang dka' thub can //
translated: Hell beings fall head first.🔽Those who slander sages

original: drang srong rnams la skur 'debs pa //🔽de rnams spyi'u tshugs dag tu ni //
analyzed: drang srong rnams la skur 'debs pa // de rnams spyi'u tshugs dag tu ni //
translated: who are truly restrained and ascetic🔽fall head first

original: dmyal ba nyid du ltung bar gyur //🔽zhes tshigs su bcad pa las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmyal ba nyid du ltung bar gyur // zhes tshigs su bcad pa las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: into the hells.🔽The Sūtra says that there are four kinds of entry into the womb.

original: mdo las mngal du 'jug pa ni bzhi'o zhes gsungs pa la bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: mdo las mngal du 'jug pa ni bzhi'o zhes gsungs pa la bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: gcig ni shes bzhin du 'jug la /
analyzed: gcig ni shes bzhin du 'jug la /
translated: One enters consciously,

original: gnas pa dang 'byung ba ni shes bzhin du ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa dang 'byung ba ni shes bzhin du ma yin pa'o //
translated: but does not remain or leave consciously.

original: gzhan ni gnas pa yang /
analyzed: gzhan ni gnas pa yang /
translated: Another remains

original: shes bzhin du zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: shes bzhin du zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: consciously,🔽but does not enter or leave consciously.

original: yang gi sgras ni 'jug pa yang ngo //
analyzed: yang gi sgras ni 'jug pa yang ngo //
translated: Another enters and remains🔽consciously,🔽but does not leave consciously.

original: gzhan ni / 'byung ba'ang /
analyzed: gzhan ni / 'byung ba'ang /
translated: Another enters, remains, and leaves

original: shes bzhin du skye /
analyzed: shes bzhin du skye /
translated: consciously.

original: yang gi sgras ni 'jug pa dang / gnas pa'o //
analyzed: yang gi sgras ni 'jug pa dang / gnas pa'o //
translated: The word “also” indicates that they are also ignorant of the abiding and the leaving.

original: gzhan ni kun du rmongs /
analyzed: gzhan ni kun du rmongs /
translated: Others are ignorant of all.

original: la la ni 'jug pa yang shes bzhin ma yin la gnas pa dang 'byung ba thams cad du yang shes bzhin ma yin par byed do //
analyzed: la la ni 'jug pa yang shes bzhin ma yin la gnas pa dang 'byung ba thams cad du yang shes bzhin ma yin par byed do //
translated: Some are ignorant of the entry, some of the abiding, and some of the leaving.

original: mngal du 'jug pa 'di bzhi ni tshigs su bcad pa dang mthun pa'i phyir bzlog ste bstan to //🔽sgo nga las skyes rtag tu'o //
analyzed: mngal du 'jug pa 'di bzhi ni tshigs su bcad pa dang mthun pa'i phyir bzlog ste bstan to // sgo nga las skyes rtag tu'o //
translated: These four kinds of entry into the womb are taught in reverse order in order to conform to the meter.🔽Those born from eggs are always ignorant.

original: sgo nga las skye ba'i sems can ni rtag tu thams cad du rmongs so //
analyzed: sgo nga las skye ba'i sems can ni rtag tu thams cad du rmongs so //
translated: Beings born from eggs are always ignorant of all.

original: 'dir yang bstan pa /
analyzed: 'dir yang bstan pa /
translated: Here, the teaching is:

original: mngal du 'jug pa gsum dag ste //
analyzed: mngal du 'jug pa gsum dag ste //
translated: There are three kinds of entry into the womb:

original: 'khor los sgyur dang rang 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur dang rang 'byung ngo //
translated: The universal monarch, the self-arisen,

original: 'khor los sgyur ba dang / rang 'byung rang sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas gnyis te /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba dang / rang 'byung rang sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas gnyis te /
translated: The universal monarch, the self-arisen pratyekabuddha, and the self-arisen buddha.

original: go rims ji lta ba bzhin no zhes 'og nas 'chad do //
analyzed: go rims ji lta ba bzhin no zhes 'og nas 'chad do //
translated: These are the three kinds of entry into the womb, in order.

original: de la dang po ni 'khor los sgyur ba ste /
analyzed: de la dang po ni 'khor los sgyur ba ste /
translated: The first is the universal monarch.

original: de ni 'jug pa 'ba' zhig shes bzhin du yin gyi /
analyzed: de ni 'jug pa 'ba' zhig shes bzhin du yin gyi /
translated: He enters the womb with full awareness,🔽but not the others.

original: @137b gnas pa dang 'byung ba ni ma yin no //🔽rang sangs rgyas ni gnas pa yang ngo //
analyzed: @137b gnas pa dang 'byung ba ni ma yin no // rang sangs rgyas ni gnas pa yang ngo //
translated: but not the state of being a Buddha.🔽The Pratyekabuddha is the state of being a Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas ni 'byung ba yang ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni 'byung ba yang ngo //
translated: The Buddha is the state of being a Buddha.

original: phyis 'gyur ba'i ming gi 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs pa 'di dag tu bstan te /
analyzed: phyis 'gyur ba'i ming gi 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs pa 'di dag tu bstan te /
translated: The wheel-turning kings, etc. are so called because they will be in the future.🔽For example, one says:🔽Cook the rice,

original: dper na 'bras chan 'tshed do //
analyzed: dper na 'bras chan 'tshed do //
translated: Grind the flour.🔽The wheel-turning kings, etc. are so called because they will be in the future.

original: phye 'thag go zhes bya ba bzhin no //🔽las sam ye shes sam gnyi ga /
analyzed: phye 'thag go zhes bya ba bzhin no // las sam ye shes sam gnyi ga /
translated: The wheel-turning kings, etc. are so called because they will be in the future.

original: rgya che'i phyir na go rims bzhin //
analyzed: rgya che'i phyir na go rims bzhin //
translated: The wheel-turning kings, etc. are so called because they will be in the future.🔽The wheel-turning kings, etc. are so called because they will be in the future.

original: las rgya che ba ni bsod nams rgya chen po byed pa rnams kyi ste dang po'o //🔽ye shes rgya che ba ni thos pa mang po rab tu rnam par 'byed pa byas pa rnams kyi ste gnyis pa'o //🔽bsod nams dang ye shes rgya che ba ni gsum pa ste /🔽de ltar na de lta bu ni go rims bzhin du 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs pa 'di dag tu rigs so //
analyzed: las rgya che ba ni bsod nams rgya chen po byed pa rnams kyi ste dang po'o // ye shes rgya che ba ni thos pa mang po rab tu rnam par 'byed pa byas pa rnams kyi ste gnyis pa'o // bsod nams dang ye shes rgya che ba ni gsum pa ste / de ltar na de lta bu ni go rims bzhin du 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs pa 'di dag tu rigs so //
