original: da ni 'dir phyi rol pa dag tu smra ba yongs su bzung nas gleng ste /
analyzed: da ni 'dir phyi rol pa dag tu smra ba yongs su bzung nas gleng ste /
translated: Now, here, having taken up the views of the non-Buddhists, we will discuss.

original: gal te sems can 'jig rten gzhan du 'pho bar dam bca' na ni bdag grub po zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sems can 'jig rten gzhan du 'pho bar dam bca' na ni bdag grub po zhe na /
translated: If one asserts that sentient beings transmigrate to another world, then the self is established.

original: de dgag par bya ste bdag med /
analyzed: de dgag par bya ste bdag med /
translated: That is to be refuted: there is no self.

original: bdag ji lta bu zhig gang phung po 'di bor nas /
analyzed: bdag ji lta bu zhig gang phung po 'di bor nas /
translated: What kind of self is it that, having abandoned this body,

original: phung po gzhan du nying mtshams sbyor ba yongs su brtags pa ste /
analyzed: phung po gzhan du nying mtshams sbyor ba yongs su brtags pa ste /
translated: connects to another body?

original: de lta bu'i nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu ni med do //
analyzed: de lta bu'i nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu ni med do //
translated: Such an internal agent does not exist.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'di skad du las ni yod da //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'di skad du las ni yod da //
translated: The Blessed One also said this: “There is karma.

original: rnam par smin pa ni yod do //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni yod do //
translated: There is ripening.

original: chos kyi 'du 'phrod la ma gtogs pa /
analyzed: chos kyi 'du 'phrod la ma gtogs pa /
translated: Apart from the combination and separation of phenomena,

original: gang phung po 'di bor nas gzhan du nying mtshams sbyor ba'i byed pa po ni mi dmigs so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang phung po 'di bor nas gzhan du nying mtshams sbyor ba'i byed pa po ni mi dmigs so zhes gsungs so //
translated: one does not observe an agent who abandons this body and connects to another.”

original: de la chos kyi 'du 'phrod ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la chos kyi 'du 'phrod ni 'di yin te /
translated: Therein, the combination and separation of phenomena is this.

original: 'di lta ste 'di yod pas ni 'di 'byung zhes bya ba rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rgya cher ro //
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'di yod pas ni 'di 'byung zhes bya ba rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rgya cher ro //
translated: “When this exists, that comes to be,” etc. ,

original: 'o na ji lta bu'i bdag gcig me dgag ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu'i bdag gcig me dgag ce na /
translated: But how do you refute the self that is one with the aggregates?

original: phung po tsam nyid do //
analyzed: phung po tsam nyid do //
translated: The self is the aggregates themselves.

original: gal te phung po tsam nyid la bdag ces zer na ni de la dgag pa med do //
analyzed: gal te phung po tsam nyid la bdag ces zer na ni de la dgag pa med do //
translated: If you say that the self is the aggregates themselves, we do not deny that.

original: de lta na yang phung po nyid 'jig rten gzhan du 'pho bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang phung po nyid 'jig rten gzhan du 'pho bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But in that case, the aggregates themselves would migrate from one world to another.

original: phung po de dag mi 'pho ste //
analyzed: phung po de dag mi 'pho ste //
translated: The aggregates do not migrate.

original: nyon mongs las kyis mngon du byas //
analyzed: nyon mongs las kyis mngon du byas //
translated: The aggregates are manifested by karma and the afflictions.

original: srid pa bar ma'i rgyun gyis na //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma'i rgyun gyis na //
translated: The continuum of the intermediate existence

original: mar me bzhin du mngal du 'jug / phung po skad cig ma de dag la ni /
analyzed: mar me bzhin du mngal du 'jug / phung po skad cig ma de dag la ni /
translated: Enters the womb like a lamp’s glow.🔽The aggregates themselves do not have the power to migrate from one world to another.

original: 'pho ba'i mthu med kyi nyon mongs pa dang las kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i phung po tsam srid pa bar ma zhes bya ba ni rgyun gyis ma'i mngal du 'gro ste /
analyzed: 'pho ba'i mthu med kyi nyon mongs pa dang las kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i phung po tsam srid pa bar ma zhes bya ba ni rgyun gyis ma'i mngal du 'gro ste /
translated: The aggregates themselves are manifested by karma and the afflictions. The mere aggregates, called the intermediate existence, enter the mother’s womb through the continuum of the intermediate existence.

original: dper na mar me skad cig ma'i rgyun gyis yul gzhan du 'gro zhes bya ba bzhin pas 'di @138a * //
analyzed: dper na mar me skad cig ma'i rgyun gyis yul gzhan du 'gro zhes bya ba bzhin pas 'di @138a * //
translated: For example, it is like saying that a flame moves to another place by the continuity of momentary flames.

original: la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: la nyes pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault here.

original: de bas na bdag ni med kyi /
analyzed: de bas na bdag ni med kyi /
translated: Therefore, the self does not exist.

original: nyon mongs pa dang las kyi mngon par 'dus byas pa'i phung bo rnams kyi rgyun ma'i mngal du 'gro zhes bya ba 'di grub po //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang las kyi mngon par 'dus byas pa'i phung bo rnams kyi rgyun ma'i mngal du 'gro zhes bya ba 'di grub po //
translated: But it is established that the continuity of the aggregates, which are produced by the afflictions and actions, enters the mother’s womb.🔽And that is so,

original: de yang / rgyud la ji ltar 'phangs rim bzhin //
analyzed: de yang / rgyud la ji ltar 'phangs rim bzhin //
translated: because the world goes to another world

original: 'phel nas las dang nyon mongs kyis //🔽'jig rten pha rol dag tu 'gro //
analyzed: 'phel nas las dang nyon mongs kyis // 'jig rten pha rol dag tu 'gro //
translated: by the power of karma and the afflictions.

original: tshe'i las tha dad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshe'i las tha dad pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the karma that produces life is different,

original: phung po'i rgyun thams cad kyi 'phen pa 'dra ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: phung po'i rgyun thams cad kyi 'phen pa 'dra ba ni ma yin te /
translated: the projection of the continuity of all aggregates is not the same.

original: de'i phyir gang la ji srid du 'phangs pa de srid du rim gyis 'phel lo //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang la ji srid du 'phangs pa de srid du rim gyis 'phel lo //
translated: Therefore, it gradually increases in size for as long as it is projected.

original: rim gang zhen /
analyzed: rim gang zhen /
translated: What is the sequence?

original: nur nur po dang / mer mer po dang / nar nar po dang / mkhrang gyur pa dang / rkang lag 'gyus pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis so //
analyzed: nur nur po dang / mer mer po dang / nar nar po dang / mkhrang gyur pa dang / rkang lag 'gyus pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis so //
translated: It is the sequence of kalala, arbuda, peśin, ghana, and praśākhā, and so on.

original: 'phel ba'i rjes su mthun pa las //
analyzed: 'phel ba'i rjes su mthun pa las //
translated: The wheel of existence is without beginning.

original: dbang po yongs su smin nas ni //
analyzed: dbang po yongs su smin nas ni //
translated: When the faculties are fully matured,

original: yang nyon mongs pa rnams kun du spyod cing las rnams kyang sogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang nyon mongs pa rnams kun du spyod cing las rnams kyang sogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: he again engages in the passions and accumulates actions.

original: de dag gis de'i lus bshig nas yang srid pa bar ma'i rgyun gyis snga ma bzhin du 'jig cing pha rol du 'gro bas na /
analyzed: de dag gis de'i lus bshig nas yang srid pa bar ma'i rgyun gyis snga ma bzhin du 'jig cing pha rol du 'gro bas na /
translated: Those actions destroy his body and he goes to the other side by the stream of the intermediate existence, as before.

original: srid pa'i 'khor lo thog ma med //
analyzed: srid pa'i 'khor lo thog ma med //
translated: The wheel of existence is without beginning.

original: rnam pa des na las dang nyon mongs pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i tshe dang / yang de'i rgyu las dang nyon mongs pa rnams dang / yang de dag las tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa des na las dang nyon mongs pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i tshe dang / yang de'i rgyu las dang nyon mongs pa rnams dang / yang de dag las tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Thus, life arises from the cause of action and the passions; from that cause, action and the passions arise; and from that, life arises, and so on.

original: srid pa'i 'khor lo thog ma med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i 'khor lo thog ma med par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the wheel of existence is without beginning.

original: thog ma rtag na ni de rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thog ma rtag na ni de rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it had a beginning, it would follow that it would be without a cause.🔽If it were without a cause, everything would arise from everything,

original: de rgyu med pa zhig yin ni 'di dag thams cad kyang rgyu med pa zhig las 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhig la /
analyzed: de rgyu med pa zhig yin ni 'di dag thams cad kyang rgyu med pa zhig las 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhig la /
translated: because it would be unnecessary to posit a cause.

original: yul dang dus so sor nges pa las myu gu la sogs pa las bon la sogs pa dang / du ba la sogs pa la me la sogs pa'i nus pa yang mthong bas rgyu med pa las byung ba yang med la /
analyzed: yul dang dus so sor nges pa las myu gu la sogs pa las bon la sogs pa dang / du ba la sogs pa la me la sogs pa'i nus pa yang mthong bas rgyu med pa las byung ba yang med la /
translated: Since the power of seeds, etc. with regard to sprouts, etc. and the power of fire, etc. with regard to smoke, etc. are seen to be determined in relation to particular places and times, there is no arising without a cause.

original: rgyu rtag pa yod par smra ba yang dang po nyid du bkag zin pas /
analyzed: rgyu rtag pa yod par smra ba yang dang po nyid du bkag zin pas /
translated: The assertion of a permanent cause was refuted earlier.

original: de bas na 'khor ba la thog ma med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na 'khor ba la thog ma med pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, cyclic existence has no beginning.

original: tshe ni rgyu la rag lus pa'i phyir rgyu zad pa las mtha' dang ldan par ni rigs te /
analyzed: tshe ni rgyu la rag lus pa'i phyir rgyu zad pa las mtha' dang ldan par ni rigs te /
translated: Since life depends on causes, it is reasonable that it has an end due to the exhaustion of causes,

original: sa bon zad pa las myu gu bzhin no //
analyzed: sa bon zad pa las myu gu bzhin no //
translated: like a sprout from the exhaustion of a seed.

original: de ltar phung po'i rgyun tshe'i gnas skabs gsum du bstan pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: de ltar phung po'i rgyun tshe'i gnas skabs gsum du bstan pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: Thus, the continuum of the aggregates is taught to be in three states of life.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin //🔽yang lag bcu gnyis rabs gsum mo //🔽de la yan lag bcu gnyis ni ma rig pa la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin // yang lag bcu gnyis rabs gsum mo // de la yan lag bcu gnyis ni ma rig pa la sogs pa nas /
translated: That is dependent origination.🔽The twelve members are the three periods of time.

original: rga shi la thug pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: rga shi la thug pa'i bar ro //
translated: The twelve members are from ignorance up to aging and death.

original: rabs gsum ni sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus te 'das pa dang ma @138b 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i tshe'o //
analyzed: rabs gsum ni sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus te 'das pa dang ma @138b 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i tshe'o //
translated: The three times are the past, future, and present, i.e., the prior limit, the subsequent limit, and the middle.

original: ji ltar na yan lag bcu gnyis rabs gsum dag tu rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na yan lag bcu gnyis rabs gsum dag tu rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: How are the twelve members arranged in the three times?🔽Two are in the prior and subsequent limits,

original: sngon dang phyi mtha' gnyis gnyis dang // bar gyi brgyad de /
analyzed: sngon dang phyi mtha' gnyis gnyis dang // bar gyi brgyad de /
translated: and eight are in the middle.

original: ma rig pa dang 'du byed rnams ni sngon gyi mtha'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang 'du byed rnams ni sngon gyi mtha'o //
translated: Ignorance and conditioning are in the prior limit.

original: skye ba dang rga shi ni phyi ma'i mtha'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang rga shi ni phyi ma'i mtha'o //
translated: Birth and aging-death are in the subsequent limit.

original: lhag ma brgyad ni bar gyi'o //
analyzed: lhag ma brgyad ni bar gyi'o //
translated: The remaining eight are in the middle.

original: ci yan lag brgyad po 'di dag thams cad kyi skye ba 'di la yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: ci yan lag brgyad po 'di dag thams cad kyi skye ba 'di la yod dam zhe na /
translated: Do all eight members exist in this birth?

original: smras pa ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa ma yin no //
translated: They reply: No.

original: 'o na su la zhe na /🔽yongs rdzogs la /
analyzed: 'o na su la zhe na / yongs rdzogs la /
translated: Whose are they?🔽They are in one who is complete.

original: yongs su rdzogs par 'di la yod pas yongs rdzogs te /
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs par 'di la yod pas yongs rdzogs te /
translated: One who is complete is one in whom all of these exist.

original: 'dir ni gnas skabs kyi bye brag 'di dag thams cad la reg pa'i gang zag 'di la dgongs kyi /
analyzed: 'dir ni gnas skabs kyi bye brag 'di dag thams cad la reg pa'i gang zag 'di la dgongs kyi /
translated: Here, the person who experiences all of these different states is intended.

original: bar ma dor 'chi ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: bar ma dor 'chi ba yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it one who dies in the intermediate state.

original: gzugs ngang gzugs med pa na spyod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs ngang gzugs med pa na spyod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not the realm of form or the formless realm,

original: 'di ltar gleng gzhi chen po'i rnam grangs las /
analyzed: 'di ltar gleng gzhi chen po'i rnam grangs las /
translated: because the great exposition of the levels declares:

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i gang zag nyid bstan pa /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i gang zag nyid bstan pa /
translated: The person who experiences the desire realm is taught.

original: kun dga' bo gal te rnam par shes pa ma'i mngal du ma zhugs nas zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun dga' bo gal te rnam par shes pa ma'i mngal du ma zhugs nas zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Ānanda, if consciousness does not enter the mother’s womb,

original: gang gi tshe rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' rnam pa gnyis su brjod pa de'i tshe ni tshor ba la thug pa'i bar yan lag bdun sngon gyi mtha'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' rnam pa gnyis su brjod pa de'i tshe ni tshor ba la thug pa'i bar yan lag bdun sngon gyi mtha'o //
translated: When dependent origination is described in terms of two aspects—the prior limit and the subsequent limit—then up to feeling is the prior limit and

original: lnga ni phyi ma'i mtha' ste /
analyzed: lnga ni phyi ma'i mtha' ste /
translated: five are the subsequent limit.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bur bcas pa la sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' smos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bur bcas pa la sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' smos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the prior limit and the subsequent limit are mentioned in terms of cause and effect.

original: yang ma rig pa la sogs pa 'di dag gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: yang ma rig pa la sogs pa 'di dag gang zhig ce na /
translated: What are ignorance and so on?

original: ma rig nyon mongs sngon gnas skabs /
analyzed: ma rig nyon mongs sngon gnas skabs /
translated: Ignorance is the affliction of the period of abiding.

original: tshe snga ma'i nyon mongs pa'i gnas skabs gang yin pa ni 'dir ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshe snga ma'i nyon mongs pa'i gnas skabs gang yin pa ni 'dir ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The state of the defilements in a previous life is called ignorance here.

original: lhan cig spyod pa dang / de'i dbang gis de dag kun du 'byung pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: lhan cig spyod pa dang / de'i dbang gis de dag kun du 'byung pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are associated with it and because they occur through its power.

original: rgyal po gshegs so zhes bya ba'i tshig gis /
analyzed: rgyal po gshegs so zhes bya ba'i tshig gis /
translated: When it is said that the king is coming,

original: de'i zham 'bring ba yang 'ongs par grung pa bzhin no //🔽'du byed sngon gyi las dag gis //
analyzed: de'i zham 'bring ba yang 'ongs par grung pa bzhin no // 'du byed sngon gyi las dag gis //
translated: it is understood that his retinue is coming.🔽The state of action is the formative forces.

original: gnas skabs zhes bya bar sbyar te /🔽tshe snga ma'i bsod nams la sogs pa'i las kyi gnas skabs gang yin pa de ni 'dir 'du byed ces bya ste /
analyzed: gnas skabs zhes bya bar sbyar te / tshe snga ma'i bsod nams la sogs pa'i las kyi gnas skabs gang yin pa de ni 'dir 'du byed ces bya ste /
translated: The state of action in a previous life is called the formative forces here.

original: las gang gis 'dir rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: las gang gis 'dir rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: The state of action in a previous life, such as merit, etc., is called the formative forces here, because it is the action through which one is reborn here.

original: rnam shes phung po'i mtshams sbyor ba //
analyzed: rnam shes phung po'i mtshams sbyor ba //
translated: The state of consciousness is the linking consciousness.

original: ma'i mngal du nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig ma la phung po lnga ni rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: ma'i mngal du nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig ma la phung po lnga ni rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The five aggregates at the moment of linking in the mothers womb are called the aggregate of consciousness.

original: ming dang gzugs ni de phan chad //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs ni de phan chad //
translated: Name and form are from then on.

original: skye mched drug dod snga rol lo //
analyzed: skye mched drug dod snga rol lo //
translated: The six sense spheres are prior to the development of faculties.

original: mtshams sbyor ba'i sems can phan chad nas /
analyzed: mtshams sbyor ba'i sems can phan chad nas /
translated: From the point of the linking consciousness onward,🔽

original: ji srid du skya mched drug ma dod ba'i bar gyi gnas skabs der ni ming dang gzugs zhes @139a * //🔽bya'o ; / skye mched bzhi dod pa'i snga rol zhes brjod par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: ji srid du skya mched drug ma dod ba'i bar gyi gnas skabs der ni ming dang gzugs zhes @139a * // bya'o ; / skye mched bzhi dod pa'i snga rol zhes brjod par bya'o zhe na /
translated: The period of time that extends from the moment when the sentient being is united with the faculties until the moment when the six sense-spheres have arisen is called name-and-form.

original: de ni de'i tshe skye mched drug ces bya ba rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //🔽de ni gsum 'dus snga rol lo //
analyzed: de ni de'i tshe skye mched drug ces bya ba rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro // de ni gsum 'dus snga rol lo //
translated: The period of time that extends from the moment when the four sense-spheres have arisen until the moment when the six sense-spheres have arisen is called the six sense-spheres.

original: skye mched drug ni dod la /
analyzed: skye mched drug ni dod la /
translated: Because, at that time, the six sense-spheres are already present.

original: ji srid du dbang po dang / yul dang / rnam par shes pa gsum ma 'dus bde srid kyi gnas skabs de la ni skye mched drug ces bya'o //🔽reg pa bde sdug la sogs pa'i //🔽rgyu shes nus pa'i snga rol lo //🔽gsum 'dus pa las reg par 'gyur la /🔽de ni ji srid du tshor ba gsum gyi rgyu yongs su gcod par mi nus pa'i gnas skabs da la reg pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ji srid du dbang po dang / yul dang / rnam par shes pa gsum ma 'dus bde srid kyi gnas skabs de la ni skye mched drug ces bya'o // reg pa bde sdug la sogs pa'i // rgyu shes nus pa'i snga rol lo // gsum 'dus pa las reg par 'gyur la / de ni ji srid du tshor ba gsum gyi rgyu yongs su gcod par mi nus pa'i gnas skabs da la reg pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The period of time that extends from the moment when the six sense-spheres have arisen until the moment when the three, i.e., the sense-faculty, the object-field and the consciousness, are not yet in a relationship of mutual support is called the six sense-spheres.🔽The period of time that extends from the moment when the three, i.e., the sense-faculty, the object-field and the consciousness, are in a relationship of mutual support until the moment when the capacity to distinguish the cause of the three sensations is acquired is called contact.🔽The period of time that extends from the moment when the capacity to distinguish the cause of the three sensations is acquired until the moment when the capacity to experience the result of the three sensations is acquired is called sensation.🔽The period of time that extends from the moment when the capacity to experience the result of the three sensations is acquired until the moment when the capacity to experience the result of the three sensations is lost is called craving.

original: tshor ba 'khrig las lnga /
analyzed: tshor ba 'khrig las lnga /
translated: The period of time that extends from the moment when the capacity to experience the result of the three sensations is lost until the moment when the capacity to experience the result of the three sensations is acquired is called attachment.🔽The period of time that extends from the moment when the capacity to experience the result of the three sensations is acquired until the moment when the capacity to experience the result of the three sensations is lost is called existence.

original: tshor ba'i gnas skabs ni ji srid du 'khrig pa'i 'dod chags kun du mi spyod pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: tshor ba'i gnas skabs ni ji srid du 'khrig pa'i 'dod chags kun du mi spyod pa'i bar ro //
translated: The stage of sensation lasts as long as one does not engage in sexual union.🔽Craving is the state of one who is attached to sexual pleasure.

original: sred pa / longs spyod 'khrig la chags pa can //🔽'khrig pa'i 'dod pa ni kun du spyod la /
analyzed: sred pa / longs spyod 'khrig la chags pa can // 'khrig pa'i 'dod pa ni kun du spyod la /
translated: The stage of craving is the state of one who engages in sexual union.

original: ji srid du yul yongs su tshor ba la ma zhugs pa'i gnas skabs de la ni srid pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ji srid du yul yongs su tshor ba la ma zhugs pa'i gnas skabs de la ni srid pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The stage of existence is the state of one who has not yet obtained the object of his desire, as long as he has not begun to enjoy the object.

original: nye bar len pa longs spyod rnams //🔽thob par bya phyir yongs rgyug pa'o //🔽gnas skabs gang du yul thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su tshol ba la zhugs nas thams cad du rgyug pa de ni len pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa longs spyod rnams // thob par bya phyir yongs rgyug pa'o // gnas skabs gang du yul thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su tshol ba la zhugs nas thams cad du rgyug pa de ni len pa zhes bya'o //

analyzed: de ltar yongs su rgyug pa / de srid 'bras bur 'gyur ba yin //

original: yang srid pa pa'i la sogs pa de ni srid pa'o //
analyzed: yang srid pa pa'i la sogs pa de ni srid pa'o //
translated: The state of one who runs around in search of the objects of desire is called existence.🔽The state of

original: las de la yang 'di nas shi 'phos nas tshe phyi mar nying mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las de la yang 'di nas shi 'phos nas tshe phyi mar nying mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: This action is followed by the linking of consciousness at death to the next existence.

original: de ni / nying mtshams sbyor ba skye ba yin /
analyzed: de ni / nying mtshams sbyor ba skye ba yin /
translated: This is birth, the arising of the aggregates.

original: 'di ni rnam par shes pa'i yan lag gang yin pa de nyid tshe gzhan du skye ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par shes pa'i yan lag gang yin pa de nyid tshe gzhan du skye ba'o //
translated: This is the same consciousness member that was in the previous existence.

original: de phan chad tshor ba'i bar ni rga shi'o //
analyzed: de phan chad tshor ba'i bar ni rga shi'o //
translated: From this point on, the rest of the members up to feeling are aging and death.

original: skye ba phan chad nas tshor ba la thug pa'i gnas skabs ni rga shi ste /
analyzed: skye ba phan chad nas tshor ba la thug pa'i gnas skabs ni rga shi ste /
translated: The period from birth up to the feeling of an object is called aging and death.

original: 'di'i yan lag bzhi po ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang reg pa dang tshor ba gang yin pa de dag nyid gzhan du na rga shi'o //
analyzed: 'di'i yan lag bzhi po ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang reg pa dang tshor ba gang yin pa de dag nyid gzhan du na rga shi'o //
translated: The four members of this period—name and form, the six sense spheres, contact, and feeling—are aging and death in another lifetime.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis po de dag ni rnam pa bzhir brjod de /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis po de dag ni rnam pa bzhir brjod de /
translated: These twelve members of dependent arising are described in four ways:

original: 'di ltar skad cig pa dang / rgyun chags pa dang / 'brel ba can dang / gnas skabs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar skad cig pa dang / rgyun chags pa dang / 'brel ba can dang / gnas skabs pa'o //
translated: as momentary, as a continuum, as related, and as a period.

original: de la skad cig ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de la skad cig ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the momentary nature of dependent arising?

original: skad cig ma gcig la yan lag bcu gnyis yod pa ste /
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig la yan lag bcu gnyis yod pa ste /
translated: In one moment there are twelve members.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: chags pa'i dbang @139b gis srog chags kyi srog gcong pa la rmongs pa gang yin pa de ni ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa'i dbang @139b gis srog chags kyi srog gcong pa la rmongs pa gang yin pa de ni ma rig pa'o //
translated: The delusion of killing a living being out of attachment is ignorance.

original: sems pa gang yin pa de ni 'du byed do //
analyzed: sems pa gang yin pa de ni 'du byed do //
translated: The intention is the formative forces.

original: dngos po so sor rnam par rig pa ni rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po so sor rnam par rig pa ni rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The individual cognition of the object is consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i phung po bzhi ni ming dang gzugs so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i phung po bzhi ni ming dang gzugs so //
translated: The four aggregates that arise simultaneously with consciousness are name-and-form.

original: ming dang gzugs rnam par gzhag pa'i dbang po rnams ni skye mched drug go //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs rnam par gzhag pa'i dbang po rnams ni skye mched drug go //
translated: The faculties that are established on the basis of name-and-form are the six sense spheres.

original: skye mched drug 'dus pa ni reg pa'o //
analyzed: skye mched drug 'dus pa ni reg pa'o //
translated: The union of the six sense spheres is contact.

original: reg pa nyams su myong ba ni tshor ba'o //
analyzed: reg pa nyams su myong ba ni tshor ba'o //
translated: The experience of contact is feeling.

original: chags pa gang yin pa de ni srid pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa gang yin pa de ni srid pa'o //
translated: The attachment is becoming.

original: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni kun nas dkris pa ni len pa'o //
analyzed: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni kun nas dkris pa ni len pa'o //
translated: The entanglements that are concomitant with that are grasping.

original: des kun nas bslang ba'i lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las ni srid pa'o //
analyzed: des kun nas bslang ba'i lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las ni srid pa'o //
translated: The bodily and verbal karma that is motivated by that is existence.

original: las de rnams kyi skye ba ni skye ba'o //
analyzed: las de rnams kyi skye ba ni skye ba'o //
translated: Birth is the arising of those actions.

original: yongs su smin pa ni rga ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su smin pa ni rga ba'o //
translated: Aging is their maturation.

original: zhig pa ni shi ba'o //
analyzed: zhig pa ni shi ba'o //
translated: Death is their destruction.

original: rgyun chags pa ni yan lag bcu gnyis pa'i phung po lnga tshe'i gnas skabs gsum du bar chad med par 'brel ba rnams te /
analyzed: rgyun chags pa ni yan lag bcu gnyis pa'i phung po lnga tshe'i gnas skabs gsum du bar chad med par 'brel ba rnams te /
translated: Continuity is the uninterrupted connection of the five aggregates in the three periods of time in the twelve members.

original: rgyun chags pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyun chags pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is called continuity because it is endowed with continuity.

original: tshe rabs gsum du 'brel pa'i phyir 'brel pa can no //
analyzed: tshe rabs gsum du 'brel pa'i phyir 'brel pa can no //
translated: It is called connection because it is connected with three births.

original: yan lag bcu gnyis pa'i phung po lnga'i gnas skabs yin pa'i phyir gnas skabs pa ste /
analyzed: yan lag bcu gnyis pa'i phung po lnga'i gnas skabs yin pa'i phyir gnas skabs pa ste /
translated: It is called a period because it is the period of the five aggregates in the twelve members.

original: de rnams las bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di gang las dgongs she na /
analyzed: de rnams las bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di gang las dgongs she na /
translated: From among these, what did the Bhagavån intend when he said, “Conditioned by birth is aging and death”?

original: 'dir ni / gnas skabs bar 'di 'dod ces grag /'dir ni yan lag bcu gnyis pa'i phung po lnga pa tshe rabs gsum du bar chad med par 'brel pa'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bar 'dod do //
analyzed: 'dir ni / gnas skabs bar 'di 'dod ces grag /'dir ni yan lag bcu gnyis pa'i phung po lnga pa tshe rabs gsum du bar chad med par 'brel pa'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bar 'dod do //
translated: Here, he intended the present period, which is the uninterrupted connection of the five aggregates in the twelve members in three births.

original: gal te yan lag ril po phung po lnga char yod na /
analyzed: gal te yan lag ril po phung po lnga char yod na /
translated: If the members are the five aggregates,

original: ci'i phyir ma rig pa la sogs pa'i chos 'ba' zhig las bsgrags she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma rig pa la sogs pa'i chos 'ba' zhig las bsgrags she na /
translated: Why are the factors such as ignorance taught?

original: gtso bo'i yan lag nyid las bsgrags /
analyzed: gtso bo'i yan lag nyid las bsgrags /
translated: They are taught as the primary factors.

original: ma rig pa gtso bo'i tshe ni ma rig par bshad la /
analyzed: ma rig pa gtso bo'i tshe ni ma rig par bshad la /
translated: When ignorance is primary, it is called ignorance.

original: 'du byed rnams gtso bo'i tshe ni 'du byed do //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams gtso bo'i tshe ni 'du byed do //
translated: When formations are primary, it is called formations.

original: de bzhin du rga shi gtso bo'i tshe yang rga shi'i bar du ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rga shi gtso bo'i tshe yang rga shi'i bar du ste /
translated: Similarly, when aging and death are primary, it is called aging and death.

original: nyes pa med do //
analyzed: nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault.

original: yang ci'i phyir mdo las ni yan lag bcu gnyis su bshad la /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir mdo las ni yan lag bcu gnyis su bshad la /
translated: Why are twelve factors taught in the sutras,

original: rab tu byed pa las ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa las ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang zhe na /
translated: but in the treatise it is said, “What is dependent origination?

original: 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad do zhes gzhan du 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad do zhes gzhan du 'byung zhe na /
translated: It is all conditioned phenomena”?

original: mdo las ni sems can zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mdo las ni sems can zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In the sutras, it is called sentient beings.

original: rab tu byed pa las ni sems can dang / sems can ma yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu byed pa las ni sems can dang / sems can ma yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In the treatise, it is called sentient beings and non-sentient beings.

original: yang ci'i phyir mdo las sems can zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig bshad ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir mdo las sems can zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig bshad ce na /
translated: Why is it only called sentient beings in the sutras?

original: sngon dang phyi ma bar mtha' la //
analyzed: sngon dang phyi ma bar mtha' la //
translated: It is taught in terms of the beginning, end, and middle.

original: rmongs pa @140a * //
analyzed: rmongs pa @140a * //
translated: Ignorance is taught in terms of the beginning.

original: rnam par bzlog pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rnam par bzlog pa'i phyir //
translated: in order to reverse them.

original: de la sngon gyi mtha' la rmongs pa rnam par bzlog pa'i phyir ma rig pa dang 'du byed bstan to //
analyzed: de la sngon gyi mtha' la rmongs pa rnam par bzlog pa'i phyir ma rig pa dang 'du byed bstan to //
translated: In order to reverse delusion concerning the prior limit, ignorance and the formative forces are taught.

original: phyi ma'i mtha' la rmongs pa rnam par bzlog pa'i phyir skye ba dang rga shi bstan to //
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' la rmongs pa rnam par bzlog pa'i phyir skye ba dang rga shi bstan to //
translated: In order to reverse delusion concerning the subsequent limit, birth, and aging and death are taught.

original: bar gyi mtha' la rmongs pa rnam par bzlog pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa bstan te /
analyzed: bar gyi mtha' la rmongs pa rnam par bzlog pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa bstan te /
translated: In order to reverse delusion concerning the middle, consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, sensation, craving, grasping, and becoming are taught.

original: de'i phyir rabs gsum mo //
analyzed: de'i phyir rabs gsum mo //
translated: Therefore, it is a three-fold series.

original: yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de ni 'di ltar nyon mongs pa dang / las dang / gzhi gsum gyi rang bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de ni 'di ltar nyon mongs pa dang / las dang / gzhi gsum gyi rang bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, this dependent origination should be understood as having the nature of three categories: afflictions, actions, and sufferings.

original: de la nyon mongs pa gsum ni ma rig pa dang / sred pa dang / len pa'o //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa gsum ni ma rig pa dang / sred pa dang / len pa'o //
translated: Among them, the three afflictions are ignorance, craving, and grasping.

original: las gnyis ni /
analyzed: las gnyis ni /
translated: The two actions are

original: 'du byed dang / srid pa'i yan lag gnyis ni las kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: 'du byed dang / srid pa'i yan lag gnyis ni las kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The two members of karmic forces and becoming are by nature karma.

original: gzhi bdun / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / skye ba dang / rga shi ste /
analyzed: gzhi bdun / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / skye ba dang / rga shi ste /
translated: The seven bases are consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, birth, and old age and death.

original: yan lag bdun ni las dang nyon mongs pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir gzhi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yan lag bdun ni las dang nyon mongs pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir gzhi zhes bya'o //
translated: These seven members are called bases because they are the basis of karma and the afflictions.

original: ji ltar yan lag bdun gzhi yin pa /
analyzed: ji ltar yan lag bdun gzhi yin pa /
translated: How are the seven members bases?

original: de bzhin 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: de bzhin 'bras bu ste /
translated: They are results,

original: yan lag bdun po nyid 'bras bur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag bdun po nyid 'bras bur gyur pa'o //
translated: and the seven members are results.

original: lhag ma lnga ni las dang nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir rgyu'o //
analyzed: lhag ma lnga ni las dang nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir rgyu'o //
translated: The remaining five are causes because they are by nature karma and the afflictions.🔽Why are the five bases and the two afflictions taught separately?

original: yang ci'i phyir gzhi rnam pa lnga dang nyon mongs pa rnam pa gnyis tha dad pa'i phyir dbus kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu ni /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir gzhi rnam pa lnga dang nyon mongs pa rnam pa gnyis tha dad pa'i phyir dbus kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu ni /
translated: The middle cause and result are taught extensively

original: rgya cher bstan cing rnam pa gnyis tha dad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgya cher bstan cing rnam pa gnyis tha dad pa'i phyir /
translated: because the two are separate.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi 'bras bu ni mdor bsdus la 'das pa'i dus kyi rgyu ni nyon mongs pa gcig gi sgo nas bstan ce na /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi 'bras bu ni mdor bsdus la 'das pa'i dus kyi rgyu ni nyon mongs pa gcig gi sgo nas bstan ce na /
translated: The result in the future is summarized in the same way. The cause in the past is taught from the perspective of a single affliction.

original: gnyis kyi rgyu 'bras bsdus pa ni //
analyzed: gnyis kyi rgyu 'bras bsdus pa ni //
translated: The cause and result of two are summarized.

original: bar ma'i rjes su dpag pa las //
analyzed: bar ma'i rjes su dpag pa las //
translated: The middle is inferred from the two.

original: bar ma nyid kyi rgyu sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' gnyis pa'i rgyu dang / 'bras bu yang rgya cher rjes su dpag pas ma bshad de /
analyzed: bar ma nyid kyi rgyu sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' gnyis pa'i rgyu dang / 'bras bu yang rgya cher rjes su dpag pas ma bshad de /
translated: The cause of the middle is the past limit, and the result of the middle is the future limit. The cause and result of the two are not explained in detail because they are inferred.

original: yang don med pa'i 'bad pa ni mi bya'o //🔽gal te yang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis 'ba' zhig tu zad ne da lta na ni /
analyzed: yang don med pa'i 'bad pa ni mi bya'o // gal te yang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis 'ba' zhig tu zad ne da lta na ni /
translated: Moreover, one should not exert oneself in a meaningless endeavor.

original: ma rig pa'i rgyu ma bstan pa'i phyir 'khor ba la thog ma can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rgyu ma bstan pa'i phyir 'khor ba la thog ma can du 'gyur ro //
translated: If dependent origination consists of only twelve members, then since the cause of ignorance is not taught, samsara would have a beginning.

original: rga shi'i 'bras bu ma bstan pa'i phyir mtha' dang ldan par yang 'gyur bas /
analyzed: rga shi'i 'bras bu ma bstan pa'i phyir mtha' dang ldan par yang 'gyur bas /
translated: And since the result of aging and death is not taught, it would have an end.

original: yang na yan lag gzhan zhig gis kha bskang bar bya dgos la /
analyzed: yang na yan lag gzhan zhig gis kha bskang bar bya dgos la /
translated: Therefore, either another member should be added or the twelve members should be explained in a different way.

original: de la yang gzhan na ni thug pa med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de la yang gzhan na ni thug pa med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it is said that it is not tenable that the first two are causes of the last two because the first two are not homogeneous with the last two, then it is not tenable that the last two are effects of the first two because the last two are not homogeneous with the first two.

original: gang gi phyir kha bskang mi dgos te /🔽gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis /🔽@140b nyon mongs pa las nyon mongs dang // bya ba nyid do de las gzhi //🔽de las gzhi dang nyon mongs skye //
analyzed: gang gi phyir kha bskang mi dgos te / gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis / @140b nyon mongs pa las nyon mongs dang // bya ba nyid do de las gzhi // de las gzhi dang nyon mongs skye //
translated: If it is said that the first two are causes of the last two because they are homogeneous with them, then it is also not tenable that the last two are effects of the first two because they are not homogeneous with the first two.🔽If it is said that the first two are causes of the last two because they are homogeneous with them, then it is also not tenable that the last two are effects of the first two because they are not homogeneous with the first two.

original: 'di ni srid pa'i yan lag lugs //🔽zhes bstan pa la /
analyzed: 'di ni srid pa'i yan lag lugs // zhes bstan pa la /
translated: If it is said that the first two are causes of the last two because they are homogeneous with them, then it is also not tenable that the last two are effects of the first two because they are not homogeneous with the first two.

original: nyon mongs pa las nyon mongs pa skye ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa las nyon mongs pa skye ste /
translated: If it is said that the first two are causes of the last two because they are homogeneous with them, then it is also not tenble that the last two are effects of the first two because they are not homogeneous with the first two.🔽If it is said that the first two are causes of the last two because they are homogeneous with them, then it is also not tenable that the last two are effects of the first two because they are not homogeneous with the first two.

original: sred pa las len pa'o //🔽nyon mongs pa las las te /🔽len pa las sred pa dang / ma rig pa las 'du byed rnams so //
analyzed: sred pa las len pa'o // nyon mongs pa las las te / len pa las sred pa dang / ma rig pa las 'du byed rnams so //
translated: If it is said that the first two are causes of the last two because they are homogeneous with them, then it is also not tenable that the last two are effects of the first two because they are not homogeneous with the first two.🔽If it is said that the first two are causes of the last two because they are homogeneous with them, then it is also not tenable that the last two are effects of the first two because they are not homogeneous with the first two.

analyzed: mig la sogs pa la yang thal bar 'gyur ro /

original: gal te rig pa med pa zhig yin no zhe na //
analyzed: gal te rig pa med pa zhig yin no zhe na //
translated: If it is the absence of knowledge,

analyzed: de lta na cung zad kyang ma yin par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: then it would be nothing at all,

original: de yang mi rung bas /
analyzed: de yang mi rung bas /

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: rig pa'i mi mthun phyogs chos gzhan //
analyzed: rig pa'i mi mthun phyogs chos gzhan //
translated: it is a separate factor that is the opposite of knowledge,

original: ma rig mi mdza' brdzun sogs bzhin //
analyzed: ma rig mi mdza' brdzun sogs bzhin //
translated: like the opposite of a friend, which is an enemy, and the opposite of truth, which is a lie.

original: ji ltar mdza' bo las bzlog na 'ga' zhig de'i gnyen por gyur pa mi mdza' @141a * //
analyzed: ji ltar mdza' bo las bzlog na 'ga' zhig de'i gnyen por gyur pa mi mdza' @141a * //
translated: If one turns away from a friend, then someone who is the opposite of a friend, an enemy, will be the antidote.🔽

original: ba yod kyi gang mdza' ba gzhan 'ga' zhig kyang dgra ma yin la mdza' ba med pa yang ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ba yod kyi gang mdza' ba gzhan 'ga' zhig kyang dgra ma yin la mdza' ba med pa yang ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: Just as there is an enemy who is the opposite of a friend, but not a third who is neither a friend nor an enemy, so too there is a dharma that is the opposite of clear knowledge, but not a third that is neither clear knowledge nor its opposite.

original: drang po zhes bya ba ni bden pa'o //
analyzed: drang po zhes bya ba ni bden pa'o //
translated: Straightness is truth.

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i tshig ni brdzun yin te /
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i tshig ni brdzun yin te /
translated: Dishonesty is the opposite of that.🔽Unrighteousness, nonutility, and nonaction are the opposites of righteousness, etc.

original: chos ma yin pa dang / don ma yin pa dang / bya ba ma yin pa rnams ni chos la sogs pa'i mi mthun par gyur pa de bzhin du ma rig pa yang rig pa'i mi mthun par gyur pa chos gzhan zhig du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: chos ma yin pa dang / don ma yin pa dang / bya ba ma yin pa rnams ni chos la sogs pa'i mi mthun par gyur pa de bzhin du ma rig pa yang rig pa'i mi mthun par gyur pa chos gzhan zhig du blta bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, ignorance should be regarded as a dharma that is the opposite of clear knowledge, but not as a third that is neither clear knowledge nor its opposite.

original: 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: 'di ga las she na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rkyen gyi ngo bor bstan pa las so //
analyzed: rkyen gyi ngo bor bstan pa las so //
translated: Because it is taught as a condition.

original: gzhan yang / kun du sbyor sogs tshig gi phyir //
analyzed: gzhan yang / kun du sbyor sogs tshig gi phyir //
translated: Moreover, because of the words “fetter,” etc.

original: mdo las ma rig pa ni kun du sbyor ba dang / 'ching ba dang / phra rgyas dang / zag pa dang / chu bo dang / sbyor ba zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa yang med pa tsam la de lta bur 'gyur ba ni 'os pa ma yin la mig la sogs pa yang ma yin pas de bas na ma rig pa ni chos gzhan pa nyid de /
analyzed: mdo las ma rig pa ni kun du sbyor ba dang / 'ching ba dang / phra rgyas dang / zag pa dang / chu bo dang / sbyor ba zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa yang med pa tsam la de lta bur 'gyur ba ni 'os pa ma yin la mig la sogs pa yang ma yin pas de bas na ma rig pa ni chos gzhan pa nyid de /
translated: It is not suitable to call mere nonexistence by such names, nor are the eyes, etc. called by such names. Therefore ignorance is a separate dharma.

original: dper na chung ma ngan pa la chung ma ma yin zhes bya ba dang / bu ngan pa la bu ma yin zhes bya ba ltar ma rig pa yang da bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na chung ma ngan pa la chung ma ma yin zhes bya ba dang / bu ngan pa la bu ma yin zhes bya ba ltar ma rig pa yang da bzhin no //
translated: For example, a bad wife is called a non-wife, and a bad son is called a non-son. Ignorance is also like that.

original: lta phyir shes rab ngan pa min //
analyzed: lta phyir shes rab ngan pa min //
translated: It is not bad wisdom because it is a view.

original: smad pa'i shes rab ni nyon mongs pa can te /
analyzed: smad pa'i shes rab ni nyon mongs pa can te /
translated: Bad wisdom is afflicted.

original: de yang lta ba'i rang bzhin yin na ma rig pa ni mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de yang lta ba'i rang bzhin yin na ma rig pa ni mi 'thad do //
translated: If it were the nature of a view, it would not be tenable as ignorance.

original: 'o na gang lta ba ma yin pa de yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gang lta ba ma yin pa de yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it is not a view, it would be that.

original: de yang yin par 'os ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang yin par 'os ba ma yin te /
translated: That is also not suitable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: lta ba de dang mtshungs ldan phyir //
analyzed: lta ba de dang mtshungs ldan phyir //
translated: Because it is concomitant with that view.

original: gal te ma rig pa shes rab tu gyur na shes rab kyi rdzas gnyis mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gal te ma rig pa shes rab tu gyur na shes rab kyi rdzas gnyis mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i phyir te /
translated: If ignorance were wisdom, then two substances of wisdom would not be concomitant.

original: de dang lta bar mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dang lta bar mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not concomitant with view.

original: 'di las kyang /
analyzed: 'di las kyang /
translated: This is also stated in the sūtras:

original: shes rab nyon mongs bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: shes rab nyon mongs bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to teach that wisdom is an affliction,🔽a sūtra states:

original: mdo las 'dod chags kyis nye ba'i nyon mongs pa can du byas pa'i sems ni rnam par ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: mdo las 'dod chags kyis nye ba'i nyon mongs pa can du byas pa'i sems ni rnam par ma grol ba'o //
translated: A mind that is afflicted by attachment is not liberated.🔽Wisdom that is afflicted by ignorance is not purified.

original: ma rig pas nye ba'i nyon mongs pa can du byas pa'i shes rab ni mi 'dag go zhes gsungs pa yang shes ra ba de nyid pradzny'a de'i nyon mongs pa yin par ni mi rigs kyi /
analyzed: ma rig pas nye ba'i nyon mongs pa can du byas pa'i shes rab ni mi 'dag go zhes gsungs pa yang shes ra ba de nyid pradzny'a de'i nyon mongs pa yin par ni mi rigs kyi /
translated: It is not logical that wisdom itself is the affliction of that wisdom.

original: ji ltar nye ba'i nyon mongs pa 'dod chags sems las gzhan yin zhing rigs tha dad pa ltar shes rab dang ma rig pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar nye ba'i nyon mongs pa 'dod chags sems las gzhan yin zhing rigs tha dad pa ltar shes rab dang ma rig pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as the secondary affliction of attachment is different from the mind and is a different type, so wisdom and ignorance are also like that.

original: ma rig pa'i don bshad zin to //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i don bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of ignorance has been explained.

original: yang ming dang / gzugs zhes bya ba'i don ci zhe na /
analyzed: yang ming dang / gzugs zhes bya ba'i don ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of name and form?

original: gzugs ni rgya cher ji skad du bshad pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs ni rgya cher ji skad du bshad pa'o //
translated: Form is as has been explained at length.

original: ming ni gzugs can ming phung po //
analyzed: ming ni gzugs can ming phung po //
translated: Name is the aggregate of what is without form.

original: ci'i phyir zhen /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhen /
translated: Why is it so?

original: ming dang dbang po dang don gyi dbang gis don la 'jug pa'i phyir @141b ro ;
analyzed: ming dang dbang po dang don gyi dbang gis don la 'jug pa'i phyir @141b ro ;
translated: Because it is the basis of the engagement with the object by means of name and sense faculty.

original: / ming gang gi dbang gis she na /
analyzed: / ming gang gi dbang gis she na /
translated: By the power of what name?

original: gang 'jig rten 'di na grag pa ste /
analyzed: gang 'jig rten 'di na grag pa ste /
translated: By the power of the name that is known in the world.

original: de na de dang de dag rgyan du gyur pa la ba lang dang rta dang gzugs dang ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de na de dang de dag rgyan du gyur pa la ba lang dang rta dang gzugs dang ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: In that case, it is the basis of the engagement with the object by means of the name cow, horse, form, taste, etc.

original: de dag kyang ci'i phyir ming yin zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang ci'i phyir ming yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it called name?

original: don de dang de dag la ming 'jug par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don de dang de dag la ming 'jug par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the cause of the engagement with the object by means of that name.

original: gzhan dag na re 'dir lus por nas skye ba gzhan du gzhol bar byed pa'i phyir ming ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'dir lus por nas skye ba gzhan du gzhol bar byed pa'i phyir ming ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that it is called the aggregate of what is without form because it is the cause of the transference of the body to another existence.

original: skye mched drug bshad zin to //
analyzed: skye mched drug bshad zin to //
translated: The six sense spheres have been explained.

original: reg pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: reg pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: Contact is to be explained.

original: reg drug / mig gi 'dus te reg pa nas yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i bar du ste /
analyzed: reg drug / mig gi 'dus te reg pa nas yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i bar du ste /
translated: There are six contacts: contact through the coming together of eye, form, and consciousness, up to contact through the coming together of mind, mental objects, and consciousness.

original: de dag kyang /
analyzed: de dag kyang /
translated: They are:

original: 'dus te byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'dus te byung ba'o //
translated: 1. contact arising from coming together;

original: dbang po dang don dang rnam par shes pa rnams 'dus pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po dang don dang rnam par shes pa rnams 'dus pa las byung ba'o //
translated: 2. contact arising from the coming together of a faculty, an object, and a consciousness.

original: reg pa drug po de dag las //
analyzed: reg pa drug po de dag las //
translated: From these six contacts,

original: lnga ni thogs pa'i reg pa yin //
analyzed: lnga ni thogs pa'i reg pa yin //
translated: five are contacts that are obstructions.

original: drug pa bla dags tshig ces bya //
analyzed: drug pa bla dags tshig ces bya //
translated: The sixth is called contact that is a designation.

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa lnga ni thogs pa dang bcas pa'i dbang po la brten pa'i thogs pa'i reg pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa lnga ni thogs pa dang bcas pa'i dbang po la brten pa'i thogs pa'i reg pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The five contacts that arise from the coming together of the eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body faculties and their objects are called contacts that are obstructions because they are based on faculties that are obstructions.

original: drug pa yid kyi 'dus te reg pa rnams ni tshig bla dags kyi reg pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: drug pa yid kyi 'dus te reg pa rnams ni tshig bla dags kyi reg pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The sixth contact that arises from the coming together of the mental faculty and its object is called contact that is a designation.

original: ci'i phyir tshig bla dags la ming zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir tshig bla dags la ming zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called a designation?

original: de ni lhag ma la dmigs pas de'i tshig bla dags kyi reg pa zhes bya'o zhes grag go //
analyzed: de ni lhag ma la dmigs pas de'i tshig bla dags kyi reg pa zhes bya'o zhes grag go //
translated: It is said that it is called contact that is a designation because it focuses on the remainder.

original: yang reg pa drug po de dag nyid gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang reg pa drug po de dag nyid gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: These six contacts are also threefold.

original: rig dang ma rig dang gzhan reg / rig pa'i reg pa dang / ma rig pa'i reg pa dang / de gnyis las gzhan pa rig pa yang ma yin ma rig pa yang ma yin pa'i reg pa'o //
analyzed: rig dang ma rig dang gzhan reg / rig pa'i reg pa dang / ma rig pa'i reg pa dang / de gnyis las gzhan pa rig pa yang ma yin ma rig pa yang ma yin pa'i reg pa'o //
translated: Contact of knowledge, contact of non-knowledge, and contact other than those two.

original: de dag kyang rim bzhin du /
analyzed: de dag kyang rim bzhin du /
translated: They are, respectively:

original: dri med nyon mongs can lhag ma //
analyzed: dri med nyon mongs can lhag ma //
translated: 1. uncontaminated, 2. afflicted, and 3. the remainder.

original: rig pa'i reg pa ni zag pa med pa'i reg pa'o //
analyzed: rig pa'i reg pa ni zag pa med pa'i reg pa'o //
translated: Contact of knowledge is uncontaminated contact.

original: ma rig pa'i reg pa ni nyon mongs pa can gyi reg pa ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i reg pa ni nyon mongs pa can gyi reg pa ste /
translated: Contact of non-knowledge is afflicted contact.

original: rig pa dang ma rig pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rig pa dang ma rig pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is associated with knowledge and non-knowledge.

original: lhag ma ni gnyi ga dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i phyir rig pa yang ma yin ma rig pa yang ma yin pa'i reg pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni gnyi ga dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i phyir rig pa yang ma yin ma rig pa yang ma yin pa'i reg pa'o //
translated: The remainder is contact that is neither knowledge nor non-knowledge because it is not associated with either.

original: lhag ma yang gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: lhag ma yang gang zhig ce na /
translated: What is the remainder?

original: dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa dang ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa dang ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: It is virtue that is contaminated and unobscured neutral states.

original: yang ma rig pa'i reg pa ni yang dang yang du kun du 'byung bas phyogs gcig smos pas reg pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang ma rig pa'i reg pa ni yang dang yang du kun du 'byung bas phyogs gcig smos pas reg pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, contact of non-knowledge is contact that arises repeatedly. Therefore, contact is twofold, since one part is mentioned.

original: gnod sems rjes su chags pa'i reg / gnod sems dang / rjes su chags pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod sems rjes su chags pa'i reg / gnod sems dang / rjes su chags pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Contact associated with malice and attachment.

original: yang thams cad bsdu na /
analyzed: yang thams cad bsdu na /
translated: If one combines all the contacts, there are three:

original: bde ba tshor ba 'gyur @142a * //
analyzed: bde ba tshor ba 'gyur @142a * //
translated: contact that is conducive to pleasant experience, etc.

original: sogs gsum // bde ba tshor bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa dang sdug bsngal tshor bar 'gyur ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa tshor bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: sogs gsum // bde ba tshor bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa dang sdug bsngal tshor bar 'gyur ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa tshor bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Contact that is conducive to pleasant experience, contact that is conducive to unpleasant experience, and contact that is conducive to neither pleasant nor unpleasant experience.

original: bde ba la sogs pa dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are conducive to pleasant feeling, etc.

original: de ltar na reg pa de dag ni bcu drug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na reg pa de dag ni bcu drug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, there are sixteen types of contact.

original: reg pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: reg pa bshad zin to //
translated: Contact has been explained.

original: tshor ba brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: tshor ba brjod par bya ste /
translated: Feeling will now be discussed.🔽The six feelings that arise from the six types of contact

original: de la sngar reg pa rnam pa drug bshad pa gang yin pa /
analyzed: de la sngar reg pa rnam pa drug bshad pa gang yin pa /
translated: that were previously explained🔽arise from the six types of contact that were previously explained.

original: de las byung ba tshor ba drug / mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba nas yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dag las byung ba'i bar te /
analyzed: de las byung ba tshor ba drug / mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba nas yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dag las byung ba'i bar te /
translated: The feeling that arises from contact with the eye up to the feeling that arises from contact with the mind.

original: de dag las /
analyzed: de dag las /
translated: From these,

original: lnga ni lus kyi sems kyi gzhan /
analyzed: lnga ni lus kyi sems kyi gzhan /
translated: Five are bodily, mental the other.

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba lnga ni dbang po gzugs can la brten pa'i phyir lus kyi tshor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba lnga ni dbang po gzugs can la brten pa'i phyir lus kyi tshor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The five sensations which arise from the contact of the five material sense faculties with their objects are called bodily sensations because they are supported on material sense faculties.

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba ni sems tsam la brten pa'i phyir sems kyi zhes bya'o //🔽de nyid nye bar rgyu ba la ;🔽/ rnam par dag ni yang bco brgyad //
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba ni sems tsam la brten pa'i phyir sems kyi zhes bya'o // de nyid nye bar rgyu ba la ; / rnam par dag ni yang bco brgyad //
translated: The sensation which arises from the contact of the mental faculty is called mental sensation because it is supported on the mind alone.

original: yang sems kyi tshor ba nyid ni /
analyzed: yang sems kyi tshor ba nyid ni /
translated: The same sensation is also called the eighteen stations of contact of the mind.

original: yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba bco brgyad rnam par gzhag pa las rnam pa bco brgyad du dbye'o //
analyzed: yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba bco brgyad rnam par gzhag pa las rnam pa bco brgyad du dbye'o //
translated: The eighteen stations of contact of the mind are established from the point of view of the eighteen mental activities.🔽The mental sensation is divided into eighteen types by reason of the eighteen mental activities.

original: yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba bco brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba bco brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eighteen mental activities?

original: yid bde ba'i nye bar rgyu ba drug dang / yid mi bde ba'i nye bar rgyu ba drug dang / btang snyoms kyi nye bar rgyu ba drug ste /
analyzed: yid bde ba'i nye bar rgyu ba drug dang / yid mi bde ba'i nye bar rgyu ba drug dang / btang snyoms kyi nye bar rgyu ba drug ste /
translated: Six are agreeable mental activities, six are disagreeable mental activities, and six are neither agreeable nor disagreeable mental activities.

original: yid bde ba la sogs pa de dag yid la brten nas de dag yul la nye bar rgyu ba'i phyir yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba'am /
analyzed: yid bde ba la sogs pa de dag yid la brten nas de dag yul la nye bar rgyu ba'i phyir yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba'am /
translated: Because they are the movement of the mind toward objects, they are mental activities.

original: yul dag la nye bar rgyu bas yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba ste /
analyzed: yul dag la nye bar rgyu bas yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba ste /
translated: Or, they are mental activities because they are the movement of the mind toward objects.

original: tshor ba'i dbang gis yul rnams la yid yang dang yang du rnam par rgyu ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba'i dbang gis yul rnams la yid yang dang yang du rnam par rgyu ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the influence of feeling, the mind moves again and again toward objects.

original: yang yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba 'di dag las 'dod pa dang ldan pa ni du zhe na /
analyzed: yang yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba 'di dag las 'dod pa dang ldan pa ni du zhe na /
translated: How many of these mental activities are associated with the realm of desire?🔽What is the object of each of them?

original: de dag las du'i dmigs pa ni ci zhig yin zhes bya ba nas de bzhin du gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i bar du yang brjod par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: de dag las du'i dmigs pa ni ci zhig yin zhes bya ba nas de bzhin du gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i bar du yang brjod par bya'o zhe na /
translated: The same question should be asked up to the formless realm.

original: smras pa / 'dod pa rang la dmigs thams cad //
analyzed: smras pa / 'dod pa rang la dmigs thams cad //
translated: All of them have the realm of desire as their object.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dag na ni bco brgyad rim gyis yod de /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dag na ni bco brgyad rim gyis yod de /
translated: In the realm of desire, all eighteen mental activities exist in sequence.

original: de yang de dag thams cad kyi dmigs pa yang de yin no //
analyzed: de yang de dag thams cad kyi dmigs pa yang de yin no //
translated: The realm of desire is the object of all of them.

original: de rnams nyid las gzugs can bcu gnyis spyod yul lo //
analyzed: de rnams nyid las gzugs can bcu gnyis spyod yul lo //
translated: Twelve of them have form as their object.

original: gzugs kyi khams su ni dri dang ro dang nye bar rgyu ba drug ma gtogs pa bcu gnyis la dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams su ni dri dang ro dang nye bar rgyu ba drug ma gtogs pa bcu gnyis la dmigs pa ste /
translated: In the form realm, twelve are objects, excluding the six that are related to smell and taste.

original: de na de gnyis med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de na de gnyis med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those two do not exist there.

original: gong ma'i gsum dag /🔽spyod yul @142b zhes bya bar sbyar te //🔽gzugs med pa'i khams kyi ni gsum ste /
analyzed: gong ma'i gsum dag / spyod yul @142b zhes bya bar sbyar te // gzugs med pa'i khams kyi ni gsum ste /
translated: The three of the higher realms🔽are the domain of the formless realm.

original: de ni gzugs la sogs pa med pa'i phyir dmigs pa chos la nye bar rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: de ni gzugs la sogs pa med pa'i phyir dmigs pa chos la nye bar rgyu ba'o //
translated: The formless realm has three that are related to phenomena as objects, because form and so on do not exist there.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang ldan pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang ldan pa bshad zin to //
translated: The explanation of those associated with the desire realm is complete.

original: gzugs dang ldan pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs dang ldan pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: Those associated with the form realm should be mentioned next.

original: de la re zhig / bsam gtan gnyis /
analyzed: de la re zhig / bsam gtan gnyis /
translated: In the first two absorptions,

original: bcu gnyis / yid mi bde ba'i nye bar rgyu ba ma gtogs so //
analyzed: bcu gnyis / yid mi bde ba'i nye bar rgyu ba ma gtogs so //
translated: there are twelve, excluding those that are related to mental dissatisfaction.

original: bcu gnyis po de dag kyang /🔽'dod par 'gro ba rnams /
analyzed: bcu gnyis po de dag kyang / 'dod par 'gro ba rnams /
translated: Those twelve🔽are the domain of those who go to the desire realm.

original: 'dod par 'gro bas na 'dod par 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: 'dod par 'gro bas na 'dod par 'gro ba ste /
translated: Those who go to the desire realm are those who go to the desire realm.

original: 'dod pa'i khams la dmigs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams la dmigs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that they focus on the desire realm.

original: ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
translated: How are they known to be so?

original: yul rnams la 'dzin pa'i don la 'gro bar sbyor ba yang mthong ste /
analyzed: yul rnams la 'dzin pa'i don la 'gro bar sbyor ba yang mthong ste /
translated: We see that the mind is applied to the object of the realm of fine-materiality.

original: de ltar rtogs par bya'o //🔽rang la dmigs pa brgyad /
analyzed: de ltar rtogs par bya'o // rang la dmigs pa brgyad /
translated: This is how it is to be understood.🔽Eight of them have the realm of fine-materiality for their cognitive object.

original: gzugs kyi khams de nyid na ni yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba brgyad de dag gi dmigs pa rang gi ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams de nyid na ni yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba brgyad de dag gi dmigs pa rang gi ste /
translated: In the realm of fine-materiality, there are eight of them, having the realm of fine-materiality for their object-field.

original: dri dang ro la nye bar rgyu ba bzhi ma gtogs so //🔽gzugs med gnyis /
analyzed: dri dang ro la nye bar rgyu ba bzhi ma gtogs so // gzugs med gnyis /
translated: The four of the sphere of odor and of the sphere of taste are excluded.🔽Two of them have the realm of immateriality for their object-field.

original: dmigs pa chos la nye bar rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa chos la nye bar rgyu ba'o //
translated: The two of the sphere of factors are the ones that have the realm of immateriality for their object-field.🔽Six of them have the second and the third meditation for their cognitive object.

original: bsam gtan gnyis drug / bsam gtan gsum pa dang bzhi pa gnyis na ni btang snyoms kyi nye bar rgyu ba drug 'ba' zhig yod kyi gzhan dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis drug / bsam gtan gsum pa dang bzhi pa gnyis na ni btang snyoms kyi nye bar rgyu ba drug 'ba' zhig yod kyi gzhan dag ni ma yin no //
translated: In the second and the third meditation, there are only six of them, namely, those of the sphere of the tangible, of the visual consciousness, etc.

original: de dag gi dmigs pa yang /🔽'dod pa'i drug ste /
analyzed: de dag gi dmigs pa yang / 'dod pa'i drug ste /
translated: The other ones are absent there.🔽The six of the realm of desire are their object-field.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi drug car yang dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi drug car yang dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The six of the realm of desire are the object-field of these six.

original: rang gi bzhi yin no //🔽gzugs kyi khams na ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: rang gi bzhi yin no // gzugs kyi khams na ni bzhi ste /
translated: Four of them have the realm of fine-materiality for their object-field.

original: de na dri dang ro med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de na dri dang ro med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the realm of fine-materiality, there are four of them, because odor and taste are absent there.

original: gong ma'i dmigs pa gcig yin no //
analyzed: gong ma'i dmigs pa gcig yin no //
translated: One of them has the higher realm for its object-field.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams su ni dmigs pa chos la nye bar rgyu ba gcig pu'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams su ni dmigs pa chos la nye bar rgyu ba gcig pu'o //
translated: In the formless realm, there is only one, the application of the mental faculty to the object-field of factors.

original: gzugs dang ldan pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: gzugs dang ldan pa bshad zin to //
translated: The applications of the mental faculty to the object-fields associated with the realm of fine-materiality have been discussed.

original: da ni gzugs med pa dang ldan pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni gzugs med pa dang ldan pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now we must discuss those associated with the formless realm.

original: gzugs med nye bar bsdogs la bzhi //
analyzed: gzugs med nye bar bsdogs la bzhi //
translated: Four in the preparatory meditation of the formless realm.

original: 'dir ni nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la nyer bar bsdogs pas na /🔽nye bar bsdogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la nyer bar bsdogs pas na / nye bar bsdogs pa ste /
translated: In the preparatory meditation of the perception-sphere of infinite space, there are four applications of the mental faculty to the object-fields:

original: der ni gzugs dang / skra dang / reg bya dang chos la nye bar rgyu ba bzhi'o //🔽de dag kyang /
analyzed: der ni gzugs dang / skra dang / reg bya dang chos la nye bar rgyu ba bzhi'o // de dag kyang /
translated: the application of the mental faculty to visible form, to sound, to tangibles, and to factors.🔽These four applications of the mental faculty to the object-fields

original: gzugs 'gro / de dag gi dmigs pa ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'o//🔽gong mar 'gro ba gcig / gzugs med pa'i khams la dmigs na ni der chos la nye bar rgyu ba gcig pu'o //
analyzed: gzugs 'gro / de dag gi dmigs pa ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'o// gong mar 'gro ba gcig / gzugs med pa'i khams la dmigs na ni der chos la nye bar rgyu ba gcig pu'o //
translated: are directed to the fourth meditation.🔽When they are directed to the formless realm, there is only one application of the mental faculty to the object-field of factors.

original: dngos gzhi la gcig / gzugs med pa'i dngos gzhi la ni chos la nye bar rgyu ba 'ba' zhig yod kyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la gcig / gzugs med pa'i dngos gzhi la ni chos la nye bar rgyu ba 'ba' zhig yod kyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: In the actual meditative attainment of the formless realm, there is only one application of the mental faculty to the object-field of factors.

original: de yang rang gi yul gzugs med pa la dmigs pa nyid do//
analyzed: de yang rang gi yul gzugs med pa la dmigs pa nyid do//
translated: This application of the mental faculty to the object-field of factors is directed to the formless realm which is its object-field.

original: @143a * // gzugs med pa'i khams kyi dngos gzhi'i ni 'og ma la mi dmigs so zhes 'og nas 'chad do //🔽yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba 'di dag kyang /
analyzed: @143a * // gzugs med pa'i khams kyi dngos gzhi'i ni 'og ma la mi dmigs so zhes 'og nas 'chad do // yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba 'di dag kyang /
translated: The fundamental meditative attainments of the formless realm do not focus on lower levels, as will be explained later.🔽These eighteen mental applications

original: bco brgyad thams cad zag dang bcas //
analyzed: bco brgyad thams cad zag dang bcas //
translated: are all contaminated.

original: zag pa med pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: zag pa med pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: None are uncontaminated.

original: de ltar na tshor ba zhes bya ba'i yan lag ni rnam pa du mar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na tshor ba zhes bya ba'i yan lag ni rnam pa du mar rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus the factor called feeling should be understood as manifold.

original: yan lag lhag ma rnams ni yang mi brjod do //
analyzed: yan lag lhag ma rnams ni yang mi brjod do //
translated: The remaining factors will not be discussed.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bshad dang 'chad par 'gyur ba gzhan //🔽'di'i yan lag kha cig ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: bshad dang 'chad par 'gyur ba gzhan // 'di'i yan lag kha cig ni bshad zin to //
translated: Others will be explained or have been explained.

original: kha cig ni 'og nas 'chad de /
analyzed: kha cig ni 'og nas 'chad de /
translated: Some of its factors have been explained and some will be explained later.

original: de la re zhig rnam par shes pa ni /
analyzed: de la re zhig rnam par shes pa ni /
translated: Among them, consciousness has been explained as follows:

original: rnam shes so sor rnam rig pa //
analyzed: rnam shes so sor rnam rig pa //
translated: Consciousness is the individual’s awareness.

original: yid kyi skye mched kyang de yin //🔽zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: yid kyi skye mched kyang de yin // zhes bshad zin to //
translated: It is also the mental base.

original: skye mched drug kyang /
analyzed: skye mched drug kyang /
translated: The six bases have been explained as follows:

original: mig la sogs pa gzugs dang ba //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa gzugs dang ba //
translated: The eye and so on are the visible form base.

original: de ni rnam par shes pa'i rten //🔽zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes pa'i rten //🔽zhes bshad zin to //
translated: They are the support of consciousness.

original: 'du byed dang srid pa ni las kyi mdzod kyi gnas nas 'chad do //
analyzed: 'du byed dang srid pa ni las kyi mdzod kyi gnas nas 'chad do //
translated: Action and becoming will be explained in the chapter on the storehouse of action.

original: sred pa dang / lan pa ni phra rgyas kyi mdzod kyi gnas nas 'chad do //
analyzed: sred pa dang / lan pa ni phra rgyas kyi mdzod kyi gnas nas 'chad do //
translated: Craving and grasping will be explained in the chapter on the storehouse of the proclivities.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de dag kyang mdor bsdu na nyon mongs pa dang las dang gzhi rnams so zhes sngar bstan pa la /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de dag kyang mdor bsdu na nyon mongs pa dang las dang gzhi rnams so zhes sngar bstan pa la /
translated: The members of dependent origination are, in brief, defilement, action, and a basis.

original: 'dir ni nyon mongs pa 'dod pa //
analyzed: 'dir ni nyon mongs pa 'dod pa //
translated: Here, defilement is like a seed,

original: sa bon bzhin klu rtsa ba dang // ljon shing de bzhin phub ma bzhin //
analyzed: sa bon bzhin klu rtsa ba dang // ljon shing de bzhin phub ma bzhin //
translated: like a naga, like a root, like a tree, like a husk of grain.

original: sa bon la sogs pa dang chos mthun pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: sa bon la sogs pa dang chos mthun pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How are they similar to a seed, etc.?

original: dper na sa bon la ni myu gu dang / sdong bu dang / lo ma la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du nyon mongs pa las kyang nyon mongs pa dang las dang gzhi rnams 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dper na sa bon la ni myu gu dang / sdong bu dang / lo ma la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du nyon mongs pa las kyang nyon mongs pa dang las dang gzhi rnams 'byung ngo //
translated: Just as a seed is the cause of the sprout, stem, leaf, etc., so too is defilement the cause of defilement, action, and a basis.

original: dpen na chu klu gnas pa'i mtsho ni skam par mi 'gyur ba ltar /
analyzed: dpen na chu klu gnas pa'i mtsho ni skam par mi 'gyur ba ltar /
translated: Just as a lake inhabited by a naga does not go dry,

original: nyon mongs pa'i klu gnas pa'i tshe yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i klu gnas pa'i tshe yang de bzhin no //
translated: so too the life of one who is the abode of the naga of defilement.

original: dper na nags kyi tshal drung nas ma phyung ba yang dang yang du bcad kyang slar skye ba ltar /
analyzed: dper na nags kyi tshal drung nas ma phyung ba yang dang yang du bcad kyang slar skye ba ltar /
translated: For example, even if you cut down a tree in a forest, it will grow back if you do not dig it up from the roots.

original: nyon mongs pa rtsa nas ma bton ba'i 'gro ba rnams kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rtsa nas ma bton ba'i 'gro ba rnams kyang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as a tree cut down at the base grows again from the stump, so it is with the world, which is not uprooted from the defilements.

original: dper na shing ljon pa dus dus su me tog dang 'bras bu rnams 'phel ba de bzhin du nyon mongs pa yang lan cig ma yin par nyon mongs pa dang / las dang / gzhi'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
