analyzed: dper na shing ljon pa dus dus su me tog dang 'bras bu rnams 'phel ba de bzhin du nyon mongs pa yang lan cig ma yin par nyon mongs pa dang / las dang / gzhi'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as a tree, from time to time, produces flowers and fruits, so the defilements, from time to time, produce defilements, actions and sufferings.

original: dper na phub ma dang bcas pa'i 'bras thug po che ni skye bar nus kyi 'ba' zhig ni ma yin pa de bzhin du nyon mongs pa'i thob pa dang 'brel ba'i las kyang tshe gzhan bskyed par nus par 'gyur gyi 'ba' zhig ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dper na phub ma dang bcas pa'i 'bras thug po che ni skye bar nus kyi 'ba' zhig ni ma yin pa de bzhin du nyon mongs pa'i thob pa dang 'brel ba'i las kyang tshe gzhan bskyed par nus par 'gyur gyi 'ba' zhig ni ma yin te /
translated: Just as a grain of rice, covered with its husk, is not fit to be eaten, but is fit to be sown, so the life of those who are bound to the possession of the defilements is not fit to be enjoyed, but is fit to produce a new existence.

original: de ltar na nyon mongs pa ni sa bon la sogs pa lta bur rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na nyon mongs pa ni sa bon la sogs pa lta bur rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus the defilements are like a seed, etc.

original: las @143b ni phub bcas 'bras dang bcas //
analyzed: las @143b ni phub bcas 'bras dang bcas //
translated: Action is like grain covered with its husk,

original: de bzhin sman dang me tog bzhin //
analyzed: de bzhin sman dang me tog bzhin //
translated: like medicine, like a flower.

original: phub ma 'di la yod pas phub ma dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: phub ma 'di la yod pas phub ma dang bcas pa ste /
translated: It is accompanied by chaff because it is associated with chaff.

original: phub ma lta bu'i nyon mongs pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: phub ma lta bu'i nyon mongs pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: The afflictions are like chaff, as has been explained.

original: da ni phub ma dang bcas pa'i 'bras lta bu'i las brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni phub ma dang bcas pa'i 'bras lta bu'i las brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, karma is like grain accompanied by chaff.

original: dper na nas dang sman 'bras bu mthar smin pa ltar /
analyzed: dper na nas dang sman 'bras bu mthar smin pa ltar /
translated: For example, barley and rice are ripe when their fruit ripens.

original: las kyang rnam par smin zin nas yang rnam par smin mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las kyang rnam par smin zin nas yang rnam par smin mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Likewise, karma is said to be ripe when its result has ripened, because it is no longer capable of producing another result.

original: dper na me tog ni 'bras bu skyed pa'i nye ba'i rgyu yin pa ltar /
analyzed: dper na me tog ni 'bras bu skyed pa'i nye ba'i rgyu yin pa ltar /
translated: For example, a flower is the immediate cause of the production of the fruit.

original: las rnams kyi rnam par smin pa skyes pa la yang de bzhin du rig bar bya'o //
analyzed: las rnams kyi rnam par smin pa skyes pa la yang de bzhin du rig bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the result of karma is understood to be produced from karma that has already ripened.

original: gzhi ni grub pa'i bza' btung bzhin //🔽dper na grub zin pa'i bza' ba dang btung ba ni yongs su longs spyad par bya ba 'ba' zhig yin gyi yang bskyed par bya ba ma yin pa ltar /
analyzed: gzhi ni grub pa'i bza' btung bzhin // dper na grub zin pa'i bza' ba dang btung ba ni yongs su longs spyad par bya ba 'ba' zhig yin gyi yang bskyed par bya ba ma yin pa ltar /
translated: The basis is like food and drink that have already been prepared.🔽For example, food and drink that have already been prepared are only to be enjoyed, not to be prepared again.

original: rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba'i gzhi yang /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba'i gzhi yang /
translated: In the same way, the basis called result is only to be enjoyed, not to be produced again.

original: yang rnam par smin pa las tshe rabs gzhan du rnam par smin pa gzhan dang 'brel pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yang rnam par smin pa las tshe rabs gzhan du rnam par smin pa gzhan dang 'brel pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Also, the maturational result does not link to another maturational result in another life.

original: gal te 'brel na ni thar bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'brel na ni thar bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it did link, there would be no liberation.🔽The continuum of life is the stream of life.

original: yang tshe'i rgyun te de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba na /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang tshe'i rgyun te de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba na / 'di lta ste /
translated: Thus, it is said that dependent origination🔽does not transcend the four existences:

original: srid pa bar ma dang / skye ba'i srid pa dang / srid pa phyi ma dang / 'chi ba'i srid pa dang / srid pa bzhi las mi 'da' ste /
analyzed: srid pa bar ma dang / skye ba'i srid pa dang / srid pa phyi ma dang / 'chi ba'i srid pa dang / srid pa bzhi las mi 'da' ste /
translated: the intermediate existence, the birth existence, the existence of the prior period, and the death existence.

original: de dag ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: de dag ni bshad zin to //
translated: These have already been explained.

original: srid pa bzhi po de dag las //
analyzed: srid pa bzhi po de dag las //
translated: From among those four existences,

original: skye ba'i srid pa nyon mongs can //
analyzed: skye ba'i srid pa nyon mongs can //
translated: the birth existence is afflicted.

original: gcig tu ste /
analyzed: gcig tu ste /
translated: It is only afflicted.

original: nyon mongs pa gang gis she na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa gang gis she na /
translated: By what afflictions?

original: nyon mongs kun gyis rangs pas //
analyzed: nyon mongs kun gyis rangs pas //
translated: It is completely afflicted by all afflictions.

original: skye ba'i srid pas gang ba'i yin pas de pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis te /
analyzed: skye ba'i srid pas gang ba'i yin pas de pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis te /
translated: The birth existence is completely afflicted by all afflictions because it is the existence of all afflictions.

original: gang gis nyid mtshams sbyor ba 'ching bar dgag pa'i nyon mongs pa ni med do //
analyzed: gang gis nyid mtshams sbyor ba 'ching bar dgag pa'i nyon mongs pa ni med do //
translated: There are no afflictions that obstruct the linking of consciousness at conception.

original: gzhan rnam gsum ste /
analyzed: gzhan rnam gsum ste /
translated: The other three existences are of three types.

original: srid pa bar ma la sogs pa srid pa gzhan gsum ni dge ba dang / nyon mongs pa can dang / lung du ma bstan pa rnam pa gsum ga yin no //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma la sogs pa srid pa gzhan gsum ni dge ba dang / nyon mongs pa can dang / lung du ma bstan pa rnam pa gsum ga yin no //
translated: The other three modes of existence, namely, intermediate existence, etc., are of three types: wholesome, unwholesome, non-defined.

original: yang srid pa 'di rnams las gang zhig gang dang ldan zhe na /
analyzed: yang srid pa 'di rnams las gang zhig gang dang ldan zhe na /
translated: Which mode of existence is associated with which realm?

original: gzugs med gsum /
analyzed: gzugs med gsum /
translated: Three in the realm of immateriality.

original: srid pa bar ma ma gtogs te //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma ma gtogs te //
translated: Except for intermediate existence.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni gang du phyin par bya ba'i phyir srid pa bar ma la mngon par grub pa'i gnas gzhan yongs su 'chad pa med do //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni gang du phyin par bya ba'i phyir srid pa bar ma la mngon par grub pa'i gnas gzhan yongs su 'chad pa med do //
translated: In the realm of immateriality, there is no intermediate existence, because there is no place to go to in order to be reborn.

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams kyi ni grangs ma smos pas srid pa bzhi po ril gyis yod do zhes snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams kyi ni grangs ma smos pas srid pa bzhi po ril gyis yod do zhes snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the realm of desire and in the realm of finemateriality, the four modes of existence are found, because the Sūtra does not specify.

original: sems can rnams kyi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ji lta ba bzhin du rgya cher bshad zin to //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ji lta ba bzhin du rgya cher bshad zin to //
translated: We have explained at length the dependent origination of sentient beings.

original: @144a * // yang sems can rnams ji ltar gnas par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: @144a * // yang sems can rnams ji ltar gnas par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How do sentient beings live?

original: smras pa / zas kyis 'gro ba gnas pa yin //
analyzed: smras pa / zas kyis 'gro ba gnas pa yin //
translated: They live by means of the sustenances.

original: bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis mkhyen pas mngon par sangs rgyas nas chos gcig bka' stsal pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis mkhyen pas mngon par sangs rgyas nas chos gcig bka' stsal pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The Bhagavat himself, knowing this, having manifestly attained Buddhahood, taught one Dharma:🔽Sentient beings abide through nutriment.

original: sems can ni zas kyis gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mdo'i tshig go ;
analyzed: sems can ni zas kyis gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mdo'i tshig go ;
translated: This is the statement of the sutra.

original: / zas rnams kyang gang dag cig ce na /
analyzed: / zas rnams kyang gang dag cig ce na /
translated: What are the nutriments?

original: zas ni bzhi sta /
analyzed: zas ni bzhi sta /
translated: There are four nutriments:

original: kham gyi zas dang / rags pa dang / phra ba'o //
analyzed: kham gyi zas dang / rags pa dang / phra ba'o //
translated: gross and subtle oral food.

original: phra ba ni srid pa bar ma rnams dri za ba'i phyir ba dang / lha rnams dang bskal pa dang po rnams rgyu mthun pa med pa'i phyir bye ma'i nang du til mar blugs pa bzhin pa'am /
analyzed: phra ba ni srid pa bar ma rnams dri za ba'i phyir ba dang / lha rnams dang bskal pa dang po rnams rgyu mthun pa med pa'i phyir bye ma'i nang du til mar blugs pa bzhin pa'am /
translated: The subtle is that of intermediate beings, because they eat odors, and that of gods and those in the first eon, because they do not have natural nutriment, like pouring oil into sand.

original: phra mo rnams kyi yin pas phra mo ste /
analyzed: phra mo rnams kyi yin pas phra mo ste /
translated: Or it is subtle because it is that of subtle beings.

original: byis pa dang drod gsher las skye ba rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: byis pa dang drod gsher las skye ba rnams kyi'o //
translated: It is that of infants and those born from heat and moisture.

original: reg pa ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: reg pa ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: Contact is the second.

original: yid la sems pa ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: yid la sems pa ni gsum pa'o //
translated: Mental intention is the third.

original: rnam par shes pa ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: Consciousness is the fourth.

original: yang de la /
analyzed: yang de la /
translated: Moreover,

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi zas yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi zas yin no //
translated: it is the nutriment of the desire realm.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag na ni de'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams der skye ba'i phyir ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag na ni de'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams der skye ba'i phyir ma yin no //
translated: In the realm of fine-materiality and the realm of immateriality, beings are not nourished by it, because they are detached from it.

original: de yang / skye mched gsum gyi bdag nyid de /
analyzed: de yang / skye mched gsum gyi bdag nyid de /
translated: It is of the nature of three sense-spheres.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i ro dang / dri dang / reg bya rnams te /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i ro dang / dri dang / reg bya rnams te /
translated: It is the object-fields of taste, smell and touch in the realm of desire.

original: kha dang snas kham du bcad nas kham du byas te med pa'i phyir thams cad kyang kham gyi zas so //
analyzed: kha dang snas kham du bcad nas kham du byas te med pa'i phyir thams cad kyang kham gyi zas so //
translated: All of it is material food, because it is swallowed by way of the mouth, after having been reduced to a state of liquidity and malleability.

original: gzugs kyi skye mched ma yin /
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye mched ma yin /
translated: It is not the sense-sphere of visible form.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: des / rang dbang grol ba mi 'dzin phyir//
analyzed: des / rang dbang grol ba mi 'dzin phyir//
translated: Because it does not nourish by its presence.

original: zas zhes bya ba ni gang rang gi dbang po dang 'byung ba chen po rnams la phan 'dogs pa yin na /
analyzed: zas zhes bya ba ni gang rang gi dbang po dang 'byung ba chen po rnams la phan 'dogs pa yin na /
translated: Food is that which nourishes the sense-faculties and the fundamental material elements of oneself.

original: gzugs ni med pa'i tshe rang gi dbang po'am /
analyzed: gzugs ni med pa'i tshe rang gi dbang po'am /
translated: When visible form is absent, it does not nourish the sense-faculty of sight or the fundamental material elements of the sense-faculty of sight.

original: de'i 'byung ba chen po rnams la yang phan mi 'dogs na yul ma yin pa'i phyir gzhan la lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: de'i 'byung ba chen po rnams la yang phan mi 'dogs na yul ma yin pa'i phyir gzhan la lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: A fortiori, it does not nourish the other sense-faculties and the fundamental material elements of the other sense-faculties, because it is not their object-field.

original: gang gi tshe mthong ba na bde ba dang / yid bde ba skyed pa de'i tshe yang de la dmigs pa las bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa'i zas su 'gyur gyi gzugs ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe mthong ba na bde ba dang / yid bde ba skyed pa de'i tshe yang de la dmigs pa las bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa'i zas su 'gyur gyi gzugs ni ma yin no //
translated: When one sees it, if it produces pleasure and satisfaction, then it is the nutriment of contact that is conducive to pleasure.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba dang dgra bcom pa grol ba rnams zas shin tu yid du 'ong ba mthong yang phan 'dogs pa med pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba dang dgra bcom pa grol ba rnams zas shin tu yid du 'ong ba mthong yang phan 'dogs pa med pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: But form is not nutriment, because even when a non-returner or an arhat who is liberated sees very desirable food, it does not benefit them.

original: reg dang sems pa rnam shes ni //
analyzed: reg dang sems pa rnam shes ni //
translated: Contact, intention, and consciousness

original: zag bcas zas rnams gsum dag tu //
analyzed: zag bcas zas rnams gsum dag tu //
translated: are the three nutriments that are included in the contaminated aggregates.

original: gsum 'dus pa las byung ba'i reg pa dang / yid kyi las sems pa dang / rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: gsum 'dus pa las byung ba'i reg pa dang / yid kyi las sems pa dang / rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: Contact that arises from the coming together of the three, intention which is mental activity, and consciousness are the three nutriments that are included in the contaminated aggregates.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa rnams ni khams gsum dag na yod do //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa rnams ni khams gsum dag na yod do //
translated: They exist in the three realms.

original: ci'i phyir zag pa med pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zag pa med pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why are they not uncontaminated?

original: zas kyi chos las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zas kyi chos las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they transcend the meaning of nutriment.

original: @144b srid pa gso bar byed pa'i don ni zas kyi don te /
analyzed: @144b srid pa gso bar byed pa'i don ni zas kyi don te /
translated: The meaning of nutriment is to nourish existence.

original: mdo las ji skad du /
analyzed: mdo las ji skad du /
translated: As a sutra explains:

original: zas bzhi po 'di dag ni sems can byung ba rnams gnas par bya ba dang / 'tshe bar bya ba dang / srid pa tshol ba rnams la phan 'dogs par byed pa'o zhes gsungs na /
analyzed: zas bzhi po 'di dag ni sems can byung ba rnams gnas par bya ba dang / 'tshe bar bya ba dang / srid pa tshol ba rnams la phan 'dogs par byed pa'o zhes gsungs na /
translated: These four nutriments are for the maintenance of sentient beings who have already arisen, for the assistance of those seeking to exist, and for the assistance of those seeking birth.

original: zag pa med pa'i chos ni de lta ma yin pas zas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos ni de lta ma yin pas zas ma yin pa'o //
translated: But this is not the case for the uncontaminated dharmas, so they are not nutriments.

original: re zhig byung ba ni sems can skyes pa yin par yang mngon na /
analyzed: re zhig byung ba ni sems can skyes pa yin par yang mngon na /
translated: It is clear that “those who have already arisen” are sentient beings who have already been born.

original: srid pa tshol ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: srid pa tshol ba gang zhe na /
translated: But who are those “seeking to exist”?🔽Those seeking birth are of five kinds:🔽those born of mind, those seeking existence,

original: yid las byung dang srid 'tshol dang // dri za srid pa bar ma dang // 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: yid las byung dang srid 'tshol dang // dri za srid pa bar ma dang // 'grub pa'o //
translated: those who smell, those who exist in the intermediate state, and those who are established.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis srid pa bar ma ni 'di dag tu brjod par gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis srid pa bar ma ni 'di dag tu brjod par gsungs so //
translated: The Lord has said that those who exist in the intermediate state are included in these five.

original: de ni yid las skyes pa'i phyir yid las byung ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ni yid las skyes pa'i phyir yid las byung ba zhes bya ste /
translated: They are called “those born of mind” because they are born from mind alone.

original: khu ba dang khrag la sogs pas ni cung zad kyang rgyur byas pa med do //
analyzed: khu ba dang khrag la sogs pas ni cung zad kyang rgyur byas pa med do //
translated: They are not born from semen, blood, etc.

original: srid pa tshol ba'i ngang tshul can yin pa'i phyir srid pa tshol ba'o //🔽dri za ba'i phyir dri za'o //
analyzed: srid pa tshol ba'i ngang tshul can yin pa'i phyir srid pa tshol ba'o //🔽dri za ba'i phyir dri za'o //
translated: They are called “those seeking existence” because they are intent on seeking existence.🔽They are called “those who smell” because they are born by smelling the odors of the semen and blood of their future parents.

original: skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir mngon par 'grub pa ste /
analyzed: skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir mngon par 'grub pa ste /
translated: It is the establishment of birth because it is directed toward birth.🔽A sutra states:

original: mdo las gnod pa dang bcas pa'i lus mngon par 'grub bo //🔽gnod pa dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten skye'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ba dang / gzhan yang mdo las gang gis mngon par 'grub pa'i kun du sbyor ba ni spangs la /
analyzed: mdo las gnod pa dang bcas pa'i lus mngon par 'grub bo // gnod pa dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten skye'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ba dang / gzhan yang mdo las gang gis mngon par 'grub pa'i kun du sbyor ba ni spangs la /
translated: The body with harm is established.🔽The world with harm is born.🔽And a sutra declares:

original: skye ba'i kun tu sbyor ba ni ma yin pa'i gang zag kyang yod de zhes bya ba mu bzhir gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba'i kun tu sbyor ba ni ma yin pa'i gang zag kyang yod de zhes bya ba mu bzhir gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There are four possibilities: that which abandons the fetter that establishes but not the fetter of birth and so on.

original: yang zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos thams cad kyang /
analyzed: yang zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos thams cad kyang /
translated: Moreover, if all contaminated phenomena

original: srid pa rnams gso bar byed pa yin na /
analyzed: srid pa rnams gso bar byed pa yin na /
translated: are the sustenance of existence,

original: ci'i phyir 'ba' zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'ba' zhig yin zhe na /
translated: why is only this called sustenance?

original: gal te yang de lta mod kyi 'on kyang gtso bo las bshad do //🔽'di la gnas dang / gnas pa'i don du gnyis yin no //
analyzed: gal te yang de lta mod kyi 'on kyang gtso bo las bshad do // 'di la gnas dang / gnas pa'i don du gnyis yin no //
translated: Even though that is so, it is explained as the primary one.🔽Two are sustenance and the object of sustenance.

original: gnyis ni srid pa gzhan 'phel dang // grub pa'i don de go rims bzhin //
analyzed: gnyis ni srid pa gzhan 'phel dang // grub pa'i don de go rims bzhin //
translated: Two increase other existences and establish existence.

original: gnas ni dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus so //
analyzed: gnas ni dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus so //
translated: The place is the body with its sense faculties.

original: de rgyas par byed pa ni kham gyi zas so //
analyzed: de rgyas par byed pa ni kham gyi zas so //
translated: The development of this is the material food.

original: gnas pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams te /
analyzed: gnas pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams te /
translated: The support is the mind and mental factors.

original: de dag rgyas par byed pa ni reg pa ste /
analyzed: de dag rgyas par byed pa ni reg pa ste /
translated: The development of this is contact.

original: re zhig 'di gnyis ni 'dir skyes pa'i srid pa gso ba la gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: re zhig 'di gnyis ni 'dir skyes pa'i srid pa gso ba la gtso bo yin no //
translated: These two are the principal factors in nourishing the existence that has been born.

original: yid la sems pa ni yang srid par 'phel bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: yid la sems pa ni yang srid par 'phel bar byed pa'o //
translated: Mental intention increases the existence that will be born.

original: 'phangs nas ni las kyis yongs su bskos pa'i rnam par shes pa'i sa bon las mngon par grub ste /
analyzed: 'phangs nas ni las kyis yongs su bskos pa'i rnam par shes pa'i sa bon las mngon par grub ste /
translated: After it has been projected, the existence that will be born is actualized from the seed of consciousness, which is determined by karma.

original: 'di gnyis ni ma skyes pa'i srid pa skyed pa la gtso bo yin te /
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni ma skyes pa'i srid pa skyed pa la gtso bo yin te /
translated: These two are the principal factors in producing the existence that has not yet arisen.

original: de'i phyir bzhir gsungs so //🔽snga ma gnyis ni gang skyes pa gso bar byed pa yin /🔽@145a * // pa'i phyir ma ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bzhir gsungs so // snga ma gnyis ni gang skyes pa gso bar byed pa yin / @145a * // pa'i phyir ma ma lta bu'o //
translated: Therefore, four nutriments are taught.🔽The first two are like a wet nurse, because they nourish what has been born.

original: phyi ma gnyis ni skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: phyi ma gnyis ni skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ma lta bu'o //
translated: The last two are like a mother, because they produce.

original: sems can rnams kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ji lta bu dang ji ltar gnas pa dang / 'chi 'pho ba yang bshad zin to //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ji lta bu dang ji ltar gnas pa dang / 'chi 'pho ba yang bshad zin to //
translated: The dependent origination of sentient beings, as it is and as it occurs, and their death and rebirth have been explained.🔽Now, in which consciousness do death and rebirth occur?🔽It should be said that death and rebirth occur in the mental consciousness.🔽The six states of the mental consciousness are:🔽the severance of the roots of virtue, the linking of the roots of virtue,🔽the detachment from the realms and stages,🔽retrogression, death and rebirth.🔽These six states are said to occur in the mental consciousness alone, not in the other consciousnesses.🔽The word “rebirth” should be understood to refer to the linking of consciousness in the intermediate existence.

original: da ni sems gang la gnas te /
analyzed: da ni sems gang la gnas te /
translated: The six states of the mental consciousness are:🔽the severance of the roots of virtue, the linking of the roots of virtue,🔽the detachment from the realms and stages,🔽retrogression, death and rebirth.🔽These six states are said to occur in the mental consciousness alone, not in the other consciousnesses.

original: 'chi ba dang skye ba brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'chi ba dang skye ba brjod par bya ste /
translated: The word “rebirth” should be understood to refer to the linking of consciousness in the intermediate existence.🔽The six states of the mental consciousness are:🔽the severance of the roots of virtue, the linking of the roots of virtue,

original: smras pa / tshad dang mtshams sbyor 'dod chags bral //
analyzed: smras pa / tshad dang mtshams sbyor 'dod chags bral //
translated: the detachment from the realms and stages,🔽retrogression, death and rebirth.🔽These six states are said to occur in the mental consciousness alone, not in the other consciousnesses.🔽The word “rebirth” should be understood to refer to the linking of consciousness in the intermediate existence.🔽The six states of the mental consciousness are:🔽the severance of the roots of virtue, the linking of the roots of virtue,🔽the detachment from the realms and stages,

original: nyams dang 'chi 'pho skye ba la //
analyzed: nyams dang 'chi 'pho skye ba la //
translated: retrogression, death and rebirth.

original: yid kyi rnam shes nyid du 'dod //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam shes nyid du 'dod //
translated: These six states are said to occur in the mental consciousness alone, not in the other consciousnesses.🔽The word “rebirth” should be understood to refer to the linking of consciousness in the intermediate existence.🔽The six states of the mental consciousness are:🔽the severance of the roots of virtue, the linking of the roots of virtue,🔽the detachment from the realms and stages,🔽retrogression, death and rebirth.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par chad pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba nyid mtshams sbyor ba dang / khams dang sa la 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / yongs su nyams pa dang / 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba dang / chos 'di drug ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyid du 'dod kyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par chad pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba nyid mtshams sbyor ba dang / khams dang sa la 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / yongs su nyams pa dang / 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba dang / chos 'di drug ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyid du 'dod kyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: These six states are said to occur in the mental consciousness alone, not in the other consciousnesses.

original: skye ba'i tshig gis ni srid pa bar mar nying mtshams sbyor ba yang bshad pa'i ngo bor rig par bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i tshig gis ni srid pa bar mar nying mtshams sbyor ba yang bshad pa'i ngo bor rig par bya'o //
translated: The word “rebirth” should be understood to refer to the linking of consciousness in the intermediate existence.

original: tshor ba ni /
analyzed: tshor ba ni /
translated: The six states of the mental consciousness are:🔽the severance of the roots of virtue, the

original: 'chi 'pho skye ba btang snyoms so //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho skye ba btang snyoms so //
translated: Death and birth are neutral.

original: 'chi 'pho ba nyid pas na 'chi 'pho ba'o //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho ba nyid pas na 'chi 'pho ba'o //
translated: Death is the end of life.

original: skye bas na skye ba ste /
analyzed: skye bas na skye ba ste /
translated: Birth is the beginning of life.

original: de gnyis la ni bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pas tshor ba yin te /
analyzed: de gnyis la ni bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pas tshor ba yin te /
translated: These two are neutral, because they are not associated with pleasure or with displeasure.

original: de ni mi gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni mi gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not clear, because they are not distinct.

original: gzhan dag ni gsal ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni gsal ba ste /
translated: The other mental activities are clear,

original: rnam par shes pa gsal bas 'chi 'pho ba dang skye bar ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gsal bas 'chi 'pho ba dang skye bar ni mi rung ngo //
translated: because they are associated with the five sense consciousnesses. It is not possible for death or birth to occur in the state of composure that is a cessation, because that state is not associated with consciousness.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa de la yang /🔽rtse gcig sems la de gnyis min //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa de la yang / rtse gcig sems la de gnyis min //
translated: In the state of composure without conception,

original: 'chi 'pho dang ni skye ba zhes bya bar sbyar te /🔽skal ba mi mnyam pa'i phyir dang / mngon par 'du bya ba las byung ba yin pa'i phyir ba dang / phan 'dogs par byed pa yin pa'i phyir mnyam par gzhag pa ni 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba med do //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho dang ni skye ba zhes bya bar sbyar te / skal ba mi mnyam pa'i phyir dang / mngon par 'du bya ba las byung ba yin pa'i phyir ba dang / phan 'dogs par byed pa yin pa'i phyir mnyam par gzhag pa ni 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba med do //
translated: death and birth are not possible,

original: sems med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: sems med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: because the mind is not completely absent in these states,🔽because these states are not associated with the five sense consciousnesses,

original: sems med pa la ni gnod pa bya bar mi nus te /
analyzed: sems med pa la ni gnod pa bya bar mi nus te /
translated: and because these states are not associated with the mental consciousness.🔽The mental consciousness is not completely absent in these states, because the mental consciousness is the support for the arising of the five consciousnesses of the eye, etc.🔽If the mental consciousness were absent, the five consciousnesses would not be able to arise.🔽If the mental consciousness were absent, the five consciousnesses would not be able to arise.

original: gang gi tshe de'i lus yongs su 'jig par rtsom pa de ni tshe yang nges par lus dang 'brel ba'i sems mngon du gyur par byas nas phyis 'chi 'pho gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de'i lus yongs su 'jig par rtsom pa de ni tshe yang nges par lus dang 'brel ba'i sems mngon du gyur par byas nas phyis 'chi 'pho gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: When the body begins to disintegrate, the life force is definitely associated with the mind that is manifest.

original: skye ba la yang sems 'chad pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ba dang / nyon mongs pa med par mi skye ba'i phyir sems med pa la yang mi rigs so //
analyzed: skye ba la yang sems 'chad pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ba dang / nyon mongs pa med par mi skye ba'i phyir sems med pa la yang mi rigs so //
translated: It is not reasonable that the mind is absent at birth, because there is no cause for the mind to be interrupted and because one is not born without affliction.

original: 'chi ba'i srid pa rnam pa gsum du bshad pa la dgra bcom pa ni /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i srid pa rnam pa gsum du bshad pa la dgra bcom pa ni /
translated: The three types of death existence have been explained.

original: mya ngan 'da' lung bstan min gnyis //
analyzed: mya ngan 'da' lung bstan min gnyis //
translated: The two arhats who attain nirvana without exertion and those whose nature it is to pass into nirvana after exertion are not subject to retrogressing.

original: gal te 'dod pa'i khams dag na btang snyoms yod na ni spyod lam pa'am rnam par smin pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te 'dod pa'i khams dag na btang snyoms yod na ni spyod lam pa'am rnam par smin pa yin no //
translated: If equanimity exists in the desire realm, then it is either a karmic maturation or a demeanor.

original: gal te med na ni spyod lam 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: gal te med na ni spyod lam 'ba' zhig go //
translated: If it does not exist in the desire realm, then it is only a demeanor.

original: de'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa 'ba' zhig @145b yin gyi gzhan ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa 'ba' zhig @145b yin gyi gzhan ma yin zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is only neutral and not otherwise.

original: de ni sems 'chad pa'i rjes su mthun pa dang nyam chung pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni sems 'chad pa'i rjes su mthun pa dang nyam chung pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is compatible with the interruption of the mind and because it is weak.

original: yang 'chi ba na lus kyi phyogs gang du rnam par shes pa 'gag ce na /🔽cig car du 'chi ba la ni lus kyi dbang po ril gyis cig car du nub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang 'chi ba na lus kyi phyogs gang du rnam par shes pa 'gag ce na / cig car du 'chi ba la ni lus kyi dbang po ril gyis cig car du nub par 'gyur ro //
translated: When dying, in what part of the body does consciousness disappear?🔽When dying suddenly, consciousness disappears from the entire body at once.

original: gal te rim gyis 'chi 'pho na ni /
analyzed: gal te rim gyis 'chi 'pho na ni /
translated: But when dying gradually,🔽those who go to lower realms,🔽those who go to the human realm,

original: de'i tshe / 'og ma'i lhar 'gro mi skye rnams //
analyzed: de'i tshe / 'og ma'i lhar 'gro mi skye rnams //
translated: and those who go to the god realm

original: rim gyis 'chi la rkang pa dang // lte ba snying gar yid 'chi 'pho //🔽'og tu 'gro bas na 'og tu 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: rim gyis 'chi la rkang pa dang // lte ba snying gar yid 'chi 'pho // 'og tu 'gro bas na 'og tu 'gro ba ste /
translated: die and transmigrate in stages.

original: ngan song du 'gro ba rnams so //🔽mi'i nang du 'gro bas na mi'i nang du 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: ngan song du 'gro ba rnams so // mi'i nang du 'gro bas na mi'i nang du 'gro ba ste /
translated: Those who go to lower realms are those who go to the lower realms.

original: mir 'gro ba rnams so //🔽lha'i nang du 'gro bas na lhar 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: mir 'gro ba rnams so // lha'i nang du 'gro bas na lhar 'gro ba ste /
translated: Those who go to the human realm are those who go to the human realm.

original: lhar 'gro ba rnams so //
analyzed: lhar 'gro ba rnams so //
translated: Those who go to the god realm are those who go to the god realm.

original: de dag ni grangs bzhin du rnam par shes pa rkang pa dang / lte ba dang snying gar 'gag go //🔽yang mi skye bas na mi skye ba ste /
analyzed: de dag ni grangs bzhin du rnam par shes pa rkang pa dang / lte ba dang snying gar 'gag go // yang mi skye bas na mi skye ba ste /
translated: In those three, consciousness disappears in stages from the feet, the navel, and the heart, respectively.

original: dgra bcom pa'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'o //
translated: Those who do not take rebirth are arhats.

original: de dag gi rnam par shes pa yang snying gar 'gag go //
analyzed: de dag gi rnam par shes pa yang snying gar 'gag go //
translated: The consciousnesses of these sense faculties cease in the heart.

original: gzhan dag na re spyi bor ro zhes zer te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re spyi bor ro zhes zer te /
translated: Others say that they cease in the head.

original: de dag tu lus kyi rnam par shes pa 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag tu lus kyi rnam par shes pa 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the body sense faculty ceases at these places.

original: lus kyi rnam par shes pa ni 'chi ba'i tshe rde leb bsregs pa'i thog tu chus btab pa bzhin du zhi bar gyur nas rkang pa la sogs pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par shes pa ni 'chi ba'i tshe rde leb bsregs pa'i thog tu chus btab pa bzhin du zhi bar gyur nas rkang pa la sogs pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The body sense faculty ceases at the time of death, like water poured into sand.

original: sems can rnams de ltar rim gyis 'chi ba na phal cher gnad 'chad pas nyen pa'i tshor ba skye ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams de ltar rim gyis 'chi ba na phal cher gnad 'chad pas nyen pa'i tshor ba skye ste /
translated: When sentient beings die in this way, they experience the sensation of being struck at the vital parts.

original: chu la sogs pas gnad gcod do //
analyzed: chu la sogs pas gnad gcod do //
translated: The vital parts are struck by water, etc.

original: lus kyi phyogs 'ga' zhig nyams na 'chi bar 'gyur ba de ni gnad ces bya ste /
analyzed: lus kyi phyogs 'ga' zhig nyams na 'chi bar 'gyur ba de ni gnad ces bya ste /
translated: The vital parts are places in the body where if damaged one dies.

original: de yang chu dang me dang rlung gi khams rnams las gang yang rung ba zhig drag tu 'khrugs par gyur pa mtshon cha bdar bas btab ste /
analyzed: de yang chu dang me dang rlung gi khams rnams las gang yang rung ba zhig drag tu 'khrugs par gyur pa mtshon cha bdar bas btab ste /
translated: The vital parts are struck by the violent agitation of the wind, fire, and water elements, as if struck by a sharp weapon.

original: reg pa bzhin du mi bzad pa'i tshor bas gcod kyi de dag shing gcad pa bzhin du ni ma yin pa'am chad pa bzhin du sems med pas na 'chad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: reg pa bzhin du mi bzad pa'i tshor bas gcod kyi de dag shing gcad pa bzhin du ni ma yin pa'am chad pa bzhin du sems med pas na 'chad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are cut by unbearable sensations, like being touched by fire, not like being cut by a saw, or like being cut by a sword.

original: ci'i phyir sa'i khams kyis ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sa'i khams kyis ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not the earth element?

original: skyon bzhi pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: skyon bzhi pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the fourth fault does not exist.

original: rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan gsum ni skyon yin la /
analyzed: rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan gsum ni skyon yin la /
translated: The three faults are wind, bile, and phlegm.

original: de dag gi gtso bo ni ci rigs par chu dang me dang rlung gi khams gang yin pa'am /
analyzed: de dag gi gtso bo ni ci rigs par chu dang me dang rlung gi khams gang yin pa'am /
translated: The principal ones are the water, fire, and wind elements, respectively.

original: snod kyi 'jig rten 'jig pa'i chos dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten 'jig pa'i chos dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, because the world of the environment is similar to the world of sentient beings in terms of destruction.

original: sems can gyi 'jig rten 'di de ltar skye ba dang / gnas pa dang 'chi 'pho ba na bcom ldan 'das kyis phung po gsum du rnam par gzhag ste /🔽phung po gsum ni yang dag pa nyid du nges pa'i phung po dang / log @146a * //
analyzed: sems can gyi 'jig rten 'di de ltar skye ba dang / gnas pa dang 'chi 'pho ba na bcom ldan 'das kyis phung po gsum du rnam par gzhag ste / phung po gsum ni yang dag pa nyid du nges pa'i phung po dang / log @146a * //
translated: When this world of sentient beings is thus born, abides, and dies, the Lord has established it in three groups.

original: ba nyid du nges pa'i phung po dang / ma nges pa'i phung po'o //
analyzed: ba nyid du nges pa'i phung po dang / ma nges pa'i phung po'o //
translated: The three groups are the group of those who are definitely on the right path, the group of those who are definitely on the wrong path, and the group of those who are not definitely on either path.

original: de la / 'phags dang mtshams med byed pa rnams //
analyzed: de la / 'phags dang mtshams med byed pa rnams //
translated: Those who are noble and those who commit the actions with immediate result

original: yang dag log pa nyid du nges //
analyzed: yang dag log pa nyid du nges //
translated: are ascertained as being in error and in truth.

original: yang dag pa nyid gang zhe na //
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid gang zhe na //
translated: What is truth?

original: gang 'dod chags gtan nas spong ba dang / zhe sdang gtan nas spong ba dang / gti mug gtan nas spong ba dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad gtan nas spong ba 'di ni yang dag pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang 'dod chags gtan nas spong ba dang / zhe sdang gtan nas spong ba dang / gti mug gtan nas spong ba dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad gtan nas spong ba 'di ni yang dag pa nyid do //
translated: The complete abandonment of desire, the complete abandonment of hatred, the complete abandonment of delusion, the complete abandonment of all afflictions is truth.

original: 'phags pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'phags pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is noble?

original: gang dag zag pa med pa'i lam skyes pa dang / sdig pa'i chos las ring du song ba de ni 'phags pa ste /
analyzed: gang dag zag pa med pa'i lam skyes pa dang / sdig pa'i chos las ring du song ba de ni 'phags pa ste /
translated: Those who have generated the uncontaminated path and have gone far from evil dharmas are noble,

original: gtan du bral ba'i thob pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan du bral ba'i thob pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they possess the obtainment of complete separation.

original: de dag ni nyon mongs pa zad par nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni nyon mongs pa zad par nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are noble because they are definitely destined to exhaust the afflictions.

original: da ni snod kyi 'jig rten gyi //
analyzed: da ni snod kyi 'jig rten gyi //
translated: Now, the abode of the world of the vessel

original: gnas par 'dod pa'i 'og dag gi / rlung gi dkyil 'khor rngams su ni //
analyzed: gnas par 'dod pa'i 'og dag gi / rlung gi dkyil 'khor rngams su ni //
translated: is the wind maṇḍala below,

original: sa ya drug 'bum grangs med do //
analyzed: sa ya drug 'bum grangs med do //
translated: which is immeasurable, with a height of 640,000 yojanas.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams ni 'di ltar gnas par 'dod de /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams ni 'di ltar gnas par 'dod de /
translated: The world systems of the great trichiliocosm are as follows:

original: 'di lta ste sems can rnams kyi las kyi dbang gis 'og nam mkha' la brten pa rlung gi dkyil 'khor mngon par 'grub ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste sems can rnams kyi las kyi dbang gis 'og nam mkha' la brten pa rlung gi dkyil 'khor mngon par 'grub ste /
translated: The wind maṇḍala arises first, in the space below, through the power of the karma of sentient beings.

original: de'i rngams su ni dpag tshad sa ya 'bum phrag drug go //
analyzed: de'i rngams su ni dpag tshad sa ya 'bum phrag drug go //
translated: It is 1,600,000 yojanas high.

original: rgyar ni grangs med de /
analyzed: rgyar ni grangs med de /
translated: It is immeasurable in width.

original: 'di ltar tshan po che chen po'i rdo rjes kyang gzhig bar mi nus par sra'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar tshan po che chen po'i rdo rjes kyang gzhig bar mi nus par sra'o //
translated: It is said that even a great vajra of a great hero cannot destroy it.

original: de'i steng na /
analyzed: de'i steng na /
translated: Above that,

original: chu ste / rngams ni bcu gcig dang / stong phrag dag ni nyi shu'o //
analyzed: chu ste / rngams ni bcu gcig dang / stong phrag dag ni nyi shu'o //
translated: there is water: 11,000 yojanas high.

original: dkyil 'khor zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The maṇḍala is immeasurable in width.

original: sems can rnams kyi las kyi rlung gi dkyil 'khor der sprin rnams 'dus nas char gyi rgyun gnya' shing tsam bab pa de chu'i dkyil 'khor du 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi las kyi rlung gi dkyil 'khor der sprin rnams 'dus nas char gyi rgyun gnya' shing tsam bab pa de chu'i dkyil 'khor du 'gyur te /
translated: Clouds gather on the wind maṇḍala through the karma of sentient beings and rain falls in a stream the size of a yoke. That becomes the water maṇḍala.

original: de'i rngams su ni dpag tshad 'bum phrag gcig dang nyi khri'o //
analyzed: de'i rngams su ni dpag tshad 'bum phrag gcig dang nyi khri'o //
translated: It is 110,000 yojanas high.

original: yang sems can rnams kyi las kyi mthu las byung ba'i rlung gis chu de kun dkrugs pa na 'o ma bskol ba'i spris ma chags pa'i tshul du steng ma gser du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang sems can rnams kyi las kyi mthu las byung ba'i rlung gis chu de kun dkrugs pa na 'o ma bskol ba'i spris ma chags pa'i tshul du steng ma gser du 'gyur ro //
translated: The water of the ocean is churned by the force of the wind, and the cream which forms on the surface becomes gold.

original: chu'i dkyil 'khor de ni /
analyzed: chu'i dkyil 'khor de ni /
translated: The circle of water

original: phyis ni rngams su 'bum phrag brgyad //
analyzed: phyis ni rngams su 'bum phrag brgyad //
translated: is 80,000 leagues thick;

original: lhag ma dag ni gser du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhag ma dag ni gser du 'gyur ro //
translated: the rest is gold.

original: lhag ma gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: lhag ma gang zhig ce na /
translated: What is the rest?

original: chu'i steng du dpag tshad 'bum phrag gsum dang nyi khri gser gyis gzhir gyur to //
analyzed: chu'i steng du dpag tshad 'bum phrag gsum dang nyi khri gser gyis gzhir gyur to //
translated: The circle of water is 320,000 leagues thick; the rest, which is 80,000 leagues thick, is gold.

original: chu dang rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi tshad bshad zin to //
analyzed: chu dang rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi tshad bshad zin to //
translated: We have explained the dimensions of the circle of water and the circle of wind.

original: chu dang gser gyi dkyil 'khor gyi //🔽thad kar 'bum phrag bcu gnyis dang // stong phrag gsum dang brgya phrag ni //
analyzed: chu dang gser gyi dkyil 'khor gyi // thad kar 'bum phrag bcu gnyis dang // stong phrag gsum dang brgya phrag ni //
translated: The circle of water and the circle of gold

original: phyed dang lda rnams kho na'o //
analyzed: phyed dang lda rnams kho na'o //
translated: are 1,203,450 leagues thick.

original: 'di gnyis ka'i rgyar ni @146b mnyam mo //🔽khor yug tu ni sum 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di gnyis ka'i rgyar ni @146b mnyam mo // khor yug tu ni sum 'gyur ro //
translated: The circle of water and the circle of gold have the same dimensions.🔽The circle of wind is 1,600,000 leagues thick.

original: kho ra khor yug tu ni brtsi na ni sum 'gyur du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kho ra khor yug tu ni brtsi na ni sum 'gyur du 'gyur ro //
translated: The circle of wind is 1,600,000 leagues thick.

original: dpag tshad sa yang phrag gsum dang // 'bum phrag drug dang khri sum brgya lnga bcu'o //
analyzed: dpag tshad sa yang phrag gsum dang // 'bum phrag drug dang khri sum brgya lnga bcu'o //
translated: The distance from the water circle to the golden circle is 1,350,000 yojanas.

original: gang yang gser gyis gzhi'i dkyil 'khor de'i steng du ni //
analyzed: gang yang gser gyis gzhi'i dkyil 'khor de'i steng du ni //
translated: The circle of earth rests on the circle of water.

original: de la ri rab gnya' shing 'dzin //
analyzed: de la ri rab gnya' shing 'dzin //
translated: The mountains are on the circle of earth.🔽Meru is in the center.🔽Yugandhara is east of Meru.

original: gshol mda' 'dzin dang seng ldeng can //
analyzed: gshol mda' 'dzin dang seng ldeng can //
translated: Īṣādhara is east of that.🔽Then, in the same way, is Khadiraka,🔽Then, in the same way, is Sudarśana,

original: de bzhin blta na sdug pa dang // rta rna dang ni rnam 'dud dang // mu khyud 'dzin ri'o //
analyzed: de bzhin blta na sdug pa dang // rta rna dang ni rnam 'dud dang // mu khyud 'dzin ri'o //
translated: Aśvakarṇa, Vinataka,🔽and Nimindhara.

original: ri chen po brgyad po 'di dag ni ri rab ni dbus na'o //🔽lhag ma rnams ni ri rab bskor te gnas pa'o //
analyzed: ri chen po brgyad po 'di dag ni ri rab ni dbus na'o // lhag ma rnams ni ri rab bskor te gnas pa'o //
translated: These eight great mountains surround Meru.🔽The remaining seven are arranged in a circle around Meru.

original: de la ri bdun gyi rabs yongs su bskor ba'i tha ma gang yin pa de ni mu khyud 'dzin to //
analyzed: de la ri bdun gyi rabs yongs su bskor ba'i tha ma gang yin pa de ni mu khyud 'dzin to //
translated: The last of the seven mountain ranges surrounding Meru is Nimindhara.

original: de'i phyi rol gyi gling ste /
analyzed: de'i phyi rol gyi gling ste /
translated: Beyond that is the outer ocean,

original: de'i phyi rol na ni gling bzhi'o //🔽de dag gi yang /
analyzed: de'i phyi rol na ni gling bzhi'o // de dag gi yang /
translated: and beyond that are the four continents.

original: phyi rol na ni 'khor yug ste /
analyzed: phyi rol na ni 'khor yug ste /
translated: Beyond that is the outer ring of mountains.

original: des gling bzhi khor yug tu ni bskor ro //🔽de dag las kyang /
analyzed: des gling bzhi khor yug tu ni bskor ro // de dag las kyang /
translated: It encircles the four continents.🔽The seven mountains are gold.

original: bdun ni gser yin te lcags so //
analyzed: bdun ni gser yin te lcags so //
translated: The last is iron.

original: de gnya' shing 'dzin la sogs pa ri bdun ni gser gyi rgyu las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de gnya' shing 'dzin la sogs pa ri bdun ni gser gyi rgyu las byung ba'o //
translated: The seven mountains, Yugandhara and so on, are made of gold.

original: khor yug ni lcags kyi rgyu las byung ba'o //
analyzed: khor yug ni lcags kyi rgyu las byung ba'o //
translated: Cakravada is made of iron.

original: ri rab rin chen bzhi yi rgyu //🔽gser gyi rgyu dang dngul gyi rgyu dang bee d'urya'i rgyu dang shel gyi rgyu ste /
analyzed: ri rab rin chen bzhi yi rgyu // gser gyi rgyu dang dngul gyi rgyu dang bee d'urya'i rgyu dang shel gyi rgyu ste /
translated: Meru is made of four jewels.

original: ngos bzhi dag tu gangs ri bzhin no //🔽ri rab la sogs pa nas 'khor yug la thug pa'i bar de dag kyang stong phrag brgyad cu chu'i nang du nub ste /
analyzed: ngos bzhi dag tu gangs ri bzhin no // ri rab la sogs pa nas 'khor yug la thug pa'i bar de dag kyang stong phrag brgyad cu chu'i nang du nub ste /
translated: Meru is made of four jewels: gold, silver, lapis lazuli and crystal, respectively, on the south, west, north and east sides.🔽The other mountains are similar to Meru.

original: de dag kyang gser gyis gzhi'i steng nas dpag tshad brgyad khri chu'i nang du nub bo //
analyzed: de dag kyang gser gyis gzhi'i steng nas dpag tshad brgyad khri chu'i nang du nub bo //
translated: The mountains, from Meru to Nimindhara, are immersed in the water to a depth of twenty-four thousand leagues and project out of the water for twenty-four thousand leagues.

original: chu'i steng du yang /
analyzed: chu'i steng du yang /
translated: The mountains rest on the golden ground.

original: dpag tshad dag ni brgyad khri'o //
analyzed: dpag tshad dag ni brgyad khri'o //
translated: The mountains rest on the golden ground to a depth of eighty thousand leagues.🔽The mountains rest on the golden ground to a depth of eighty thousand leagues.

original: de ltar na ri rab ni 'phang du dpag tshad brgyad khri'o //
analyzed: de ltar na ri rab ni 'phang du dpag tshad brgyad khri'o //
translated: Thus Meru is eighty thousand leagues in height.

original: brgyad po'i 'phang du phyed phyed dbri //
analyzed: brgyad po'i 'phang du phyed phyed dbri //
translated: The other seven are progressively cut in half.

original: ri rab chu'i steng du ji cam 'phags pa de'i phyed ni gnya' shing 'dzin te /

analyzed: mu khyud 'dzin la thug gi bar du ri bdun po de dag gi bar ni rol mtsho bdun zhes bya ste /

analyzed: 'thungs na mgrin pa la mi gnod pa dang / 'thungs na lto ba la mi gnod pa'o //
translated: The water is cool, sweet, light, soft, clear, odorless, not harmful to the throat, and not harmful to the stomach.

original: yang de dag las /
analyzed: yang de dag las /
translated: Again, from those

analyzed: dang po stong phrag brgyad cu'o //

analyzed: ri rab dang gnya' shing 'dzin gyi bar gyi rol mtsho dang po ni kha tshon du dpag tshang brgyad khri'o //

analyzed: lhag ma ni phyi'i rgya mtsho'o //

analyzed: smras pa / de'i bar gyi gling brgyad dag ni /

analyzed: rnga yab dang ni rnga yab gzhan ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi ste /

analyzed: thams cad na yang mi rnams gnas so // 'di nas byang na ri nag po //

analyzed: gnam 'phang dang chu zhing gi tshad dang / de bzhin du 'og gi gzhi dang dpag tshad nyi khri ste /

analyzed: 'di nas ni dpag chad bzhi khrir 'gyur ro //

analyzed: sdug bsngal bar chad med pa'i phyir mnar med pa'o //

analyzed: gzhan dag ni sdug bsngal bar chad dang bcas pa ste ;

analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: yang sos na ni bcad cing phug la btags kyang rung /

analyzed: brgyad po kun la'ang lhag bcu drug / bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang de ltar dmyal bde brgyad du /

analyzed: bshar pa las ni rgal bar dka' //🔽drug po'i las kyis gang du gang //

original: re re la yang lhag bcu drug / ces gsungs pa la /
analyzed: re re la yang lhag bcu drug / ces gsungs pa la /

analyzed: lhag pa bcu drug gang zhe na //

original: de dag gi ni ngos bzhin //
analyzed: de dag gi ni ngos bzhin //

analyzed: me ma mur dang ro myags dang // spu gri'i lam sogs chu bo'o //

analyzed: de dag gi ngos bzhi bzhi sgo sgo na lhag pa bzhi ste /

translated: The first is filled with knee-deep burning coals, the second with a swamp of excrement, the third with trees with leaves like razors, and the fourth with iron-leaved trees.

analyzed: spu gri'i lam la sogs pa mtshon cha mngon par 'bab ste gsum ni spyir brtsis pa gcig tu bya'o //

analyzed: lhag pa bzhi bo ni chu bo rab med de thal chus gang ba'o //

original: des kyang dmyal ba chen po'o bas bzhin du bskor to //
analyzed: des kyang dmyal ba chen po'o bas bzhin du bskor to //

analyzed: lhag pa bzhi po 'di dag ni phyogs kyi dbye bas bcu drug ces bya'o //
translated: These four additional hells are called the sixteen hells by way of their directional location.

analyzed: dmyal bdag gi 'chi ba'i 'og tu yang 'di dag tu 'bying bas na lhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or, they are called special hells because one sinks into them after dying in the hells.

original: re zhig de dag ni tsha pa'i dmyal ba chen po yin no //🔽chu bur can sogs grang brgyad gzhan //
analyzed: re zhig de dag ni tsha pa'i dmyal ba chen po yin no // chu bur can sogs grang brgyad gzhan //
translated: These are the great hot hells.🔽The eight cold hells are different.

original: gzhan na grang ba'i sems can dmyal ba brgyad la 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan na grang ba'i sems can dmyal ba brgyad la 'di lta ste /
translated: The eight cold hells are different from the hot hells.

original: chu bur can @148b dang / chu bur rdol ba dang / so thams thams dang / aa chu zer ba dang / kyi hud zer ba dang / autpal ltar gas pa dang / padma ltar gas pa chen po ste /🔽sems can de dag ni grang ba mi bzod pas nyen te /
analyzed: chu bur can @148b dang / chu bur rdol ba dang / so thams thams dang / aa chu zer ba dang / kyi hud zer ba dang / autpal ltar gas pa dang / padma ltar gas pa chen po ste / sems can de dag ni grang ba mi bzod pas nyen te /
translated: They are called Arbuda, Nirarbuda, Aṭaṭa, Hahava, Huhuva, Utpala, Padma, and Mahāpadma.🔽The beings there are tormented by the cold and their bodies and voices change in the following ways.

original: lus dang sgrar 'gyur ba dang mthun par ming de dag tu btags pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang sgrar 'gyur ba dang mthun par ming de dag tu btags pa'o //
translated: They are called by names that correspond to these changes.

original: de dag kyang 'dzam bu gling 'di nyid kyi 'og sems can dmyal ba chen po rnams kyi drang thad na gnas te /
analyzed: de dag kyang 'dzam bu gling 'di nyid kyi 'og sems can dmyal ba chen po rnams kyi drang thad na gnas te /
translated: These hells are located directly below Jambudvīpa, at the same distance from the ground as the highest heaven of the fourth meditation.

original: sems can dmyal ba bcu drug po 'di dag thams cad kyang sems can thams cad kyi las kyi dbang gis 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba bcu drug po 'di dag thams cad kyang sems can thams cad kyi las kyi dbang gis 'byung ngo //
translated: The sixteen hells are created by the collective actions of sentient beings.

original: dud 'gro'i spyod yul ni skam dang chu dang nam mkha'o //
analyzed: dud 'gro'i spyod yul ni skam dang chu dang nam mkha'o //
translated: The animal world is in the water, on the earth, and in the air.

original: yi dags ni dud 'gro dang mi dang lha'i sha tshugs te /
analyzed: yi dags ni dud 'gro dang mi dang lha'i sha tshugs te /
translated: The world of the hungry ghosts is similar to the human body.

original: longs spyod med pa dang / longs spyod chung ba dang / longs spyod che ba rnams yin no //
analyzed: longs spyod med pa dang / longs spyod chung ba dang / longs spyod che ba rnams yin no //
translated: There are three types of hungry ghosts: those who are obstructed with regard to food and drink, those who are obstructed with regard to eating, and those who are obstructed with regard to drinking.

original: gang nyi ma dang zla ba 'di gnyis ci la gnas she na /
analyzed: gang nyi ma dang zla ba 'di gnyis ci la gnas she na /
translated: On what do the sun and moon rest?

original: rlung la ste sems can thams cad las kyi dbang gis 'byung ba'i rlung gling bzhi ri rab yongs su 'khor zhing nyi ma dang zla ba dang skar ma rnams 'phul lo //
analyzed: rlung la ste sems can thams cad las kyi dbang gis 'byung ba'i rlung gling bzhi ri rab yongs su 'khor zhing nyi ma dang zla ba dang skar ma rnams 'phul lo //
translated: They rest on the wind, on a wind circle which is the work of sentient beings. This wind circle is the wheel which holds the sun and moon and the stars, and which moves around Meru and the four continents.

original: nyi ma dang zla ba 'di gnyis 'di nas thag rdi srid ce na /
analyzed: nyi ma dang zla ba 'di gnyis 'di nas thag rdi srid ce na /
translated: What is the distance from here to the moon and the sun?

original: ri rab phyed na nyi zla ste /
analyzed: ri rab phyed na nyi zla ste /
translated: The sun and moon are half of Meru.

original: gnya' shing 'dzin gyi rtse mo nas rgyu'o //
analyzed: gnya' shing 'dzin gyi rtse mo nas rgyu'o //
translated: They move above Yugandhara.

original: tshad ji tsam zhe na /
analyzed: tshad ji tsam zhe na /
translated: What is their size?

original: dpag tshad lnga bcu dang gcig bcas //
analyzed: dpag tshad lnga bcu dang gcig bcas //
translated: Fifty and one yojanas.

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi tshad ni dpag tshad lnga bcu'o //
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi tshad ni dpag tshad lnga bcu'o //
translated: The moon disk is fifty yojanas in size.

original: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi ni gcig dang bcas pa'i lnga bcu ste /
analyzed: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi ni gcig dang bcas pa'i lnga bcu ste /
translated: The sun disk is fifty yojanas, with one yojana added.

original: lnga bcu rtsa gcig ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lnga bcu rtsa gcig ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the expression ekottarika is: one plus fifty.

original: ci gling bzhi po dag tu nyi mas cig car du bya ba byed dam zhe na /🔽smras pa / ma yin te /
analyzed: ci gling bzhi po dag tu nyi mas cig car du bya ba byed dam zhe na / smras pa / ma yin te /
translated: Do the sun and moon perform their functions simultaneously in the four continents?🔽No, they do not.

original: 'di ltar de dag tu /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag tu /
translated: In fact,🔽at the time when it is midnight in Kuru in the north,

original: nam phyed nyi ma nub pa dang // nyi ma phyed dang 'char dus gcig / gang gi tshe byang gi sgra mi snyan du nam phyed pa de'i tshe shar gyi lus 'phags su nyi ma nub bo //
analyzed: nam phyed nyi ma nub pa dang // nyi ma phyed dang 'char dus gcig / gang gi tshe byang gi sgra mi snyan du nam phyed pa de'i tshe shar gyi lus 'phags su nyi ma nub bo //
translated: it is sunset in Videha in the east,

original: 'dzam bu'i gling du nyi ma phyed do //
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling du nyi ma phyed do //
translated: midday in Jambudvīpa,

original: ba lang spyod du ni nyi ma 'char te /🔽de bzhin du /
analyzed: ba lang spyod du ni nyi ma 'char te / de bzhin du /
translated: and sunrise in Godānīya in the west.

original: gzhan dag la yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang sbyar ro //
translated: The same for the other continents.

original: nyin mo dang mtshan mo ni nyi ma'i 'gros kyis ring thung du 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyin mo dang mtshan mo ni nyi ma'i 'gros kyis ring thung du 'gyur te /
translated: The days and nights become longer and shorter through the movement of the sun.

original: de la dbyar gyi zla ba gnyis pa yi //🔽tha ma'i che dgu nas mtshan ring //
analyzed: de la dbyar gyi zla ba gnyis pa yi // tha ma'i che dgu nas mtshan ring //
translated: From the ninth day of the last month of summer🔽the nights grow longer.

original: dbyar gyi zla ba gnyis pa dbyar zla ba tha chungs kyi yar ngo'i tshes dgu nas mtshan ring ngo //
analyzed: dbyar gyi zla ba gnyis pa dbyar zla ba tha chungs kyi yar ngo'i tshes dgu nas mtshan ring ngo //
translated: From the ninth day of the waxing phase of the last month of summer, the nights grow longer.

original: dgun rnams kyi ni bzhi pa la //
analyzed: dgun rnams kyi ni bzhi pa la //
translated: From the fourth month of winter

original: thung ngur 'gyur te /
analyzed: thung ngur 'gyur te /
translated: the days become shorter.

original: de nyid dgun gyi zla ba bzhi pa'i mar gyi tshes dgu nas thung dur 'gyur ro zhes bya ba sbyar te /🔽dgun zla tha @149a * //
analyzed: de nyid dgun gyi zla ba bzhi pa'i mar gyi tshes dgu nas thung dur 'gyur ro zhes bya ba sbyar te / dgun zla tha @149a * //
translated: From the ninth day of the waning phase of the fourth month of winter, the days become shorter.

original: chungs kyi yar ngo'i tshes nas so //🔽nyin mo zlog / gang gi tshe nam ring ba de'i tshe nyin mo thung ngo //
analyzed: chungs kyi yar ngo'i tshes nas so // nyin mo zlog / gang gi tshe nam ring ba de'i tshe nyin mo thung ngo //
translated: From the waxing phase of the last month of winter.🔽When the nights are long, the days are short.

original: gang gi tshe nam thung ba de'i tshe nyin mo ring ngo //
analyzed: gang gi tshe nam thung ba de'i tshe nyin mo ring ngo //
translated: When the nights are short, the days are long.

original: byang gi ngos su 'gro na nyin mo ring ngo //
analyzed: byang gi ngos su 'gro na nyin mo ring ngo //
translated: When the sun moves north, the days are long.

original: dang po zla ba nya ba nas 'grib pa snang ba de la rgyu ci yod ce na /
analyzed: dang po zla ba nya ba nas 'grib pa snang ba de la rgyu ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the cause of the appearance of the moon’s waxing and waning?

original: nyi ma dang zla ba nye pa las /🔽rang gi grib mas sgrib par snang gang gi tshe nyi ma'i gzhal med khang zla ba'i gzhal med khang dang nye bar rgyu bde'i tshe /
analyzed: nyi ma dang zla ba nye pa las / rang gi grib mas sgrib par snang gang gi tshe nyi ma'i gzhal med khang zla ba'i gzhal med khang dang nye bar rgyu bde'i tshe /
translated: The sun and moon are close to the earth.🔽When the sun's palace approaches the moon's palace,

original: nyi ma'i 'od kyis de'i gzhal med khang la 'bab ste /
analyzed: nyi ma'i 'od kyis de'i gzhal med khang la 'bab ste /
translated: the light of the sun falls on the moon's palace.

original: de'i phyir de'i ngos phyi rol du grib ma 'bab bas 'grib par snang ngo zhes btags pa las bstan to zhes grag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i ngos phyi rol du grib ma 'bab bas 'grib par snang ngo zhes btags pa las bstan to zhes grag go //
translated: Therefore, the side of the moon facing away from the sun is seen as dark.

original: gzhan dag na re rgyu ba'i tshul las res 'ga' de lta bur gzhal med khang gi phyed snang ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rgyu ba'i tshul las res 'ga' de lta bur gzhal med khang gi phyed snang ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: Sometimes the moon appears half because of the mode of movement.

original: nyi ma la sogs pa'i gzhal med khang 'di rnams ni rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha gzhal med khang na gnas pa rnams kyi gnas yin no //
analyzed: nyi ma la sogs pa'i gzhal med khang 'di rnams ni rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha gzhal med khang na gnas pa rnams kyi gnas yin no //
translated: The palaces of the sun and so on are the abodes of the gods of Caturmaharajika who abide in palaces.

original: sa la gnas pa rnams kyi ni ri rab kyi bang rim la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sa la gnas pa rnams kyi ni ri rab kyi bang rim la sogs pa'o //
translated: Those who abide on the earth are on the terraces of Meru and so on.

original: yang bang rim de dag ni du dag cig / bar cha ni ji srid cig ce na /
analyzed: yang bang rim de dag ni du dag cig / bar cha ni ji srid cig ce na /
translated: How many terraces are there and how far apart are they?

original: 'di la bang rim bzhi dag //
analyzed: 'di la bang rim bzhi dag //
translated: The terraces are four in number.

original: bar gyi thag ni stong phrag bcu //🔽gcig gi 'phang du ni dpag tshad khri yin no //
analyzed: bar gyi thag ni stong phrag bcu // gcig gi 'phang du ni dpag tshad khri yin no //
translated: The distance between them is ten thousand leagues.

original: bzhi pa'i bar du yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa'i bar du yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The first terrace is ten thousand leagues above the earth and so on up to the fourth terrace which is ten thousand leagues above the third.

original: de dag gis ni ri rab kyi phyed man chod du phyin to //🔽de dag kyang grangs bzhin du de las /🔽stong phrag dag ni bcu drug dang // brgyad dang bzhi dang gnyis 'phags so //
analyzed: de dag gis ni ri rab kyi phyed man chod du phyin to // de dag kyang grangs bzhin du de las / stong phrag dag ni bcu drug dang // brgyad dang bzhi dang gnyis 'phags so //
translated: The terraces extend out from Meru to a distance equal to half their height.🔽The distance from Meru to the edge of the terraces is thus 20,000 leagues for the first terrace, and so on up to the fourth terrace, the distance from Meru to the edge of which is 50,000 leagues.🔽The first three terraces are, in ascending order, 16,000, 8,000 and 4,000 leagues in width.

original: dang po dang gnyis pa dang gsum pa dang bzhi ba dang rim bzhin no //🔽de dag las lag na gzhong thogs dang // phreng ba 'dzin dang rtag myos dang // rgyal chen bzhi ba'i lha rnams so //🔽dang po dang gnyis pa dang gsum pa dang bzhi pa dag tu rim bzhin no //
analyzed: dang po dang gnyis pa dang gsum pa dang bzhi ba dang rim bzhin no // de dag las lag na gzhong thogs dang // phreng ba 'dzin dang rtag myos dang // rgyal chen bzhi ba'i lha rnams so // dang po dang gnyis pa dang gsum pa dang bzhi pa dag tu rim bzhin no //
translated: The fourth terrace is 2,000 leagues in width.🔽The first three terraces belong to the Caturmaharajakayikas.🔽The first three terraces are the abodes of the Caturmaharajakayikas.

original: rgyal chen bzhi pa'i lha zhes bya ba ni rgyal po chen po bzhi po dag bdag nyid so sor gnas pa de'i 'khor rnams te /
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi pa'i lha zhes bya ba ni rgyal po chen po bzhi po dag bdag nyid so sor gnas pa de'i 'khor rnams te /
translated: The first terrace belongs to the Caturmaharajakayikas themselves; the second and third terraces are divided among the Caturmaharajakayikas, the Trayastrimsas and the Yamas.

original: de'i phyir de dag tu rgyal chen bzhi pa'i lha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag tu rgyal chen bzhi pa'i lha zhes bya'o //
translated: That is why they are called the gods of the Heaven of the Four Great Kings.

original: ji ltar bang rim bzhi dag la rgyal chen bzhi ba'i lha rnams gnas pa bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar bang rim bzhi dag la rgyal chen bzhi ba'i lha rnams gnas pa bzhin du /
translated: Just as the gods of the Heaven of the Four Great Kings live on the four terraces,

original: ri ni bdun po dag la yang //🔽mu khyud 'dzin la sogs pa dag la'o //🔽de'i phyir lha'i ris de ni thams cad pas che'o //🔽ri rab rtsen sum cu gsum //
analyzed: ri ni bdun po dag la yang // mu khyud 'dzin la sogs pa dag la'o // de'i phyir lha'i ris de ni thams cad pas che'o // ri rab rtsen sum cu gsum //
translated: so too do the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-three live on Meru.

original: bang rim dang ri rab kyi tshad ji tsam zhe na /🔽de ni stong phrag nyi shu yin //
analyzed: bang rim dang ri rab kyi tshad ji tsam zhe na / de ni stong phrag nyi shu yin //
translated: The gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-three live on the summit of Meru, which is thirty-two thousand leagues high and wide.

original: phyogs bzhi ngos bzhi la ngos re re zhing yang dpag tshad nyi @149b khri ste /
analyzed: phyogs bzhi ngos bzhi la ngos re re zhing yang dpag tshad nyi @149b khri ste /
translated: The summit has four sides, each of which is eight thousand leagues.🔽The gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-three live on the summit of Meru.🔽The gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-three live on the summit of Meru, which is thirty-two thousand leagues high and wide.

original: khor ra khor yug tu ni brgyad khri'o //
analyzed: khor ra khor yug tu ni brgyad khri'o //
translated: The summit has four sides, each of which is eight thousand leagues.

original: phyogs mtshams brtsegs pa bzhi la ni //
analyzed: phyogs mtshams brtsegs pa bzhi la ni //
translated: On the four corners of the summit are the palaces of the four great kings of the quarters.

original: lag na rdo rje gnas /
analyzed: lag na rdo rje gnas /
translated: Vajrapāṇi lives on the summit of Meru.

original: ri rab kyi rtse mo ni phyogs mtshams kyi gra de dag las gang dag la gnod sbyin lag na rdo rje zhes bya ba gnas ba dpag tshad lnga brgya'i tshad tsam gyis brtseg spa bzhi gyen du 'phags so //
analyzed: ri rab kyi rtse mo ni phyogs mtshams kyi gra de dag las gang dag la gnod sbyin lag na rdo rje zhes bya ba gnas ba dpag tshad lnga brgya'i tshad tsam gyis brtseg spa bzhi gyen du 'phags so //
translated: In the center of the peak of Meru,

original: ri rab kyi rtse mo nyid kyi //🔽dbus na / ngos la nyis stong lnga bcu pa //🔽dpag tshad phyed dang gnyis pa yi //
analyzed: ri rab kyi rtse mo nyid kyi // dbus na / ngos la nyis stong lnga bcu pa // dpag tshad phyed dang gnyis pa yi //
translated: is the city of Sudarśana,🔽two thousand five hundred leagues in extent,

original: grong khyer blta na sdug ces pa //
analyzed: grong khyer blta na sdug ces pa //
translated: half a league in height,

original: gzhi bkra gser las byas mnyen pa //🔽ngos la nyis stong lnga brgya pa //
analyzed: gzhi bkra gser las byas mnyen pa // ngos la nyis stong lnga brgya pa //
translated: made of gold,🔽beautiful, and delightful.

original: zhes bya ba ni ngos re re zhing yang dpag tshad nyis stong lnga brgya yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ngos re re zhing yang dpag tshad nyis stong lnga brgya yin no //
translated: Each side is two thousand five hundred leagues.

original: dpag tshad phyed dang gnyis yin no zhes bya ba ni grong khyer de'i 'phang du dpag tshad phyed dang gnyis te de ni lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyi rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor yin no zhes grag go //
analyzed: dpag tshad phyed dang gnyis yin no zhes bya ba ni grong khyer de'i 'phang du dpag tshad phyed dang gnyis te de ni lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyi rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor yin no zhes grag go //
translated: It is half a league in height. This is the palace of Śakra, lord of the gods.

original: de na rnam par rgyal byed de //
analyzed: de na rnam par rgyal byed de //
translated: The Vaijayanta palace of Indra is located in the middle of the city.

original: ngos la nyis stong lnga bcu pa//
analyzed: ngos la nyis stong lnga bcu pa//
translated: It is two hundred and fifty yojanas on each side.

original: grong khyer gyi dbus na lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyi khang bzangs rnam par rgyal byed ces bya ba'i ngos ngos kyi srid du dpag tshad nyis brgya lnga bcu yod do //
analyzed: grong khyer gyi dbus na lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyi khang bzangs rnam par rgyal byed ces bya ba'i ngos ngos kyi srid du dpag tshad nyis brgya lnga bcu yod do //
translated: In the middle of the city is the palace of Śakra, lord of the gods, called Vaijayanta, two hundred and fifty yojanas on each side.

original: 'di ni re zhig nang gi gnas so //🔽de'i phyir shing rta sna tshogs dang // rtsub 'gyur 'dres pa dga' bas brgyan //
analyzed: 'di ni re zhig nang gi gnas so // de'i phyir shing rta sna tshogs dang // rtsub 'gyur 'dres pa dga' bas brgyan //
translated: This is the inner enclosure.

original: grong khyer de'i phyi rol na /
analyzed: grong khyer de'i phyi rol na /
translated: Outside of that, on the outside of the city,

original: ngos bzhi dag na lha rnams kyi rtsed mo'i gnas skyed mos tshal bzhi yod de /
analyzed: ngos bzhi dag na lha rnams kyi rtsed mo'i gnas skyed mos tshal bzhi yod de /
translated: are the four parks of the gods,

original: 'di lta ste skyed mos tshal shing rta sna tshogs can dang / rtsub 'gyur dang / 'dres pa dang / dga' ba'i tshal te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste skyed mos tshal shing rta sna tshogs can dang / rtsub 'gyur dang / 'dres pa dang / dga' ba'i tshal te /
translated: namely the Caitraratha, Pāruṣyaka, Miśraka, and Nandana parks.

original: de dag gis grong khyer de'i phyir rol brgyan to //
analyzed: de dag gis grong khyer de'i phyir rol brgyan to //
translated: These adorn the outside of the city.

original: nyi shus bcad pa'i ngos bzhin //
analyzed: nyi shus bcad pa'i ngos bzhin //
translated: On each side, twenty yojanas from the city,

original: sa gzhi bzang po gzhan yod de //
analyzed: sa gzhi bzang po gzhan yod de //
translated: there are other excellent lands.

original: skyed mos tshal de dag gi ngos bzhi dpag tshad nyi shus bcad pa na /
analyzed: skyed mos tshal de dag gi ngos bzhi dpag tshad nyi shus bcad pa na /
translated: Each of these pleasure groves is twenty yojanas in size.🔽

original: lha rnams kyi rtse ba'i gnas gzhi bzang po bzhi yod do //🔽grong khyer gyi phyi rol gyi ngos //
analyzed: lha rnams kyi rtse ba'i gnas gzhi bzang po bzhi yod do // grong khyer gyi phyi rol gyi ngos //
translated: On the four sides of these parks, at a distance of twenty leagues from the city, there are four fields, the fields of the gods.

original: byang shar mtshams na yongs 'du ste /
analyzed: byang shar mtshams na yongs 'du ste /
translated: Outside the city, in the northeast,🔽is Sudharmā,

original: grong khyer gyi byang shar phyogs mtshams na sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi 'dod pa'i dga' ba mchog gi gnas shing yongs 'dus brtol zhes bya ba yod de /
analyzed: grong khyer gyi byang shar phyogs mtshams na sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi 'dod pa'i dga' ba mchog gi gnas shing yongs 'dus brtol zhes bya ba yod de /
translated: Outside the city, in the northeast, there is the field of the Thirty-three gods called Sudharmā, the Good Law, where the gods go in order to speak about the affairs of the gods.

original: lho nub mtshams na chos bzang ngo //
analyzed: lho nub mtshams na chos bzang ngo //
translated: In the southwest is Vaijayanta,

original: lho nub kyi mtshams na gang du lha rnams 'khod na bya ba mi bya ba bgrod par byed pa'i lha'i 'dun sa chos bzang zhes bya ba yod do //🔽@150a * // re zhig sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams kyi snod kyi gnas pa ni de lta bu'o //
analyzed: lho nub kyi mtshams na gang du lha rnams 'khod na bya ba mi bya ba bgrod par byed pa'i lha'i 'dun sa chos bzang zhes bya ba yod do // @150a * // re zhig sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams kyi snod kyi gnas pa ni de lta bu'o //
translated: Outside the city, in the southwest, there is the field of the Thirty-three gods called Vaijayanta, the Victorious, where the Thirty-three gods go in order to enjoy the pleasures of games.🔽This is the receptacle of the Thirty-three gods.

original: de steng gzhal med khang gi lha //
analyzed: de steng gzhal med khang gi lha //
translated: The gods of the heaven of the Thirty-three gods live🔽in palaces.

original: 'thab bral dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed rnams dang / tshangs pa la gnas kyi bye brag bcu drug tu 'gro ba rnams te /🔽gang dag gi gnas mngon par ni mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: 'thab bral dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed rnams dang / tshangs pa la gnas kyi bye brag bcu drug tu 'gro ba rnams te / gang dag gi gnas mngon par ni mdor bsdu na /
